loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima B. is from the town of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old. Zosima is widowed and has two school-aged children. Zosima operates a specialized retail store where she sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, to the local community. Zosima has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Zosima joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zosima is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase more fish and for working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Zosima from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the family's basic needs. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and for working capital

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Sou T., 45, is a village farmer who has been farming for more than nine years. Her husband, Duch Em, age 50, works with her in this sector. This couple has been blessed with four children: two are married and have already started new family homes, while the others are single. This coming rice-cultivating season, after the rains fall, Sou T. is applying for a loan as capital to grow a rice crop.

loans.use: To grow a rice crop.

loans.name: Po

texts.en: Po S., 45, lives in Kompong Cham Province, where she has been farming for years in the village. Her husband earns a living as a carpenter. This couple has given birth to five children. Two of their children are employed: a daughter is a seamstress for a garment factory and a son works in construction. Po S. will use this loan to purchase a used motorbike in order to make her family’s transportation easier. She and her husband are pictured at their house.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorbike.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie A. is from the town of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 39 years old. Elsie is married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Elsie owns & operates a business selling specialty food products in the local community. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP. She will purchase the raw ingredients that are needed to make the homemade food products that she has for sale in her small food stall. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Elsie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support needs of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: The two people shown in the picture are Mrs. S. K. and her husband. S. K. is 41 years old, a farmer, and the mother of four children. Two of her sons are employed as construction workers, whilst her husband works in the carpentry business. S. K. will be using this loan as capital for her unemployed son to begin selling ice-cream in the local school.

loans.use: To begin selling ice-cream in the local school

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im S. L. currently sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing (her husband is a local fisherman). As another source of income, her husband raises a few cows for their offspring to sell. This modest couple now has three children who are of school age. Im S. L. humbly requests a loan to replace an old fishing tool that has broken. 
The two people shown in the picture are Mrs. Im S. L., 38, and her husband, age 41.

loans.use: To replace an old fishing tool that has broken

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Ouch K., 50, is a village woman living in Kompong Cham Province. Since the beginning of 2005, Ouch K. owned an old bicycle and used it to pick up a few products to sell door-to-door around her village. She sells items like pork, fish, and vegetables, and typically makes $3 profit a day to meet her family’s daily expenses. Her husband, Om Pho, 55, is a local farmer. This couple has four children who are married. With this loan, Ouch K. will purchase a plot of plantation from a villager in order to greatly grow various kinds of crops. This will enable the family to accrue an extra profit to meet their daily expenses. Ouch K. was not available for the photograph, so her husband is in the photo instead at their house.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of plantation

loans.name: Uraz

texts.en:
For the past 15 years, A. Uraz has put much effort into his agricultural activities. Despite the difficult economic situation that he has gone through, he has managed to support his family and provide his three children with everything they need. To develop his business, Uraz has made use of loans provided by IMON International, which he has used toward technical assistance for his crops. Once again, Uraz seeks loan support from IMON International to invest in his crops, raise his harvest, and survive along with his family. With your help, Uraz will be able to get ahead.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Pin

texts.en: C. M., 22, is a younger mother who has one lovely kid who is enrolled in school. She is married to Sopear (pictured), 29, who works as a goldsmith in the market. She is currently buying and selling used goods from her home, and is earning an average of $2 income per day. C. M. just started running her investment in early 2009, and she still needs additional money in order to improve her investment. Because of the lack of capital, C. M. is looking for an $1100 loan from Kiva. She will use this loan to increase her business capital and to buy some equipment for her husband’s job.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en:
A. Nazokat has a responsibility that makes her work hard for improvement. She is a married mother and she wants her children to be well educated so that they can have a better future. Nazokat has worked in farming for the last 15 years. Nazokat is a woman of humble heart and position who works very hard every day in her fields to produce her family’s sustenance, planting and tending her potatoes, tomato and cucumber. Currently, Nazokat is asking for a loan to buy seed, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants to prepare one of her fields for cultivation. Show your solidarity with this noble but backbreaking cause!     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Tuhtabibi

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


 Тухтабиби Турсунова 1969 года рождения, замужем имеет 3 детей . Образование среднее. Заниматься откормом скота несколько лет. Муж сидит дома  помогает ухаживать за скотом. 2 года назад обратилась в Микроинвест за кредитом от КИВА. Мавжуда также занимается переработкой молоко. Ей также помогает сын продавать и выбирать скот. Она дополнительно выходит на поле и делает прополку и другую фермерскую работу Аппона Аштского района. На полученный займ хочет купить корм для скота сена и жмых .
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. Tuhtabibi T. was born in 1969. She is married with 3 children. She is a high school graduate. For several years she has been doing cattle farming, and her husband, who is unemployed, helps her around. Two years ago she applied for a Kiva loan. Mavjuda also processes milk. Her son helps her select and sell cattle. In addition, she works in the fields, removing weeds and doing other farming of Asht's Appon. She would like to use the loan for buying fodder and hay.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase cattle

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mrs. Phan R., 59, is married to Saroeun, age 66. Phan R. and her husband generate their daily income by selling chickens. They normally buy chickens at the cheapest price from the people who live in the rural areas and retail them at better price in the local busy market. This couple has been blessed with four children: two are married and the others are still young. Phan R. will be using a loan to accrue capital for her commerce, to buy more chickens to sell. (The picture is Phan R.'s husband).

loans.use: To buy more chickens to sell

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl O. is from the town of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 18 years old. Sheryl is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Sheryl owns & operates an "ala carte business" selling grilled chicken and pork meat. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling grilled meat to the local community. Sheryl is just starting this business.

In 2009, Sheryl joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sheryl is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Sheryl from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with a grown daughter and a 6-year-old son. She is an entrepreneur from Melitopol where she runs a small business selling women’s clothing and artificial leather retail items in the central city market. Yelena owns three vending facilities in the same marketplace and offers a nice selection of items for sale at prices affordable for an average Ukrainian. Yelena has been running her trade for seven years. She has about 20,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Her net profit amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas a month.

Yelena is hoping to use the loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to increase assorted seasonal merchandise and get additional income. She is hoping to invest a portion of the generated income into development of her husband’s construction business startup. Yelena feels very comfortable working in this sphere of business. She has promptly repaid all previous loans and we believe the current loan will be repaid fully as well.

loans.use: To increase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with a grown daughter. Her family lives in Melitopol. Ludmila sells men’s outer wear in the central market of her home town. She is an experienced market vendor who has been in the trade for 12 years. Ludmila has 20,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Her net profit amounts to 10,000 Grivnyas. She owns three vending facilities in the same marketplace.

Ludmila is seeking a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to increase her seasonal men’s clothing for sale. She is hoping to generate additional profit and invest it in construction of her own little clothing store which has been her dream for awhile. Ludmila believes financial assistance will help her develop her business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of men's clothing

loans.name: Chon

texts.en:
Chon C. is 25 years old, single and a resident of Siem Reap Province, where he earns a living raising ducks in a cage behind his house. He raises ducks to produce eggs and sells the eggs to people who come to buy in bulk at his house.
On the other hand, he has also cultivated a rice crop on his plot of land in the village. He currently lives with his older mother and his three siblings. Chon C. requested a loan to use in both goals, to grow a rice crop during this rainy season and to buy additional small ducks to breed.

loans.use: To buy additional small ducks to breed and to grow rice

loans.name: Tit

texts.en: Tit S., 53, is a village woman and lives in the rural area of Phnom Penh Capital, where she owns a plot of land and uses it to plant various kinds of crops to earn a living. Another source of family income comes from her husband who works as a security guard for a gasoline station. This couple has four children: two are married and live separately, while the others are single. One of their daughters is a garment worker and has provided a salary to meet the family’s foods a little more. Tit S. will use half of the loan to buy a motor for her family’s riding needs and the rest of the loan to decorate her house.

loans.use: To buy a motor for the family’s riding needs

loans.name: Fowzya Group

texts.en:
Fowzya is the group leader of the Fowzya group. There are four members. They request a loan of 2500 Afghani.

Fowzya and M. sell oil. Naser Ahmad sells cosmetics. Nasar is a tailor. He wants to buy a machine for his business.

With this loan they can enlarger their businesses and support their families better in the future. They are really happy with this process in this poor country.

loans.use: make their businesses larger.

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en: Ouk S., 63 years old, is a widowed mother  who has been blessed with three children who are single. One of her daughters is working as a military policewoman. Ouk S. hires a store in the local busy market where she sells breakfast foods to people who come to buy anything in the market. She generates her daily income of $4 each day to manage her family's living and especially to support her two children’s school fees and food needs. Ouk S. has been repairing her old house for a few months but it is still not completed due to the family’s financial problems. Therefore, she would like a loan of $1000 to finish repairing her house.

loans.use: To finish repairing her house

loans.name: Muong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Moung C. is a borrower who has been selected as group leader by the other members of this group loan. Moung C. is a 59 year old widow and mother of two children. One of her daughters helps to feed the family by working as a garment worker. Moung C. currently earns a living by growing both rice and vegetable crops in the village. Her clients come to buy her mature crop in bulk two months after planting and they then sell the produce in the market. Moung C. does not own a vehicle so she pays a lot in taxi fees. To reduce her transportation costs, she would like a Kiva loan to add to her personal savings to buy a used motor. The other two borrowers are:
Mrs. K., 27, a farmer, who is applying for a loan to buy construction materials for her husband’s business.
Mr. H., 29, a local farmer is requesting a loan to buy a cow to plow his farmland.

loans.use: To buy a used motor vehicle

loans.name: Farshta Group

texts.en:
Farshta is the group leader of the Farshta group. There are four members. They want to expand their businesses. Farshta and Belqas want a loan for their embroidery business. They want to open a new shop. Abull wants a loan for his stationary business. Zaynab sells vegetables.

They want to say this loan is very useful because it provides a good chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their business.

loans.use: Expand their businesses.

loans.name: Ana Lizeth

texts.es: Ana lizeth S. R. vive en el municipio de Ilopango ubicado en e departamento de San Salvador. Ana vive con esposo y sus hijos Jessica de 14 años, Ángela de 9 años y el pequeño Saulito de 11 meses de edad. Ana posee una tienda hace cinco años, donde vende productos de primera necesidad, la tienda se encuentra ubicada dentro de su casa. Ana solicita un crédito para surtir la tienda con otra variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana Lizeth S. R. lives in the municipality of Ilopango, located in the district of San Salvador. Ana lives with her husband and her children: Jessica (14), Ángela (9), and little Saulito (11 months).

Ana has had a store for five years, where she sells basic necessities. The store is located within her home.

Ana is requesting a loan in order to stock her store with more of a variety of goods to offer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store

loans.name: Gladis Josefina

texts.es: Gladis Josefina C. V. D. M., vive en San Martín ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Gladis es una mujer D. 46 años D. edad madre D. cinco hijos D. los cuales dos ya son mayores D. edad y trabajan como profesores, y los otros hijos D. Gladis siguen estudiando. Gladis es una madre muy comprometida con su familia ha trabajado 23 años en su negocio que es una tienda, con la cual ha logrado sacar adelante a todos sus hijos motivándolos a estudiar y ser unos profesionales, hoy Gladis solicita este crédito por que quiere comprar productos para venta por mayoreo D. esta manera lograría mayor margen D. ganancias.
texts.en:
Gladis Josefina C. V. D. M. lives in San Martín, located in the district of San Salvador. Gladis is a 46-year-old mother of five children, two of which are grown and work as teachers. The other children are currently students.

Gladis is a very engaged mother. With her family, she has worked for 23 years in her store, which has successfully motivated her children to move forward with their studies and to become professionals.

Today, Gladis is requesting a loan because she wants to buy products to sell at wholesale, and in this manner would manage to increase her profit margins.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy seeds and other farm related items.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan Antonio G. vive en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Juan tiene 65 años de edad vive con su pareja y sus tres hijos. Juan se dedica principalmente a la venta de ropa, su mecánica de trabajo es de manera ambulante  el visita todos los pueblos de sus alrededores en su carro, donde lleva toda la mercadería, Juan obtiene ganancias de 50% en la mercadería que el vende. Ademas de tener este negocio, por ser persona muy trabajadora, también tiene una tienda, muy surtida de artículos de primera necesidad.

Juan solicita este crédito para comprar más mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio G. lives in the Ahuachapan department. Juan is 65 years old and lives with his spouse and three children. Juan makes a living primarily from selling clothing as a street vendor. He visits the surrounding towns in his car, where he has all his merchandise. Juan makes a 50% profit on all his sales. In addition to this business, since he is a very hard working person, he also has a store, which is well stocked with basic goods. Juan is requesting this loan to be able to purchase more merchandise for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy D. G. lives in the rural community of Barangay Buliwao Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. Being a widow is a difficult situation because she must care for all four of her children who are all studying at the moment in college and high school. She works very hard to give them all a better education and future someday. Daisy is managing a general store to be able to proviD. her children with their daily needs and allowances for school.

She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 as additional working capital for her business. She is hoping that someday, her business will become progressive and one of the leading stores in their village. She purchases her sales merchandise in the public market of Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. With the amount she is asking to borrow, Daisy will able to buy merchandise in bulk, which will reduce costs. Daisy is a positive thinker and hopes in the future she will be able to earn more to benefit her children. She believes that nothing is impossible if she does her best and asks the help of our Almighty God.

loans.use: To buy merchandise in bulk for her store

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
“Habang maikli ang kumot matutong mamaluktot” said Genie B.. An idiomatic expression that means: learn to maximize things from limited resources. She further explains that each of us must know how to adjust ourselves in times of crisis and must learn to economize and save for the future. She took this as her own principle in life in order to face challenges. Her family lives in the rural community of Barangay Buliwao Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Elizaldy B. and they are blessed with two children. Her eldest child has already finished a vocational course while her youngest is still studying.

Genie has maintained a hog raising business for many years, while her husband is a driver of a passenger jeepney. The couple aims to increase their standard of living and give their children a better future by continuing to send them to school. Genie is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 in order to sustain her hog raising business and become progressive in the future. She hopes to buy additional piglets to raise for her business.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets for her business

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Despite the hardships of life, Geraldine still believes that parents should be the best model for their children to follow someday. She and her husband sacrifice much so that their children may have a better future. Geraldine is married to Jose F. of Barangay San Leonardo in Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya where they currently live. They belong to a poor family and were not able pursue a college education. Their two children are studying in the elementary school right now. Geraldine, with the help and support of her husband, is doing her best to give them enough support. 

She maintains a hog-raising business in their village in which she has a simple but powerful way to generate income. Her husband is a construction worker in their area. Geraldine is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 from Kiva lenders to further sustain and grow her business. She also hopes someday to establish a general store to generate a daily income aside from hog raising.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Atilio

texts.es: Atilio C. A. vive en Jayaque ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, Atilio es un hombre casado de 45 años de edad, se dedica al transporte público en su pick up, con 16 años de experiencia en el negocio, Atilio manifiesta tener una buena rentabilidad es sus ingresos ya que sus ganancias son aproximadamente del 48%. Atilio solicita este crédito por que quiere hacerle mejoras a su pick up, ya que este es su herramienta diaria de trabajo y le es conveniente tenerlo en las mejores condiciones posibles.
texts.en:
Atilio C. A. lives in Jayaque which is in the La Libertad department. Atilio is a married man of 45 years of age. He makes a living providing transportation in his pick up. He has 16 years of experience in this business. Atilio claims to be making good profits, his profit is about 48% of his investment. Atilio is requesting this loan to make improvements to his pick up truck, since this is his daily source of income and he needs to maintain it in the best possible conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen manages a general store in her village of Barangay Paungan Aliaga in Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Jose P. who is a very supportive husband. Helen is 42 years old and is still working very hard to give their children a better future. They have three children; two of them have already graduated high school but put off college for a while due to financial constraints. Her youngest is still studying in high school. 
Helen is hoping to borrow PHP 9,000 to use in maintaining and growing her general store. Her two older children help her manage the business where they sell different grocery items, as well as fruits and vegetables. She is hoping to save enough within the next year for her children to be able to seek a college education. She believes that with the help of Kiva Lenders, and her patience towards managing her business, she will become successful and someday overcome the hardships of her life.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Thelma

texts.es: Thelma A. vive en el cantón La Coyotera ubicado en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Thelma  tiene 60 años de edad, se dedica a su negocio que es una pequeña tienda ubicada en su casa,  tiene 12 años de experiencia en el negocio. Ella solicita este crédito por que quiere surtir la tienda  y también quiere invertir en materia prima para la elaboración de pupusas para vender  ya que en la zona donde tiene ubicado su negocio es muy transitado todos los días por estudiantes que van a la escuela.
texts.en:
Thelma A. lives in the La Coyotera canton, located in the department of Ahuachapán. Thelma is 60 years old. She has 12 years of experience running a mini market in her home. She is requesting this loan because she wants to restock her shop. She also wants to invest in ingredients to make pupusas (handmade corn flat bread stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, and/or refried beans) to sell them because her business is located in an area frequented daily by students on their way to school.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products to restock her mini market

loans.name: Maria Naid

texts.es: Maria Naid C. D. B. resiD. en La Herradura ubicado en departamento D. La Paz. Maria tiene 64 años D. edad, vive con su familia compuesta por su esposo, su nuera y una nieta. El esposo D. Maria trabaja D. pescador, obtiene ingresos mensuales D. 100$, es por ello que Maria busco otra manera para generar dinero ya que no eran suficientes lo ingresos D. su esposo y fue así como puso su negocio que es una tienda con productos D. primera necesidad. Maria solicita este crédito para surtir su tienda y así lograr mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria Naid C. D. B. lives in the department of La Paz. She is 64 years old and lives with her family—her husband, daughter-in-law, and a granddaughter. Maria’s husband is a fisherman whose monthly income is $100.00. For this reason, Maria sought another way to make money because her husband’s salary was insufficient, so that is why she set up her general store in which she sells basic need items. Maria is requesting this loan to increase inventory, thus boosting sales.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock general store

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is commonly called “Leoni” (her nickname) in their village. She is now a widow and has two children: Fredillon and Fredelyns. They live in a rural community located in Barangay Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. Her eldest already graduated from college.

Leoni is thankful for having her vending business as source of income to provide for the education of her youngest child. Leoni is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 as additional working capital for her vending business. She is very proactive in her business as she goes around her village selling her vegetables instead of having a shop in front of her home like some do. Having the loan will give Leoni the opportunity she needs to work hard and grow her business.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Sem's Group

texts.en:
There are four borrowers who are jointly taking this loan. Its leader, Mrs. Sem P. is 54 years old and is a married woman with two children. She has built a store in front of her home where she sells a few items like cooked ingredients and some sweets to the neighbors for a profit. Her husband, Pouch Veth, is the one managing their business as well as fishing.

Sem P. will be using her first loan from Kiva to purchase extra grocery items to sell. This will allow her to accrue a profit to better meet her entire family’s daily expenses.

The other borrowers include:

Mr. C. is a fisherman who is asking for a loan to support his business.

Mrs. C. will be using the loan to buy nets and traps for fishing.

Mrs. A. is a fishnet weaver who is applying for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house.

loans.use: To purchase extra grocery items to sell

loans.name: Lovely

texts.en:
Lovely has aimed to raise her family from poverty in order to give their children a better future. “However, life really was like a wheel,” said Lovely. “Sometimes we are on top and sometimes we’re at the bottom.”

Lovely is married to Leonermar who helps her with his utmost power to secure their children’s future. Lovely manages a vegetable vending business while her husband patiently tills their farm lot. Sometimes, her husband also serves as a tricycle-transport operator in their village to earn some extra income.

Lovely is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 as additional working capital. She is glad that she is able to earn an income of around PHP 800 weekly from her vegetable vending business. She hopes that her business grows bigger through the assistance of the Kiva lenders and with continued hard work and patience.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is engaged in a food-vending business. She is 53 years old and is married to Benjamin B.. They live happily with their two children in Barangay Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. Neither of them were able to graduate in high school but they wanted their children to finish their studies in college so that they will have a better future someday. The couple helps each other to earn income and support the studies of their children.

Their main source of income is farming which is being managed by her husband very well to harvest a good yield. Lucrecia also manages a food vending business that is situated in front of their house. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 as additional capital to improve her business. She enjoys operating her business and does not get discouraged, even when things are difficult. She believes that having strength and passion in her work is one of the great factors to become successful someday.

loans.use: To uses as business capital

loans.name: Mouy's Group

texts.en:
Mouy M., 33, has been chosen by the other members to be the leader of this group loan. She was married for years, but divorced her husband and has no children. She now lives alone and has a job as a grocery seller, selling her items to the neighbors who live near her house in the village. She is taking  out a loan to buy a quantity of grocery items in order to better meet her customer’s requirements.

There are four other borrowers who have joined this loan:

Paoch N. will use the loan to buy more nets and traps for fishing.

Muoy S. sells fish in the market and will use the loan to buy fresh fish to sell.

Chhay R. catches fish and is seeking a loan to purchase fishing equipment.

Reun S. will be using the loan to buy additional tools to make fishing easier.

loans.use: To buy a quantity of grocery items

loans.name: Aterei E Acterenge Sarah Group

texts.en:
A. Sarah, is a 22-year-old businesswoman. She is married with three children of whom one child is going to school and she is looking after two dependents.

A. Sarah has dealt in produce such as green peas and groundnuts (peanuts) since 2007. She is using the loan to purchase green peas and groundnuts for sale. Her business is improving. She is even managing to take care of herself. She is a hardworking lady whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase green peas and groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en: Magdalina M. is from the town of Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 64 years old, married, and has four adult children. Magdalina owns and operates a business buying and selling green bananas in the local market. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2000, Magdalina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Magdalina is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional green bananas for her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of relatives and other family members. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional green bananas for her business

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Pha

texts.en: Pha D., 31, resides in the Kampong Cham Province where, as a house wife, she takes care of the home and looks after her three young children, two of whom are in school and one who is yet too young to attend.  Her husband, 32, pictured here, is a pig farmer who typically makes $14 in revenue per day. Monthly, this family spends about $45 on food, $15 on the children’s education and around $25 on transportation. To earn more income, Pha D. is asking for a loan of $1000 for her husband to raise pigs and purchase pig feed. This loan will ultimately help the family raise its standard of living.

loans.use: To raise pigs.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a vendor of vegetables and different snacks in her village. She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to use as additional working capital for her business. According to her, she needs to do her best in performing her task so that she may provide a good life to the children she will have someday.

She recently married Nixon M. and they are living in the simple village of Barangay Buliwao in Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. Her husband works as a bus driver. The couple is saving some of their daily income to establish her planned village store in the days to come.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Ramzi Group

texts.en:
The Ramzi group is made up of three women who live in the region of the Aley, Mount Lebanon.

Najat is a 34-year-old married woman who has two children. She has been producing handicrafts and embroideries for 20 years. Najat is successful in her work because of her experience. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She set up her business because of her experience and her good networking skills. Najat requested a loan of $300 USD from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua, in order to purchase materials such as thread and accessories. This is the first time that Najat has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on expanding her work.

Siham is a 24-year-old married woman with three children. She has had a sewing business for 15 years. Siham is successful in her work because she likes it and does it well. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She set up her business because of her need. Siham requested a loan of $300 USD from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua, in order to purchase materials such as thread and accessories for her work. This is the first time that Siham has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

Rayan is a 20-year-old woman. She has been doing handicrafts for two years, and she makes boxes, bags, and lots more. Rayan is successful in her work because of her good taste. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She set up her business to support her family’s income. She requested a loan of $300 USD from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua, in order to purchase thread for her work. This is the first time that Rayan has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

About group loans
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individuA. loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Marichelle

texts.en: Marichelle Y. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. Marichelle owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store, selling daily use products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. Marichelle has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Marichelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marichelle is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to sustain her family's needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jarkin

texts.en:
A. Jarkin is 46 years old and married with two children. She started her own business seven years ago because her husband at that time was unemployed. Jarkin sells confectionery like candies, cookies and pastries in the local market. The generated income allows Jarkin to support her family. Jarkin dreams of educating all of her children with higher education.

Today, Jarkin requests 4,000 Somoni for purchasing confectionery to enlarge her range of goods. The income she is planning to spend on the well being of her family as well as for educating her children.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase confectionery to enlarge her range of goods

loans.name: Ke

texts.en: KE K. H. is 27 years old and resides in the Kampong Cham province. She is a grocery seller and earns US$12 per day. She has two children to support. Her husband, 39, is a farmer who typically makes US$ 10 per day. Ke K. H. is asking for a loan of US$ 700 to purchase more grocery items and fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is married and has two kids. He sells men's clothing at one of the markets in Melitopol city. He has been in this business for 12 years. He has always tried to offer his clients large variety at affordable prices. His profit is about 5,000 UAH per month. The clothing business is the only source of income for this family. Oleg uses the profit to help his parents to survive economically as well.
Oleg would like to borrow 12,200 UAH to increase his inventory. He is going to use the loan to purchase more clothing for the season. Oleg is very optimistic and believes he can develop this business even more.

loans.use: To increase his inventory of men's clothing.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
“With endurance and sacrifice,” says Marilyn.

Marilyn is married to Larry T. and they live in a rural place located at Barangay Buliwao Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. Due to financial difficulty, they have used their time carefully to earn income in order to provide for their daily basic needs at home and to support the studies of their three children who are studying in high school and elementary levels of education. They want their children to finish their studies until college so that they will have a good future.

Despite the hardships and difficulties, the couple is doing their best to provide for the studies of their children. Larry, her husband, is planting rice and vegetables to harvest a good yield. On the side, Marilyn decided to engage in a vegetable vending business to support him to earn a daily living. Marilyn wants to borrow the amount of PHP 7, 000. In this regard, Marilyn plans to strengthen her business more in order to earn and save for the future of their children. The loan will be used as additional working capital.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Zulfiniso

texts.en:
Zulfiniso is married with 8 children. She sells nice, quality fabrics for national dresses in a big local market. Her family is actively helping her with her business, which she started about 14 years ago. Zulfiniso would like to ask for a loan of 6000 Somoni to increase her inventory which will help supply her until the spring season. She believes this timely investment will help her generate additional income and increase the family budget. We think Zulfiniso’s responsibility and strong character will assist her in the current loan repayment.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

loans.use: To purchase of new fabrics to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Neath

texts.en:
NEATH S. is 37 years old and resides in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer and makes US$4 every day. She has two children. Her husband, 30, is a mat seller who typically makes US$ 45 in revenues per day.
NEATH S. is asking for a loan of US$1000 for her husband to purchase mattresses to sell to his customers. (S. is pictured with her husband's motorbike used to transport mattresses to sell)

loans.use: To purchase mattresses to sell.

loans.name: Ban

texts.en: Ban C., 25, is a village woman who lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a good homemaker who cooks tasty meals and cares for two kids, both of whom are studying in primary school. She currently earns her daily profit of $4 a day from cultivating rice and raising pigs. Another income source comes from her husband who works in construction. Ban C. will be using a loan to purchase a pair of oxen for plowing a field to grow a rice crop and to raise its offspring in the future. Ban C. was mpt available at that day so her husband is shown in the photo instead.

loans.use: To purchase a pair of oxen

loans.name: Melynda

texts.en:
Mylenda S. is popularly known by her nickname, which is “Indang”. She is married to Edward S. and they live in the rural community of Barangay San Leonardo of Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. They were blessed with three children: Princess Jane, Justine Prince and Jasmine May. Two of them are now attending elementary school. She wants all her children become successful someday, so she works hard to prepare for the future.

Her husband Edward drives a tricycle transport to earn an income, while Melynda manages a general store in their village. She has to wake up very early in the morning and closes at 8:00 in the evening. She wants her business to grow so she is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 Philippine Pesos to use as additional working capital. She strongly believes that expanding her store will secure the future of her children especially in providing for their need to acquire an education.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Rosell

texts.en:
Rosell R. is 30 years old and lives in the town of Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City in the Philippines. Rosell is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosell owns & operates a traditional gold mining business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling gold dust to local jewelers. Rosell has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

Rosell is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase a gold flasher machine to improve his business activities. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to support his childrens' education. This will be Rosell's third loan from HSPFI, having successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP. He joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a gold flasher machine to improve his gold mining business

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Kanyumu A Central Adiochi Christine Group

texts.en:
A. Christine is 28 years old and married with four children. Three of her children attend school, along with one other dependent whom she also takes care of. A. deals in charcoal and has been operating her business for over six years.

She is requesting a loan to purchase bags of charcoal to increase capital and improve her stock inventory to meet the orders of her customers. A. is an active and hardworking business lady whose dream is to build a proper house for her family and other dependents.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal to meet her customers' additional orders

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
C. Shahodat is 52 years old. For fifteen years Shahodat has been working as a market vendor. She sells plates and dishes made in an oriental style in the central local market, which are very popular among the local populace. This kind of china is also widely used for girls' dowry and also for family celebrations. Now Shahodat is planning to enlarge the range of goods she sells by purchasing more china. Hence, she is requesting 2,000 Somoni. Shahodat is an existing IMON client with good credit history, and promises to repay the loan promptly. She thanks everyone supporting her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road. However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. Civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous with only 7% of the land being arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural and manufacturing sectors, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

loans.use: To purchase oriental-style plates and dishes

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura L. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Laura is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Laura owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a "sari-sari" or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Laura has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine Pesos (about US $211) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Laura joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laura has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 pesos from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Laura is requesting a new loan of 10,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional products to sell in her "sari-sari" or general store. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Laura from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy products to sell in her store

loans.name: Mylin

texts.en:
Mylin and her husband Ronnie T. live happily in Barangay Baresbes Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. Both of them graduated from college but, unfortunately, were not able to find well paying jobs. The couple still wants to give their children a good education, though, and are working so hard for their future.

Ronnie works as a security guard in Solano while Mylin manages a food and snack vending business in their house. She is asking to borrow PHP 5,000 as working capital to maintain and expand her business. Her average net income weekly is PHP 750.

Mylin sacrifices much to make her business work. She must wake up early in the morning to prepare food to sell as people go to work. She hopes to have a fruitful business that will enable her to help her husband to uplift their standard of living.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago, Uguloy started her business of selling the national women's dresses. Experienced and talented in the business, Uguloy has expanded her business into a successful trade, supporting her family of two children. Throughout the last year, IMON International has provided assistance to Uguloy’s business through microfinance loans. Committed to growth and successful entrepreneurship, Uguloy has used her previous loans wisely and has repaid each with a perfect credit history. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 3600 Somoni to replace the depleted inventory, hoping to continue expanding her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: To buy inventory for dress shop

loans.name: Ung

texts.en:
Ung C., 52, has had an occupation as a used clothes seller, selling in the local market, earning approximately $10 each day. She is a widowed mother blessed with two children who are single. One of them is a teacher in the local primary school.

Ung C. usually starts her work in the morning and finishes in the late evening. Her business is very profitable for her family, and that motivates her to continue working. Recently, Ung C. sold nearly all her clothes from her stock supply and she hopes to buy an increased quantity of clothing using a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio O. is from the town of Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City. He is 54 years old. Emilio is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Emilio owns & operates a business financing mining activities through purchasing gold dust from miners and selling it with mark-up to the local jewelers. Emilio has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Emilio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to engage in business activities. Emilio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Emilio is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to be used as capital to finance the mining activities. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Emilio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support needs of relatives and other family members. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To finance the mining activities.

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mairam

texts.en:
T. Mairam is an enterprising, capable, and very hard-working woman. She lives in Shahrituz, Tajikistan and sells shoes for women and children. She began her business after the death of her husband. Her work is allowing her three children to go to school. It is very important to Dilorom that her children finish school and become honest, hard-working individuals. You can help Dilorom provide for the education of her children. She needs 5000 Somoni to buy merchandise to increase sales. She wants to continue to support her children and only wishes to work in order to achieve this. Support her! 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the new shoes for women for summer season.

loans.name: Batsayhan

texts.en: Batsayhan D. lives with her husband and two children in Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her 20-year-old daughter is a student in a local university and her 15-year-old son goes a local high school. Batsayhan's husband is a technician at the local power plant. Batsayhan has a small barber shop. She is an experienced hairdresser. She started her small barber shop in 2000 by renting a small room in the local apartment building with an attractive location.  As her business has done well, she needs to expand her barbershop. For the expansion, she requests a loan to purchase the necessary furniture and equipment for her barbershop. With the future profit, she is planning to save for her son's future university tuition.

loans.use: To buy furniture and equipment for her barbershop.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is married with one child. She sells cosmetic items, like deodorants, perfumes, etc. at a store named Kashtan, where she rents some space. Natalia's profit is 3,500 UAH per month.

Natalia has been in this business for five years. During this time she has been able to obtain many repeat clients. She always offers good quality products and a large variety. Her goal is to have a stable source of income for her family. 

Natalia is a hardworking and quite entrepreneurial person. She would like to obtain a loan of 9,000 UAH to be able to increase her inventory as well as to try some new products. A good family relationship is a great support for Natalia and her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory and to try new products

loans.name: Oigul

texts.en:
Oigul is a widow and mother of four children. She sells clothing in the small market of Shahrituz. Oigul’s business is going well and demand has been very stable over the last 14 years. Oigul is an entrepreneur of high integrity. She is very hard working and energetic. Even when her competitors have similar product or lower prices, clients naturally gravitate to her because she makes them feel valued, respected and heard. Oigul is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase seasonal clothing which will help her stabilize her business and income so she can support herself and her daughter.

-------------------------------- More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase clothing for women for the summer season.

loans.name: Flordiliza

texts.en: Flordiliza is married to Danilo B. and they lived in the rural village of Buliwao Quezon Nueva Vicaya.  Farming is their major source of income in their village.  They help each generate a daily income to support the education of their children and for their daily living.  She is very eager to develop her business so she will able to earn a higher income. Flordiliza is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to acquire more products to sell.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Amejei C Among Josephine Group

texts.en: Josephine A. is 28 years old.  She is a single mother with four children.  Three are in school, one lives at home and she also takes care of a dependent. Josephine sells smoked fish and she has been in business for two years.  She is requesting a loan to purchase smoked fish. She is an active lady and her future plan is to obtain livestock (a bull or a cow).

loans.use: Purchase smoked fish to satisfy customers demand.

loans.name: Maruf

texts.en:
K. Maruf is 30 years old. He is married with two children. Maruf sells cattle. As a rule he purchases small cattle in the central market, feeds them and resells them at higher prices.

Being in this business for many years he knows how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. Thus, he gets up every morning to feed the animals and look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and he generates a stable income for his family.

Maruf has a large and friendly family who always try to help each other. Maruf is planning to enlarge his stock and purchase more cattle.

With this purpose he requests $700. You could become an important part in Maruf family's life. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

---------------------------------------- More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase cattle to expand his business.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda A. is from the town of Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 41 years old, married and has seven adult-aged children.

To make a living, Imelda prepared and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products such as viands in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Imelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase raw ingredients needed to make viands for sale.

Imelda is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP to repair her food stall used in the business. This loan will be the fourth taken out by Emelda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of the family.

-------------------------------- About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Repair her food stall.

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita, a 38-year-old resident of Barangay Sto. Domingo in Quirino, Isabela, is married to Ronaldo D., a 42-year-old jeepney driver. They have a 10-year-old daughter, Lorraine Mhay, who is studying in the primary school of Sto. Domingo. The most common sources of income in their rural village are rice and corn farming.

Carmelita is engaged in vending various kinds of food in their village. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to be used as additional revolving capital to enable her business to grow and satisfy all her customers. For the two years she has been in business, Carmelita has been able to maintain it well. According to her, it is of great help in supporting her family’s daily food requirements. She hopes that her business will become more successful as time goes by and is also praying that they remain healthy while they are still young so that she can work properly and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 50 years old and is the widow of Elpidio T.. She has eight children: five were able to finish the secondary level of education; her sixth child, Jaypee, is 15 years old and has stopped attending high school because of financial difficulties; while Corazon, 11 years old, and Michelle, 8 years old are both studying in the primary level. 

Corazon is a vendor of native cakes which she sells in the public market of their town of Naguillan, Isabela. She cooks and sells her native cakes and is doing her best to develop the business to be able to generate a higher income for the education of her two younger children. She is hoping that somehow, through her business, she can increase her standard of living.

Corazon is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 as additional working capital in the production of her native snacks. She further said that “in every sacrifice, there is a prize.” She is hoping that her prize will be enough to support her family’s daily needs.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Davaadorj

texts.en:
Davaadorj T. lives with his wife in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He was recently married and his wife is still a student in a local university. He has just recently moved out from his parents’ home in order to start a new life for his own family.

Davaadorj runs an office supply and service center. Some of the services that he offers are taking photos, scanning, printing, and copying documents. He started his business in 2003 with one personal computer that he owned. However, with his business profit, he has bought more equipment, including two laptops, a color printer and a digital camera.

In the future, Davaadorj would like to expand his small service into a well-equipped and full-service studio. He requests a loan to purchase more paper and ink for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more paper and ink for his business

loans.name: Jacel

texts.en:
Jacel is 20 years old and is married to Garmond T. who is presently working abroad as a domestic helper. Jacel is presently residing in Purok or district four in Barangay San Manuel of Naguilian, Isabela. They don’t have any children yet because they plan to save first before starting a family, especially so now that the global economic crisis has made it harder to earn money.

Jacel is engaged in a cell phone load retailing business, which gives her a net income of PHP 3,000 monthly. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to be used as additional revolving capital in her business. This is the only way she knows to help her husband save money for their future children. She hopes that someday they could save and sustain for the welfare of her family.

Jacel believes that “time is gold”. That’s why, as long as they don’t have children yet, Jacel and her husband must work diligently for their future.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 41 years old and is married to Emiliano S.. They live in Purok (District) 2 of Barangay San Manuel in Naguilian, Isabela.

They are blessed with seven children: their eldest, Michael, is 23 years old and studying for a degree in accounting; second is Ferdinand, who is a 22-year-old college student taking an electrical engineering track; third is Emiliano S. Jr., who is a 21-year-old high school graduate and is presently working abroad; fourth is Jomel, who is 20 years old, and has stopped studying due to financial difficulties experience by his family but will pursue his studies this year according to Jocelyn; fifth is Cathleen, who is a 15-year-old secondary student; sixth is Mica Venus, who is 5 years old and a daycare pupil; and the youngest is Michael James who is 2 years old. 

Jocelyn sells RTW (ready-to-wear) clothing products, which she purchases from Divisoria in Manila. She sells pants, blouses, T-shirts for men and women and kids clothing as well.

Jocelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to be able to sustain her business and save for the education of her children. She has been in business for three years and she hopes now to expand it. Another dream of her is to improve their home, which is just made from bamboo. She also wants her children to finish their studies thus she is doing her best to work and become productive in her business. She also shared that “if you do your best, God will do the rest”.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita O., a 50-year-old resident of Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a specialized retail business whose main revenue comes from selling various foods in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Nenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, she is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital and to partly pay for their purchase lot. This loan will be the third taken out by Nenita from HSPFI and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of the family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional working capital and to pay for their purchase lot

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Naranbadam

texts.en:
Naranbadam T. is a single mother with a 3-year-old son. She currently lives in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. She holds dual degrees in pedagogy and finance.

Naranbadam currently owns a small convenient store where she mostly retails various food items such as soft-drinks, baked goods, candies, etc. She frequently travels to wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and brings back products for her store. While she is travelling, her mother works at the store as a seller.

In the future, Naranbadam would like to expand her store into a decent supermarket, which will introduce more variety of food products for locals. She requests a loan to purchase more inventory for her store from Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store from Ulaanbaatar

loans.name: Chansihoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chansihoeun N., 48, and her husband, Mr. Heang Pech, 54, were married in 1984 and have four children: one son and three daughters. Two of her children are married and live outside the family home; another one is in grade 9 and the youngest son stays at home. Besides her children, she also has an aged mother who is living with her. The family lives along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Chansihoeun has been selling vegetables and fish phork for over thirty years (fish phork is made of chopped fish, salt, sugar, yeast and rice, placed in large airtight jars and allowed to ferment). She buys fish from a fisherman to make phork at her house and sells it in her village and nearby villages. Her husband assists his wife in the business.

Chansihoeun hopes to purchase more vegetables and fish to make phork. It would be better for her to increase her income to support her family, but she doesn’t have enough capital. That’s why she is asking for her first loan of $500 to use for this purpose.
