loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and fish to make phork

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en:
Jovie is engaged in vending chicharon (fried pork skin) in her village. She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to be able to have additional capital to increase her daily income. She has been in the business for twenty years and she hopes that it will become progressive so that her income will increase.

Through the aid of a motorcycle, she is able to deliver her chicharon to some stores in their village and sometimes to nearby villages. According to Jovie, she has to perform her obligation as a good mother to her children by providing them with support for their education so that they have the opportunity for a better future. 

Jovie is 35 years old and is married to Jofel A.. They are living in Barangay San manue,l Naguilian, Isabela and they are blessed with four children. Through the help of her brother-in-law they were able to start their business. She hopes that someday, with the help of the loan, the business will expand and will help increase her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Amejei C Alupo Lucy Group

texts.en:
A. Lucy is 26 years old and is married with three children and looks after twenty dependents. She sells groundnuts (peanuts) and she has been in her business for three years. 

She is using the loan to buy bags of groundnuts to increase the size of her business. She is a very hardworking lady and courageous. She hopes to prosper in her business and, in the long run, to purchase cows.

loans.use: To purchase bags of groundnuts to increase  the size of her business

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael D., 23, and his wife, 24-year-old Aesel, reside in the Barangay of San Manuel, Naguilian, Isabel, where they are the parents of a two-year-old daughter, Diana Rose, one of the reasons Michael is working so hard for his future. In their village Michael’s wife helps him in his selling of special chicharon (fried and dried pork skin) purchased from the 3KJ special chicharon of Mr. Jennifer Alejo, who is also a Kiva entrepreneur. While he only has an income of PHP 3,000 within a month, which is sometimes not sufficient for his family needs, Michael is really hopeful that someday he will able to develop his business to the same extent as Jennifer, whose enterprise is now really successful.

Michael has been running his chicharon retailing business for two years, and in order to realize his dream of developing the operation, he is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 as additional business capital. He believes that the more products he sells, the more income he will generate. He also believes that this amount will be helpful in pursuing all of his plans in life for the future well-being of his family. Michael is happy that his wife is in full support of his business, and he hopes that someday soon he will grow his business and have enough money to save for his family’s future.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Mr. Vuthy S., 37, and his wife, Mrs. Chansipheach Nao, 39, live along National Road Number One to the Cambodia/Vietnam border, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1992 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. The eldest son attends school and the other two are still too young.

Vuthy’s wife sells pickled cucumbers and papayas. She buys cucumbers and papayas from her village to make pickle and sells it in her village and in front of a garment factory.

Vuthy has been a security guard for one month. His old motorcycle doesn’t work properly and he very often spends a lot of money repairing it. So, he is applying for his first loan of $700 to purchase a motorcycle to replace the old one.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to replace the old one

loans.name: Sherimar

texts.en:
Sherimar is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 from Kiva that she will utilize in maintaining her direct-selling business of Avon, Natasha and MSE products. She would like to grow her business to be able to continue to support her family.

Sherimar generates an income of at least PHP 4,000 monthly and, according to her, it is really a great help to her family. She also manufactures homemade peanut butter as another source of income. Her brothers and sisters are still studying and she works hard to give them the support they expect from her. She hopes not to disappoint them on that matter and she believes that, “If there’s a will, there’s a way”.

Sherimar is 27 years old and is a resident of Barangay San Manuel of Naguilian, Isabela. She is still single and is the eldest child of her parents and graduated from high school. She once worked in Taiwan as a domestic helper for six months and in Jordan for three years. She is a very responsible child to her parents and a good sister to her siblings. She supports her parents and seven sisters and brothers in their schooling through investing her saved income and from the revenue from her businesses.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 38 years old and is the responsible wife of Rommel C. who is 39 years old. They live in Purok (district) 2 of San Manuel, Naguilian, Isabela. They are blessed with three children: Alyssa is twelve years old and is already in high school; Rodolfo is 9 years old and he is studying in the elementary; the youngest is Geraldine who is four years old. Nora wishes to give her children a better future by providing for their important necessities in school.

Nora sells chicharon (fried pork skin), fish crackers, peanuts, candy and other small items, which her husband sometimes, with their motorcycle, delivers in the provinces of Nueva Vizcaya, San Mateo, San Mariano and Naguilian, Isabela.

Nora started her retail business in 1999 and is thankful that she is still working. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to have additional business capital. She hopes that her children will successfully finish their studies someday especially in college because it is where they could start finding better opportunities to become successful individuals.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Ketra

texts.en:
Mrs. Ketra K., 47, and her husband, Mr. Many Un, 49, have been married since 1980. They have four children—two sons and two daughters. One of Ketra’s daughters is a cobber in a shoe factory, one son has full-time employment, the other daughter assists her mother in her scarf weaving business and the youngest son attends school. The family lives along National Road Number one, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Ketra has been a scarf weaver since 2000; it’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products in Olympic market, located in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a soldier for over 20 years; he also drives a motor taxi when he has free time to get more extra income. 

Ketra has two looms: one for her and another one for her daughter. She is requesting her second loan of 1,000 to purchase cotton threads to continue her scarf weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase cotton threads for her scarf weaving

loans.name: Admira

texts.en: Admira Polić is 34 and comes from the town of Tuzla. She is married and has two children; her daughter is 7 and her son is 11. Her husband is employed and earns well. Admira sells clothes at the big market in Tuzla. She resells very nice clothes and her clothes offer is really good. Admira has been our client for a long time. She repaid six loans from  WWI (Žene za Žene International). All these loans were invested in the clothes business. She requested her seventh loan in the amount of 2500 KM. Admira has big experience in this business and knows that big and good offers lead to bigger earnings.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Dzimedo Kégué Group

texts.fr: Cette association a été créée en 1999 par trois femmes très dynamiques, deux d’entre elles  exercent comme une  activité génératrice de revenu la vente de céréales et la troisième vend des charbons de bois. Deux d’entre elles sont veufs, la troisième est mariée, elles ont toutes des enfants. Le revenu de leur activité leur permet de s’entraider et de réaliser des œuvres de bienfaisance. Elles veulent agrandir leur activité afin de réaliser plus de profits et améliorer les activités sociales du groupe,l'association a déjà obtenu  trois crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé, elle demande pour la quatrième fois à WAGES un crédit pour acheter 7 sacs de maïs, 10 sacs de mil, 5 sacs de riz et 10 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
This association was created in 1999 by three dynamic women. Two of them earn their living selling cereals and the third sells charcoal. Two of them are widows; the third is married. They all have children.

The income from their businesses allows them to help each other and to do charitable work. They wish to expand their activities so as to make more profit and improve the social work the group does. The association has already received 3 loans that they have correctly reimbursed. They are requesting, for the fourth time through WAGES, a loan to buy 7 sacks of maize, 10 sacks of millet, 5 sacks of rice, and 10 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of maize, millet, rice, and charcoal

loans.name: Ravy

texts.en:
Mrs. Ravy P., 30, and her husband, Mr. Chanthorn Keo, 32, were married in 2000 and have no children yet. The family lives on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom P., the capital city of Cambodia.
Ravy sells snacks in the local school. Mr. Chanthorn Keo is a security guard who works in Phnom P.. He gets up in the early morning to travel to Phnom P. and comes back home in the evening. 
Ravy wants to start a raising pig business. It would be better for her to earn more income to support her family. Therefore, she is requesting her first loan of $300 to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Fayaza Group

texts.en:
Fayaza is the leader of this group of four. The members want to take a group loan of 56000 Afghani to help improve their businesses.

Fayaza wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. Bibi Fatama wants to take a loan for her husband's general store. Hanesa wants to take a loan for her husband's carpentry shop. Anesa wants to take a loan for her embroidery business.

They would all like to expand their businesses with this loan. They want to support their families and make a better future for them.

loans.use: To expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Sotheany

texts.en:
Mrs. Sotheany U., 24, and her husband Mr. Sam-At Sok, 28, were married in 2005 and have one young daughter. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city.

Sotheany has been a silk weaver for nine years. It’s a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a silk weaver as well, and he also created another business - growing mushrooms to sell.

Sotheany previously applied for a loan to build a room for her husband for planting mushrooms. Now her husband wants to build one more room to expand his business. So Sotheany is requesting her second loan of $600 to help finance her husband’s mushroom-growing business.

loans.use: To help fund her husband's mushroom-growing business

loans.name: Lonlon Kégué Group

texts.fr: Cette association  créée en 2008 regroupe 5 femmes dynamiques et un homme du quartier de kégué à Lomé, elle a pour objectif de mettre en commun  la force financière  de ses membres afin d’augmenter leur stock et bien vendre, les membres de l’association sont  mariés et ont des enfants. Les membres de cette association  mènent différentes activités génératrices de revenu comme la vente du jus de fruits, des céréales, de condiments, de produits de beauté et de charbons de bois. Cette association solidaire a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé. Ce deuxième crédit qu’elle sollicite  leur permettrait d’acheter 6 sacs de charbons de bois, 3 sacs de maïs, 1carton de produits de beauté et 3 sachets de condiments. Avec ce nouveau stock elles pourront bien vendre et aider les familles dans les besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
This association, created in 2008, brings together 5 dynamic women and one man from the Kégué neighborhood in Lomé. Its goal is to use the financial strength of its members to advance the common good, increasing their stock so they can expand their sales volume. The members of the association are married and have children. They earn a living in various ways, selling fruit juice, cereals, condiments, cosmetics, and charcoal.

This solidarity association has received one loan which they have correctly reimbursed. This second loan that they are requesting will permit them to buy 6 sacks of charcoal, 3 sacks of maize, 1 case of cosmetics, and 3 bags of condiments. With this new stock, they will be able to make lots of sales and help their families with daily needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of maize, sugar, condiments, bag of "pure water" and various items

loans.name: Naiheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Naiheng S. (in the picture with her daughter) is fifty-five years old and married to Mr. Sokha Preab, who is fifty-four years old. They were married in 1979 and have seven children: three sons, all of whom are in school, and four daughters. One of her daughters is married and lives outside the family home, one daughter is a garment factory worker, and the other one is a tailor.  The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Naiheng began selling groceries at the beginning of 2009. She buys grocery items at the market in Phnom Penh for resale from her house. Her husband has worked for the water supply authority in Phnom Penh since 1980. Naiheng is applying for a loan to purchase a sewing machine and build a shop for her daughter who is a tailor.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and build a tailoring shop for her daughter who is a tailor.

loans.name: Kabata North Akurut Florence Group

texts.en: A. Florence is forty-seven years old and married with seven children, who are all in school. She has three additional dependents under her care, and they are also in school. She deals in the production of local brew, and she has been in this business for over ten years. Florence is using the loan to purchase millet flour, yeast, and other necessary ingredients for local brewing, with the hope of improving her business size and profits. She is active and hard working, and she loves encouraging others to work hard. Her future plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase millet flour, yeast, etc for local brewing

loans.name: Senada

texts.en: Senada Soljankić was born in 1967, and comes from the suburban town of Tuzla. She is married and has one son who is at the university and one daughter in secondary school. Her husband has steady employment in a mine and earns almost enough to feed his family. Senada breeds poultry to supplement their income. Previously she raised poultry just for their own use, but now Senada has decided to purchase more chickens that she can sell, thus establishing a poultry business. Senada is requesting her first loan from the Kiva field partner, Women for Women International, and hopes to earn enough to support her son`s school costs at the university.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and chicken food

loans.name: Chengly

texts.en:
Mrs. Chengly M., who is fifty-nine years old, and her husband, Mr. Son Tit, age fifty-eight, were married in 1975 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. One of her sons is married and lives outside the family home. The family lives along national road number one about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Chengly and her husband have been raising pigs for thirty years. The couple wants to create another business producing rice wine, but they don’t have the necessary capital. So Chengly is asking for her first loan to start the production of rice wine and to buy more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To start producing rice wine and purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Affi

texts.fr: H. Affi est née vers 1949 à AZONGBAHOUTO, plus précisément à ATINKANME, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Affi est originaire de GRAND-POPO au Sud du Bénin.  Affi est veuve et mère de huit enfants: quatre garçons et quatre filles, tous majeurs. Affi vend la bouillie de maïs devant son domicile. C'est à Bago, un village au Nord du TOGO, pays frontalier au Bénin que Affi s'approvisionne en maïs. Affi a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédit de ALIDé pour constituer de stock de maïs. Affi rembourse ses crédits toujours sans aucune difficulté. Affi sollicite un cinquième crédit de ALIDé pour acheter le maïs en gros et stocker.
texts.en:
H. Affi was born around 1949 in Azongbahouto, more precisely in Atinkanme, a neighborhood of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. Affi's origins are in Grand-Popo in the south of Bénin.

Affi is a widow and the mother of 8 children, 4 boys and 4 girls, all of them adults. She sells maize porridge in front of her house. She buys her maize in Bago, a village in the north of Togo, a border country of Benin. She has already received 4 loans from ALIDé to build up a stock of maize. Affi always repays her loans without difficulty. She is requesting a 5th loan from ALIDé to buy maize wholesale and stockpile it.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 5 sacks of 50 kg of maize, 25 kg of granulated sugar, and firewood

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Mrs. Son H., age thirty-nine, and her husband, Mr. Kheng Heng, age forty-two, were married in 1980 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Two of tH. are married and live outside the family home. The family lives along national road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Son has been growing lotus for ten years, and her husband has been a fisherman for the same length of time. He fishes from a lake near his house and sells the fish in the village. Son doesn’t have her own transportation. A lot of money flows out to pay for traveling costs, so she is applying for her first loan to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Eli -Attiégou Group

texts.fr: Cette association est composée de 04 femmes mariées avec des personnes à charges, elles exercent toutes des activités génératrices de revenu  à savoir la vente de caleçon,  des assiettes et  des céréales. Elles veulent  dynamiser l’activité sociale du groupe raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de  WAGES leur second crédit pour agrandir leur activité génératrice de revenu par l’achat de 04 sacs de riz, 02 sacs de haricots, deux douzaines de caleçons  et 04 cartons d’assiettes.
texts.en:
This association is composed of 4 married women, all of them responsible for other people. They all earn a living in various ways, for example selling men's underwear, dishes, and cereals.

They want to strengthen the charitable work the association does, and for that purpose they are requesting their second loan from WAGES to expand their businesses by buying 4 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of dried beans, 2 dozen pairs of men's underwear, and 4 cartons of dishes.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of underwear, dishes, cereals, and various items

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en: Nadir T. is married and has three children. His family lives in the city of Agsu, where Nadir runs a small downtown grocery store. Nadir 's store is well-known in the neighborhood because he serves his customers well and works late hours, which is very convenient for those who work late and go shopping after they get off work. Nadir has been in business for eighteen years. Currently he is seeking a loan to purchase more inventory in order to increase the variety of goods he offers. Nadir had some struggles at first when his business was growing and becoming self-sustainable, but he handled all these challenges well and is looking toward the future with much enthusiasm and optimism.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods in his store

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena R. is from the village of Taglimao, in Cagayan De Oro City. She is fifty-three years old and married with six grown children. To make a living, Elena owns and operates a business making and selling food. She sells specialty food products such as bibingka (a Philippino delicacy) and from peddling vegetables in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $65 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services that would help improve her living situation by enabling her to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan which was used to sustain her business. She is requesting a new loan to purchase ingredients for bibingka and to provide additional capital for her vegetable sales. This will be her second loan. She plans to use the revenue generated from the business to support the needs of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for bibingka and as capital for vegetable sales

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Kerambo

texts.en: Kerambo C. is a married man and an entrepreneur in Tanzania. He runs two businesses at Yombo Buza ward in Dar es Salaam. He runs a poultry business, raising both layers and broilers, and at the same time he runs two retail shops where he employs two workers.  He sells fifteen trays of eggs a day to both retail and wholesale customers. He has 1,500 broilers and layers. Necessary items for his businesses are purchased from the wholesale and retail shops at the Kariakoo city shopping center. He is asking for a loan to build more poultry cages and to buy what he needs to keep the businesses going.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Sam-At

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-at K., age fifty-one, and her husband Mr. Sophai Orn, age fifty-two, were married in 1975. They have five daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home. Two other daughters weave silk at home, and the youngest studies in the local school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city.

Sam-at’s husband has been a fisherman for ten years. He fishes from a lake and river near his village. Their main income comes from her daughters' silk-weaving business. They don’t have enough capital to purchase silk materials to continue their business, so Sam-at is requesting her first loan to provide financial help to her daughters.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for her daughters' weaving business.

loans.name: Punkhan

texts.en: Punkhan J. is forty-five years old and married with four children. He lives with his family in his own house, which is stocked with the basic necessities. Punkhan has owned a small general store for five years. He sells foodstuffs for everyday use, such as sweets, flour, macaroni, sugar, preserved food, soft drinks, etc. The reason for requesting a loan is to be able to purchase more merchandise to stock the business. A greater variety of goods will attract more clients and generate a better monthly income to help his family. Please support this man who has the strength and courage to keep working!

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to stock the store

loans.name: Mazakhir

texts.en:
Mazakhir K. runs a small grocery store, selling a wide variety of foodstuffs, including canned foods, soft drinks, juices, sweets, tea, coffee, etc. He has been in this business for about twelve years. He is married and has three children. One of his goals is to be able to remodel his apartment and improve his living conditions.

Mazakhir has requested a loan of $1,200 to buy additional foodstuffs, in order to increase the range of his goods. The loan will help him increase his income and continue to operate a stable, sustainable business.

loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Vakhila

texts.en:
Vakhila J. runs a small grocery store, selling a wide variety of foodstuffs, including canned foods, soft drinks, juices, sweets, tea, coffee, etc. She has been in this business for about four years. She is married and has eight children. One of her goals is to be able to improve her living conditions.

Vakhila has requested a loan of $1,200 to buy additional foodstuffs, in order to increase the range of her goods. The loan will help her increase her income and continue to operate a stable, sustainable business.

loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita D. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 55 years old. Perlita is widowed and has seven adult children. To make a living, Perlita owns & operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Perlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Perlita is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business and to partly help in building her house. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Perlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business and to help in building her house

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya M. is married and her husband is an entrepreneur. She has two children, who are the source of her inspiration and drive as she wants to give them a better life so that they can study and do well for themselves.

Raya started her grocery store six years ago to help her husband out financially. She started off with a few products, but her business has grown as she has many frequent clients.

Raya would like a loan of $1,200 to buy merchandise so that she can offer a wider variety of products and so that her business can grow. Her clients are always asking her for new things.

Raya and her family thank you very much for your support, which means that her business can grow and she can fulfill her goal of providing for her family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise so that she can offer a wider variety of products

loans.name: Sedina

texts.en:
Sedina Imširović is 48 and comes from the village of Mramor near the town of Tuzla. She is married and her husband works in the coalmine. Sedina has three children: one daughter is married; the other works in the local store; and the third child is her school-aged son.

Sedina is a hardworker and has repaid three loans from WWI (Žene za Žene International). She used her first loan to buy a cow, the second was to purchase a calf and the third was invested in a poultry business.

Sedina has enough cattle feed and she has one calf every few months that she raises and sells. Besides that she has had the poultry business for a long time and now has decided to request a new loan of 2,000 KM to purchase more poultry and poultry feed. Sedina has developed her poultry business and has constant clients. Her family works together with her and shares the profit.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry and poultry feed

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad K. is 52 years old and is married with four children. He sells confectionery and other foodstuffs in the market and has been in this business already for four years. This activity generates the main income for his family.

As long as Elshad is very popular in the market selling the fresh and tasty pastry, he tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today, he requests $1,200 to purchase more confectionery to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more confectionery to sell

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira M. is married and is a Tanzanian small-businessman. He runs a business selling traditional clothes (Khanga and Vitenge) and also secondhand clothes at Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam.

He purchases the traditional clothes at Mnazi Mmoja traditional market center and the secondhand clothes from Karume small traders’ market. He buys wholesale and sells retail to his customers. He needs a loan of TZS 1,200,000 to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Sameira Group

texts.en:
Sameira is the leader of this group of five. All of them would like to help improve their businesses.

Sameira and Marsal want to take a loan for their vegetable shop. They want to make it larger and buy necessary materials. Fardows and Saheyla want to take a loan to buy necessary materials for their bakery. Yalda wants to take a loan to expand her food processing business.

With this loan they all can expand their businesses and support their families, making a better future for all.

loans.use: To expand their vegetable shop

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en:
Shaban S. is married and is a Tanzanian small-businessman. He runs a shop selling both new and secondhand clothes at Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam.

He purchases the business goods wholesale from Kariakoo city shopping center and secondhand clothes are purchased wholesale from Karume small traders’ city market.

Business income is used to meet the daily family needs. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Sandrine

texts.fr: K. Sandrine est originaire du TOGO, pays frontalier au Bénin. Sandrine est née le 1er Janvier 1974 à Kpondoavé, un des quartiers de Lomé, Capitale du TOGO. Sandrine est mariée à HOUENOUVI Cloud, couturier de profession mais faisant comme activité la conduite de taxi-moto. Sandrine est mère de cinq enfants dont quatre garçons et une fille. L'aîné est au cours élémentaire deuxième année et le benjamin est encore nourrisson. Sandrine et sa famille résident à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Sandrine fabrique et vend de savon liquide. Sandrine achète les matières premières pour la fabrication du savon liquide à Lomé. Sandrine est une ancienne bénéficiaire de ALIDé qui a déjà eu quatre crédits de la part de ALIDé. Pour augmenter le volume de sa production, Sandrine sollicite un cinquième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
K. Sandrine's origins are in Togo, a border country of Bénin. Sandrine was born on January 1, 1974 in Kpondoavé, one of the neighborhoods of Lomé, capital of Togo. She is married to Houenouvi Cloud, a professional tailor but presently working as a motor-taxi driver. She has 5 children, 4 sons and one daughter. The oldest is in the second year of elementary school and the youngest is still an infant.

Sandrine and her family live in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Sandrine makes and sells liquid soap. She buys the raw materials for making liquid soap in Lomé. Sandrine is a long-time client of ALIDé who has already received 4 loans through ALIDé. To increase the volume of production, Sandrine is requesting a 5th loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of raw materials for making liquid soap

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok C. is thirty-four and lives with her other family members in the province of Kompong Cham. She is blessed with four children who are minors.

She and her husband currently generate a daily profit by growing crops for sale. Sok C. will use the loan money to purchase an ox to plow her farmland. She will use the remainder of the loan to buy cucumber seeds to grow.

loans.use: To purchase an oxen to plow her farmland

loans.name: Aterei D Alungat Christine Group

texts.en: A. Christine is 24 years old and married with three children, all schooling; she also takes care of five dependents. Of the 5 dependents, 3 are in school. She sells milk and other basics. She has been in her business for over 3 years. She is requesting the loan in order to buy more milk and other basics like sugar, salt and soap, etc., increasing the capital of her business. She is hard-working and courageous. Her dream is to buy a plot of land with her husband and construct a house in town.

loans.use: To buy more milk and other basics like, sugar, salt, and soap, etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma R. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur  and a married woman. She runs a clothing shop with both new and second-hand clothes at Buguruni   ward in Dar es Salaam. Business goods are purchased from Kariakoo wholesale shops at the city market business center and second-hand clothes are purchased from Karume second-hand goods city market center and sold retail to customers at Buguruni. She has been in the business for three years and her plan is to open and run a wholesale clothing shop. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Brankica

texts.en:
Brankica Kujundžić is 49 and comes from the village of Dobrnja near the town of Tuzla. She is married and her husband is retired but he sells medicinal herbs. They have one nine-year-old daughter. Brankica sells used clothes in her own store. Beside that she breeds chickens for her own use and some to sell.

Brankica is already a loan client of WWI ( Žene za Žene International ). She has requested a loan through WWI in the amount of 1000 KM to purchase used clothes to resell. Her husband`s pension is not so much and the income from Brankica`s business is very important for them.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes to resell

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia A. Ally is a Tanzanian married woman and entrepreneur.  She runs a food shop at Buguruni Ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells varieties of cereal crops such as wheat flour, maize flour, groundnuts, dried beans and also sugar. She purchases her business goods from Kariakoo Market wholesale and also direct from the producers. Business income is used to meet her daily family needs. Her business plan is to run a wholesale shop. She needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Aterei A Akurut Mary Gorreti Group

texts.en: A. Mary Gorreti is 30 years old. She is married with six children who go to school, and she takes care of two other dependents. She has been selling chapati for over 5 years in her business. She is using the loan to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, a frying pan, etc., improving her business. She is a hard-working business woman, targeting to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, cooking oil, a frying pan, etc.

loans.name: António Naftal

texts.pt:
António Naftal M.
Localização: Boane
Actividade: Comércio – Venda de Vestuário
Empréstimo: 16,000.00MT
Início: 19/05/2009
Período de pagamento: 16 meses

António de 27 anos nasceu no distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, estudou até nona classe. Casado maritalmente com três filhos, todos menores.
Nacceu e viveu em Boane até hoje, é comerciante e fotografo de profissão a mais de nove anos.
Actualmente dedica-se a venda de refrigerantes e sua actividade tem mais movimento a partir das 17hrs, altura que maior parte da população trabalhadora regressa para suas casas e nesta altura precisaram de refrescar suas mentes. 
Seu rendimento diário varia entre 2,000.00MT  - 2,500.00MT. vive na casa própria junto com a esposa e três filhos.
Com o empréstimo de 16,000.00MT, pretende reforçar seu stock para responder a demanda.
No futuro sonha ampliar seu negocio  e comprar um meio de transporte para o negocio e passeios com a família.
texts.en:
António, 27 years old, was born in the Boane district, Maputo province. He studied at school until ninth grade. He is married with three children, all minors. A native of and still living in Boane, he has been a merchant and professional photographer for more than nine years. Presently he works selling soft drinks. His peak hours are after 5:00 p.m., when the majority of the working population returns home and they need, at that point, to refresh and clear their minds. His daily income varies between 2,000 MT and 2,500 MT. He lives in his own house with his wife and three children. With the loan of 16,000 MT, he plans to build his stock in order to respond to demand. In the future, he dreams of growing his business and buying a mode of transportation for his business and for drives with his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stocks in his shop

loans.name: Kabata North Apolot Helen Group

texts.en:
A. Helen is 40 years old, married with three children, all of whom are in school. She makes local brew as her business. She has been involved in her business of local brewing for over 10 years. She is requesting the loan to purchase yeast and millet flour for making local brew.

Helen is a very hard-working business lady who encourages others to work hard. Her dream is to obtain livestock especially cows and goats.

loans.use: To purchase yeast and millet flour for making local brew

loans.name: Armando Salomão

texts.pt:
Armando Salomão N.
Localização: Boane
Actividade: Habitação – Compra de material de construção  
Montante de Empréstimo: 10,000.00MT
Início: 19/05/2009
Período de pagamento: 16 meses

Armando de 46 anos nasceu na cidade de Maputo, estudou até sexta classe. Casado e pai de cinco filhos dos quais três são maiores e dois menores. Para além da esposa e filhos sustenta uma irmã estudante.
É alfaiate de profissão e é proprietário de uma alfaiataria e têm empregado duas pessoas.
Tem um rendimento liquido mensal de 5,000.00MT.
É segundo empréstimo com HLUVUKU e já vinha trabalhando com Procredit, mas acabou abandonando pela distancia entre sua residência e este banco de micro finanças que acarretava mais custos.
Com o empréstimo pretende melhorar as condições de habitabilidade da família e sonha solicitar outro empréstimo para equipar sua casa.
texts.en:
Armando, 46 years old, was born in the city of Maputo and attended school until sixth grade. He is married and is a father of five children, of whom three have reached the age of majority and two are minors. In addition to his wife and children, he provides for a sister who is a student. Armando is a tailor by profession, the owner of a tailor shop with two employees. He has a monthly liquid income of 5,000 MT. This is his second loan with Hluvuku. He used to deal with Procredit, but he wound up discontinuing that because of the expenses incurred due to the distance between his home and that microfinancing bank. With this loan, he plans to improve living conditions for his family, and he dreams of requesting another loan to furnish his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material to build family home.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie T. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 31 years old. Rosalie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, canned goods, and other products in the local community. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Rosalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.

Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rosalie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education and to provide the needs of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Azarias Alberto

texts.pt:
Azarias Alberto M.
Localização: Boane
Actividade: Comércio – Venda de Produtos
Empréstimo: 13,000.00MT
Início: 19/05/2009
Período de pagamento: 16 meses

Azarias nasceu no distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, estudou até sexta classe. Casado maritalmente com nove filhos, três dos quais são estudantes.
Viveu em Chibuto até 2006, tendo se mudado com a esposa e filhos para o distrito de Boane.
É comerciante e vende produtos de primeira necessidade. O rendimento diário varia entre 1,500.00MT a 2,000.00MT, consegue fazer pequenas poupanças.
Este é segundo empréstimo com a Hluvuku, e antes terá contraído outro empréstimo com BCI um banco comercial. Não foi capaz de nos dizer o que fez lhe mudar de parceiro financeiro.
Com empréstimo de 13,000.00MT, pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria e diversificar os produtos.
No futuro pretende ampliar sua residência e investir na agro-pecuária.
texts.en:
Azarias was born in the district of Chibuto, Gaza province. He studied until sixth grade. He is married with nine children, three of whom are students. He lived in Chibuto until 2006, when he moved with his wife and children to Boane district. He is a merchant, selling basic foodstuffs and necessities. His daily income varies between 1,500 MT and 2,000 MT, and he manages to put a little aside. This is his second loan with Hluvuku. Before this, he contracted another loan with BCI, a commercial bank. He was unable to tell us what made him change his financial provider. With a loan of 13,000 MT, he plans to increase his volume of merchandise and diversify his stock. In the future, he plans to build onto his home and invest in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in his shop

loans.name: Cèdé Chantal

texts.fr: A. Cèdé Chantal est née le 14 Janvier 1962 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Chantal est mariée à Candide ADONON et est mère de six enfants, tous majeurs. Chantal vit avec sa famille à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. C'est les produits de la brasserie (boissons sucrées et eaux minérales) et des jus de fruit que vend Chantal ainsi que de l'eau glacée. Chantal achète ses produits de brasserie dans les dépôts de Cotonou chez les semi-grossistes. Quand aux matières premières des jus de fruit(ananas, orange, bissap, baobab, maïs, etc.) Chantal les achète à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Chantal a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits de ALIDé. Chantal respecte bien ses échéances de remboursement. Actuellement, Chantal sollicite un cinquième crédit pour s'approvisionner en quantité importante en boissons sucrées et eaux minérales afin de faire face aux nombreuses exigences de ses fidèles clients.
texts.en:
A. Cèdé Chantal was born in January 14, 1962 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to Candide ADONON and is the mother of six children, all of age. Chantal lives with her family in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. What she sells are pub items (soft drinks and mineral waters) and fruit juices, as well as ice water. She buys these goods from outlets in Cotonou from semi-wholesalers. As for the fruit juices ingredients (bananas, oranges, hibiscus flowers, baobab, corn, etc.), she buys these in Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. Chantal has already benefited from four Alidé loans. She really honors her repayment schedule. Currently, she’s requesting a fifth loan for stocking up on sizable amounts of soft drinks and mineral waters, so as to cope with the numerous demands of her loyal customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy twenty 6-packs of soft drinks, a 50-kg sack of sugar, six measures of dried hibiscus flowers, and some bananas and oranges

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky D. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 38 years old. Vicky is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Vicky owns and operates a specialized business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from engaging in traditional gold mining known as pamiling. They work hard so that they can pan enough gold for the day and sell it for the needs of the family. Sometimes, if they have enough capital, Vicky is the one who buys the gold from her co-miners and delivers it to the city.

In 2008, Vicky joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vicky has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Vicky is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Vicky from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Carolina Ismael

texts.pt:
Carolina Ismael C.
Localização: Boane
Actividade: Habitação – Compra de material
Empréstimo: 15,000.00MT
Início: 19/05/2009
Período de pagamento: 16 meses

Carolina de 39 anos nasceu na Província de Zambézia, estudou até sexta classe. Casada com quatro filhos, todos menores e dois já estudam.
Viveu na Zambézia até 1995, tendo se mudado junto com o marido para Boane, onde vivem na casa própria até hoje.
A Sra. Carolina vive de negocio e trabalha 8hrs por dia, tem rendimento mensal de 4,000.00MT.
É quinto empréstimo com a Hluvuku e pretende com o mesmo ampliar a residência familiar que já não satisfaz as necessidades da família.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para terminar com as obras e mobilar a residência.
texts.en:
Carolina, 39 years old, was born in Zambézia province and attended school until sixth grade. She is married with four children, all of whom are minors and two are already in school. She lived in Zambézia until 1995, when she moved with her husband to Boane where they still live in their own home. Ms. Carolina makes a living from her business and works eight hours a day. Her monthly income is 4,000 MT. This is her fifth loan with Hluvuku and with it she plans to build onto her family home, which no longer satisfies the needs of her family. In the future, she plans to request further loans to finish the work and furnish her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build on family home.

loans.name: Cecília Jeremias

texts.pt:
Cecília de 41 anos nasceu no distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, estudou até quinta classe. Viúva com três filhos, dois dos quais são menores e a estudar.
Ficou viúva quando tinha dois filhos, tendo sofrido muito depois da morte do marido. Foi expulsa da casa pelos familiar do falecido marido, mas felizmente conseguiu construir casa própria e teve o terceiro filho com outro marido, mas não chegaram de viver juntos.
A sua principal fonte de rendimento é venda roupa usada e mobília trazida do norte de Moçambique que lhe permite obter uma renda de 7,000.00MT por mês, o que garante-lhe o sustento.
Vive na casa própria e com empréstimo de 10,000.00MT tenciona aumentar a sua capacidade de compra de mercadoria, o que irá reduzir o número de viagens.
No futuro tenciona construir um pequeno estabelecimento comercial na sua casa para evitar viagens constantes.
texts.en:
Cecília, 41 years old, was born in Boane district, Maputo province and attended school until fifth grade. She is a widow with three children, two of whom are minors and are at school. Cecília became a widow when she had two children and suffered a lot after the death of her husband. She was kicked out of the house by her late husband's family, but luckily managed to build her own home. She had her third child with another husband, but they have never lived together. Her principal source of income is from selling clothes and furniture, brought from the north of Mozambique. This provides her an income of 7,000 MT per month, on which she is able to live. She lives in her own home. With a loan of 10,000 MT, she intends to increase the amount of merchandise she can buy which will reduce the number of trips to the north. In the future, she plans to build a small shop in her house in order to avoid constant travelling.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan R. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 18 years old. Joan is married and has an infant. To make a living, Joan owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste and various other products in the local community. Joan has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joan is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Joan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Celestino Sebastião

texts.pt:
Celestino Sebastião C.
Localização: Boane
Actividade: Habitação – Compra de material de construção 
Empréstimo: 15,200.00MT
Início: 19/05/2009
Período de pagamento: 16 meses

Celestino nasceu no distrito da Manhiça, Província de Maputo, estudou até terceira classe. Casado maritalmente com seis filhos, sendo dois maiores e todos ainda vão a escola.
Viveu em Manhiça até 1970, tendo se mudado junto com a esposa para Boane no mesmo ano.
É carpinteiro de profissão e é proprietário de uma carpintaria e emprega duas pessoas. Sua renda mensal é de 5,000.00MT.
Com empréstimo de 15,200.00MT pretende melhorar a residência familiar e seu maior sonho é construir uma carpintaria de maior capacidade.
texts.en:
Celestino Sebastião C. Location: Boane Activity: Purchase construction materials Loan amount: 15,200 MT Start date: 19/05/2009 Payment period: 16 months Celestino was born in the district of Manhiça in the province of Maputo, and attended school through the third grade. He is married and has six children, two of them now adults. All of them are still in school. He lived in Manhiça until 1970, when he and his wife moved to Boane. He is a carpenter by trade, and owns a workshop that employs two people. His monthly income is 5,000 MT. With the requested loan of 15,200 MT he plans to improve his family's home, and his greatest dream is to build a larger carpentry workshop.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build family's house

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie C. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 21 years old. Rosemarie is married and has an infant. To make a living, Rosemarie is starting a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste and various other products in the local community. Rosemarie is just starting up this business.

In 2009, Rosemarie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Rosemarie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell for the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia A. is from the village of Napilan. She is 44 years old, married, and has one adult child. Letecia owns and operates a business raising crops for sale, primarily fruits & vegetables. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Letecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Chale Muamuma

texts.pt:
Chale M. Camisa
Localização: Boane
Actividade: Habitação – Compra de material de construção 
Empréstimo: 10,500.00MT
Início: 19/05/2009
Período de pagamento: 16 meses

Chale de 48 anos nasceu em Mopeia, Província de Cabo Delgado, estudou até sexta classe. Casado maritalmente com seis filhos, um maior e outros são menores, todos vão a escola.
Veio de Mopeia para Boane em missão de serviço e quando reformou decidiu fixar-se definitivamente no distrito de Boane. 
Para além da esposa e filhos, vive também com sua mãe. 
É carpinteiro de profissão e conta com ajuda de dois empregados. Produzem artigos mais solicitados pelos clientes, maioritariamente bases de camas e portas.
É segundo empréstimo com Hluvuku, tendo o primeiro sido aplicado para legalização do terreno no qual ele pretende iniciar a construção de uma residência familiar com melhores condições.
texts.en:
Chale, 48 years old, was born in Mopeia, Cabo Delgado province. He studied at school until grade six. He is married with six children, one has reached his majority, the others are minors, and all go to school. He went from Mopeia to Boane for his military service, and when he was discharged he decided to stay permanently in the Boane district. In addition to his wife and children, he also lives with his mother. By profession, he is a carpenter and he has the help of two employees. They produce the articles most requested by their customers, mostly bedsteads and doors. This is his second loan with Hluvuku. He applied the first to register his title to the land on which he plans to begin construction of a family home with better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build family home

loans.name: Dalina João

texts.pt:
Dalina de 54 anos nasceu na cidade de Maputo, estudou até segunda classe. Viúva com quatro filhos, com idades entre 10 e 17 anos e todos são estudantes.
Viveu na cidade de Maputo até 1976, tendo se mudado para Boane quando tornou-se casada. tornou-se viúva a 5 anos e neste momento suporta a família sozinha.

Vive de pequenos negócios ambulatórios e recebe pensão do falecido marido, vive em casa própria, embora ainda em construçao, uma vez que está sendo construida em fases, devido a capacidade financeira.

Este é quarto empréstimo com a Hluvuku sempre para mesma actividade, com o mesmo pretende continuar com o levantamento das paredes e comprar material de cobertura da parte da casa que está sendo ampliada.

No futuro pretende construir pequeno estabelecimento comercial e desenvolver sua actividade sem ter que deslocar para fora de casa.
texts.en:
Dalina, 54 years old, was born in the city of Maputo. She studied until grade two at school. A widow, she has four children aged 10-17 years and they all are students. She lived in Maputo until 1976, when she moved to Boane where she met her late husband. She is a maid and makes a living off selling products on the street, and her late husband's pension. She lives in her own house, which is still under construction. The house is being built in phases because of limited financial resources to build it all at once. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku, still for the same purpose of continuing to construct her house. With this loan she plans to continue to erect walls around her home and buy material to expand her home. In the future, she plans to build a small business establishment and carry out her business activities without having to go far from home.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build family home

loans.name: Lucienne

texts.fr: D. Lucienne est née vers 1969 dans le Département de l'Ouémé. Lucienne est mariée à GAOUNGA Lucien, chauffeur de profession. Lucienne est mère de six (6) enfants. L'aîné est âgé de 24 ans et le benjamin de 10 ans. Ces enfants sont encore à la charge de Lucienne et de Lucien. Lucienne et sa famille vivent à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Lucienne est dans la restauration. En effet, Lucienne vend du riz, de haricot, de pâte de maïs, de manioc et de causette d'igname. C'est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Lucienne fait ses provisions de restauration. Lucienne a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits de ALIDé et a bien remboursé ces crédits. Actuellement, Lucienne sollicite un quatrième crédit de ALIDé pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
D. Lucienne was born around 1969 in Ouémé County. She is married to GAOUNGA Lucien, a driver by profession. She is the mother of six children. The eldest is 24, and the youngest is 10. These children are still in their care. Lucienne and her family live in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is in the restaurant business. Basically, she sells rice, beans, and mashes made of cornmeal, cassava, or yam chips. Her supplies are gotten from Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. Lucienne has already benefited from three Alidé loans and has repaid them. Currently, she’s requesting a fourth loan from Alidé to satisfy her customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat d'un sac de maïs de 50Kg, de deux sacs de riz de 50Kg, de 25 Kg de haricot, de 25 litres d'huile d'arachide et de bois de chauffage.

loans.name: Eusébio Gilberto

texts.pt:
Eusébio Gilberto M.
Localização: Boane
Actividade: Habitação – Compra de material de construção 
Empréstimo: 10,000.00MT
Início: 19/05/2009
Período de pagamento: 16 meses

Eusébio nasceu no distrito de Manjacaze, Província de Gaza, estudou até decima primeira classe. Casado e tem seis filhos todos maiores de idade, cinco dos quais ainda vão a escola.
Viveu em Manjacaze e aos dezassete anos foi para cidade de Maputo para continuar com estudos onde veio a casar em 1980.
É técnico de saúde de profissão e reformado na mesma área. Depois da reforma optou por aprender negocio de modo a aumentar a renda familiar e ocupar a tempo inteiro.
A sua renda mensal incluindo a pensão de reforma é 5,000.00MT.
Este é o quinto empréstimo com a Hluvuku e com este valor tenciona melhorar a residência familiar. 
Seu grande sonho é ter sua habitação concluída e equipada.
texts.en:
Eusébio was born in the Manjacaze district, Gaza province. He studied at school until grade 11. He is married with six children, all of whom have reached the age of majority, and five of whom are still in school. He lived in Manjacaze, and when he was seventeen years old, he went to the city of Maputo to continue his studies. He married there in 1980. By profession, he is a health technician, and when he retired he was still in this profession. After retiring , he chose to learn business as a way to augment his family income, and so he would be occupied full time. His monthly income including his retirement pension is 5,000 MT. This is his fifth loan with Hluvuku, and with this sum he intends to improve his family home. His big dream is to have his home finished and furnished.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build family home

loans.name: Fonseca

texts.pt:
Fonseca N.
Localização: Boane
Actividade: Comércio – Venda de produtos de primeira necessidade  
Montante de Empréstimo: 20,000.00MT
Início: 19/05/2009
Período de pagamento: 16 meses

Fonseca de 40 anos nasceu em Angoche, Província de Nampula, estudou até decima segunda classe. Casado e ainda sem filhos.
Saiu de Angoche em 1988 e veio para cidade de Maputo para cumprir chamamento militar, depois casou se e decidiu construir no distrito de Boane que dista 30 Kms da cidade de Maputo.
O casal vive em casa própria e trabalham 10 hrs por dia junto com a esposa, iniciaram o negocio em 2004 e vendem produtos de primeira necessidade.
Com o empréstimo de 20,000.00MT pretendem aumentar o stock para evitar mais viagens para as compras na cidade de Maputo.
No futuro gostaria de ter ampliado o negócio, construindo um talho para venda de carne que é bastante procurada na zona.
texts.en:
Fonseca, 40 years old, was born in Angoche, Nampula province. He studied in school until twelfth grade. He's married and is still without children. He left Angoche in 1988 and went to the city of Maputo to complete his military service. After he got married and decided to build a home in the district of Boane, which is 30 km from Maputo. The couple live in their own home and work ten hours a day together. They began their business in 2004, selling basic necessities. With this loan of 20,000 MT, they plan to increase their stock to avoid more trips for purchases in Maputo. In the future, he would like to grow his business, building a butcher shop to sell meat, which is in great demand in that region.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in his shop

loans.name: Iolanda Felismina Doira

texts.pt:
Iolanda Felismina Doira M.
Localização: Boane
Actividade: Habitação – Compra de material de construção  
Montante de Empréstimo: 13,200.00MT
Início: 20/05/2009
Período de pagamento: 16 meses

Iolanda de 41 anos nasceu no distrito da manhiça, Província de Maputo, estudou até nona classe. Viúva e mãe de três filhos de 22, 19 e 10 anos, respectivamente. Todos estudam.
Transferiu-se da vila da Manhiça para Boane em 1987 quando casou.
Trabalha na Associação Khidlimukaa 5 anos como secretária executiva com horário das 7:30 às 15:30, tem como salário mensal 3,000.00MT e vive na casa própria.
É quarto empréstimo com a Hluvuku, tendo desembolsado 6,000.00MT, 7,300.00MT e 10,000.00MT, respectivamente, todos foram para habitação.
No futuro sonha concluir a sua residência e comprar mobiliário.
texts.en:
Iolanda, 41 years old, was born in Manhiça district, Maputo province. She studied until ninth grade. She is a widow and mother of three children, 22, 19 and 10 years old respectively. They're all in school. She moved from Manhiça to Boane in 1987 when she got married. She has worked for the Khidlimukaa Association for five years as an executive secretary. Her hours are 7:30 a.m. until 3:30 p.m., and she receives 3,000 MT a month as her salary. She lives in her own home. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku. She has received 6,000 MT, 7,300 MT and 10,000 MT respectively, all were for housing. In the future, she dreams of finishing her home and buying furniture.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build family home

loans.name: Wédayamana 1(Confiance En Soi-Même) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Wédayamana 1  est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Sirakélé de la ville de Koutiala région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec  en moyenne 35ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles excellent uniquement   dans la culture de l’arachide.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe   Wédayamana 1 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre prêts précédents, elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture,  au grand marché de Koutiala ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Wédayamana 1 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 65 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Wédayamana 1 Group is a group of married women from the village of Sirakélé in the main city of Koutiala in the Sikasso region (Mali's third administrative region). The women live in traditional large, extended families and have an average age of 35 and at least five children each. Their sole business is growing peanuts. Anxious to make their agricultural business profitable, the members of the Wédayamana 1 Group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program five years ago. Having fully repaid their first four loans, they are now on their fifth farming loan. The current loan will be used to buy peanut seeds and small items of farm equipment and fertilizer at the main market in Koutiala. At the end of the off-season, the harvested crops are placed in storage for a certain period to gain value before being sold at the main market of Koutiala and surrounding markets at retail (and often wholesale) prices. The produce is sold for cash to customers who generally come from the large towns. Once their agricultural produce has been sold, the members of the Wédayamana 1 Group each expect to make a profit of CFA 65,000, which will be used to repay the loan interest and to cover everyday family expenses.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and minor supplies

loans.name: Adèle

texts.fr: S. Adèle est née le 10/05/1968 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique  de la République du Bénin. Mais Adèle est originaire d'Agonlin dans le Département du Mono. Adèle est mariée à ODOUTAN  Simplice, mécanicien vélomoteur. Adèle et Simplice ont deux enfants Mohammed et Iswath tous scolarisés. Adèle vit avec sa famille au quartier Agontinkon à Cotonou. Adèle a eu un bref cursus scolaire et alla après en apprentissage de couture. Avant la fin de sa formation, Adèle abandonna la couture pour faire de petits commerces. Actuellement, Adèle vend des fruits d'avocat de façon ambulante. Adèle a déjà eu deux crédits de ALIDé pour développer son activité de vente de fruits d'avocat. Adèle veut diversifier son activité avec la vente de chaussures et tissus en provenance de Lomé, Capitale du Togo, pays frontalier au Bénin. C'est la raison pour laquelle Adèle sollicite un troisième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
S. Adèle was born on May 10, 1968 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. But she traces her roots to Agonlin in Mono County. She is married to ODOUTAN Simplice, a motorbike mechanic. Adèle and Simplice have two children, Mohammed and Iswath who are both in school. Adèle lives with her family in the Agontinkon in Cotonou. She attended school for a short time and afterwards entered into a sewing apprenticeship. Before completing her training, she dropped sewing for working in a small business. Currently, she sells avocados door-to-door. Adèle has already had two Alidé loans for developing her business selling avocados. She wants to diversify her business with the sale of shoes and cloth from Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country bordering Benin. This is why she’s requesting her third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 36 pairs of shoes and ten 12-meter bolts of Hitarget cloth

loans.name: Jequicene

texts.pt:
Name (Nome do Cliente):jequicene C. 
Internal Client ID (Numero do Expediente do Empréstimo)18495
 Location (Localização / Sucursal): Namaacha
Primary Activity (Atividade Primaria): Habitação
 Loan Requested (Valor do Empréstimo em Meticais:22.000mt
Repayment Term (Numero de Prestações Mensais): 14
Loan Use (Uso do empréstimo, em 1 frase) compra e criaçao de pintos para revenda
Disbursement Hluvuku (Data de Desembolso do Empréstimo):26/05/09 
Dêscription (Historial


Jequicene nasceu em Inhambane, solteiro de 49 anos de idade, estudou ate a 5ª classe devido à falta de transporte, pois a escola encontrava-se muito distante da casa. Pai de 12 filhos: com idades compreendidas entre os 5anos aos 25 anos de idade. A mais velha já casada e os restantes vão à escola.   
Jequicene sai de Inhambane a Namaacha, uma vila na fronteira de Swazilândia, a procura de emprego. Começa a trabalhar como guarda nas irmãs franciscanas durante 12 anos. Mas devido ao elevado custo de vida, pois este ganhava pouco, começa a praticar negócio de venda de potes abandonando assim o emprego e dedicar se mais aos negócios que lhe davam bons lucros. Com o rendimento dos negócios ele consegue construir duas casas, uma vês que tem duas Esposas, e ainda comprar uma viatura para lhe facilitar no seu trabalho. Agora para além da venda de potes, faz transporte semi-colectivo de passageiros (vulgo chapa) e tem um rendimento diário de 200.00mtn e também faz criação de frangos. Esta actividade aprendeu nas irmãs franciscanas. ( onde gastava 12,000.00mtn para criar 200 pintos).
Nesta actividade avícola tem ganhado um rendimento de 5,000. 00mt em cada ciclo e a sua criação aumentou com o empréstimo que  teve na Hluvuku- Kiva; hoje em dia cria 500.00 pintos gastando 30.000.00MT em cada fase tendo assim um lucro no valor de 12.000.00MT. E consegue custei ar as despesas familiares (cuida dos seus pais que vivem com ele em sua casa) e os estudos dos seus filhos. Por mês consegue poupar 3.000.00MT 

Este é o segundo empréstimo de Jequicene na Hluvuku e Kiva. Os primeiros 18.000.00MT foram usados para ampliar a criação de frangos, conseguiu pagar sem nenhum problema e pede este segundo empréstimo de 22.000.00MT para aumentar o volume seu stock.Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para fazer crescer o negocio, cada vez mais.
texts.en:
Jequicene was born in Inhambane. He is single, 49 years old, and studied until fifth grade. He had to stop school because of a lack of transportation, since the school was very far from his house. He is the father of 12 children, whose ages range from five to 25 years old. The oldest is already married and the rest go to school. Jequicene left Inhambane for Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, looking for work. He began by working as a guard for Franciscan sisters for 12 years. But because of the rising cost of living, and because he wasn't earning much, he began a business selling earthenware pots and gave up his job to concentrate on more lucrative businesses. With his business earnings, he managed to build two houses, since he had two wives, and also bought a vehicle to help him with his work. Now, in addition to selling earthenware pots, he provides informal public transportation services and has a daily income of 200 mtn. He also raises chickens. This occupation he learned with the Franciscan sisters (where he would spend 12,000 mtn to raise 200 chicks). This poultry business earns an income of 5,000 mt in every cycle, and it is growing with the loan he had from Hluvuku-Kiva. These days, raising 500 chicks costs 30,000 MT in each phase, and therefore has a profit of 12,000MT. And he manages to pay family expenses (caring for his parents who live with him in his house) and his children's studies. Each month he is able to save 3,000 MT. This is the second loan for Jequicene with Hluvuku and Kiva. The first 18,000 MT were used to grow his chicken raising business. He managed to repay it with no problem, and asks for this second loan of 22,000 MT to enlarge the size of his stock. He is confident that he will repay it ahead of time and and ask for a new loan to grow his business, each time a little more.

Translated from Portuguese by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his stock of poultry.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nekruz

texts.ru: Некруз Ватанов проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 28 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Некруз более 2 лет занимается земледелием, он выращивает картофель. Клиент просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить удобрения. Клиент после применения удобрений на земле может получить хороший урожай, который покроит его расходы  и он планирует продать часть своего урожая населению.
texts.en:
Nekruz V. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 28 years old. He is married and has two children. Nekruz has been in agriculture for more than two years and grows potatoes. The client is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. He can get a good harvest after using fertilizer on his land which will cover his expenses. He plans to sell part of his harvest to the locals.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the land

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joana Estevão Langa

texts.pt:
Name (Nome do Cliente): Joana estevao langa M. 
Internal Client ID (Numero do Expediente do Empréstimo) 18490
 Location (Localização / Sucursal): Namaacha
Primary Activity (Atividade Primaria): Habitação
 Loan Requested (Valor do Empréstimo em Meticais:25.000mt
Repayment Term (Numero de Prestações Mensais): 14
Loan Use (Uso do empréstimo, em 1 frase) compra de material de construçao
Disbursement Hluvuku (Data de Desembolso do Empréstimo): 26/05/08
Dêscription (Historial

Joana tem 48 anos de idade, nasceu na província de Gaza, viúva, tem quatro filhos: com idades compreendias entre os 12 aos 26 anos de idade. Os dois mais velhos já estão a trabalhar como Professores primários, a penúltima filha esta no convento a seguir a vida religiosa, Joana seu sustenta o seu filho mais novo e a sua sobrinha órfã de mãe e abandonado pelo pai. 
Joana sai de Gaza após seu marido ter sido transferido para trabalhar em Namaacha uma vila na fronteira de Suazilândia. Dois anos depois o seu pedido de transferência sai e ela vai ao encontro do marido levando consigo a sua família.
