Chegado a Namaacha foi afecta numa das escolas primarias do distrito como professora, trabalha a mais de 20 anos na função publica com um salário mensal no valor de 5.500.00mt e no período da noite tem feito horas extras onde ganha um subsidio de 3.000.00mt.
A vida fica difícil quando seu marido perde a vida deixando a com 4 filhos por criar. Aproxima se a uma instituição bancária (BIM) solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 11.000.00mt para dar continuidade da obra que iniciou com o seu falecido marido, só que esta que não foi concluída devido ao elevado custo de material de construção e tinha que reembolsar o credito em 5 anos pagando mensalmente 550.00mt.
 Após a abertura da Hluvuku-Adsema neste distrito, ela aproxima se solicitando um empréstimo para dar continuidade da obra. Hoje ela tem uma casa do tipo três (concluída) sendo este o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva.
Ela agradece por lhe terem ajudado a realizar seu sonho e dar mais conforto a sua família. Este è o terceiro empréstimo de Joana na Hluvuku, e o segundo com Kiva . O primeiro empréstimo de 10,000.00 mt usou para coleccionar o material de construção, e pede o segundo de 25,000.00mt para concluir a obra de ampliação. Assim que Joana terminar de pagar este terceiro empréstimo também de 25.000.00MT que usou para construir o murro da sua casa, pretende pedir outro para comprar tijoleiras para embelezar o chão da sua casa.
texts.en:
Joana is 48 years old, she was born in the province of Gaza, she is a widow with 4 children, who are between 12 and 26 years old. The two older ones will be working as elementary school teachers, her eldest daughter is preparing to be a nun. Joana supports her youngest kid and her nice who is an orphan, as she lost her mother and was abandoned by his father. Joana left Gaza after her husband was transferred to work at Namaacha a village at the frontier of Suazilandia. Two years after he was transferred she went to see his husband and took her family with her. When she arrived she started working as a teacher at an elementary school and worked there for 20 years with a monthly salary of 5.500.00mt, she also worked overtime at night and earned extra pay of 3.000mt. Her life turned very difficult when her husband died leaving her with 4 children to raise. She went to a bank (BIM) to request a loan for 11.000mt to keep on building their home which was not finished due to the high cost of building materials, she paid the loan back in 5 years, paying 550mt monthly. After the opening of Hluvuku-Adsema in this district, she comes to request a loan to keep on building her home. She finished her house and this is her third loan from Hluvuku and second with Kiva. She is very thankful for the help she received to obtain her dream of providing more comfort to her family. Her first loan was for 10,000mt was used to buy material for construction, the second for 25,000mt was to finish the construction. The third one is to build a wall and she wants to ask for another loan to buy bricks to embellish the floor of her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build families house

loans.name: Lucia Isac

texts.pt:
Name (Nome do Cliente): lúcia isac N. 
Internal Client ID (Numero do Expediente do Empréstimo)18568
 Location (Localização / Sucursal): Namaacha
Primary Activity (Atividade Primaria): comercio
 Loan Requested (Valor do Empréstimo em Meticais:10.000mt
Repayment Term (Numero de Prestações Mensais): 14
Loan Use (Uso do empréstimo, em 1 frase) compra e venda de potes
Disbursement Hluvuku (Data de Desembolso do Empréstimo): 26/05/08
Dêscription (Historial


Lucia nasceu em maputo tem 42 anos de idade, vive maritalmente estudou ate a 10ª classe é mãe de três filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 18 aos 24 anos de idade. As duas mais velhas estão empregadas na função publica o mais novo freqüenta a escola.

Lúcia quando frequentava a 6ª classe esta fica grávida da sua primeira filha, esta que nasce sem nenhuma assistência do pai pois este recusou a filha ainda no ventre da sua mãe. Após o parto Lúcia continua a viver em casa dos seus progenitores estes que cuidaram dela nos momentos mais difíceis da sua vida. Três anos depois ela retoma os seus estudos e consegue fazer a 10ª classe, ano seguinte consegue ingressar no Centro de Formação de Professores Primários em Namaacha uma vila na fronteira da Suazilândia, onde abandona o curso após ter se juntado com seu actual esposo. O esposo da lhe um valor para iniciar com seu próprio negócio de venda de potes adquiridas em Maputo e revendidas na Suazilândia actividade esta que pratica ate então. Nas quartas e sábados tem estado a vender no mercado informal. O melhor pote é o número 1x10,2x10 e 3x10 tem comprado a 120.00mt, 180.00mt, e 200.00mt e revendido a 210.00mt, 270.00mt e a 330.00mt consecutivamente. Tem tido um lucro mensal no valor de 6.000mt e consegue poupar 2.000mt. para alem de potes ela tem uma machamba de hortícolas na sua casa nomeadamente alface e couve e tem lhe ajudado no seu dia-a-dia no auto sustento da sua família

Este é o quinto empréstimo de Lúcia na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva. Os quatro primeiros foram usados para aumentar o volume do negócio, valores que pagou sem nenhum problema e solicita este de 10.000.00mt para o mesmo fim. Está confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo determinado e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Lucia was born in Maputo, she is 42 years old and is married. She finished high school and has 3 children who are between 18 to 24 years old. Her two oldest daughters are working for the government and the youngest one is still in school. Lucia got pregnant with her first child when she started high school, her child was born without the assistant of the father, as he rejected his daughter. After her first child was born Lucia lived at her parents' house, who took care of her on the most difficult times of her life. Three years later she started studying again and finishes high school. The following year she was able to enter the Center to Form Primary School Teachers in Namaacha a village near Suazilandia, where she abandoned her studies after she got together with her current husband. Her husband gave her money to start her own business selling pots bought in Maputo to be sold in Suazilandia, which is still her current business. On Wednesdays and Saturdays she sells at the market. Her best pots are the numbers 1x10, 2x10 and 3x10 that she buys at 120mt, 180mt and 200mt and she sells at 210mt, 270mt and 330mt respectively. She gets a monthly income of 6.000mt and is able to get a profit of 2.000mt. Besides the pots she has a farm of vegetables at her house that produces lettuce and cabbage and had helped her providing for her family. This is her fifth loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. Her first four loans were used to increase the volume of her business, and she paid without any trouble and she is requesting the current one for the same. She is confident she will pay before the due date and request a new one to finish her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in her business

loans.name: Rosalina Fernando

texts.pt:
Name (Nome do Cliente): Rosalina Fernando D.
Internal Client ID (Numero do Expediente do Empréstimo) 18491
 Location (Localização / Sucursal): Namaacha
Primary Activity (Atividade Primaria): comercio
 Loan Requested (Valor do Empréstimo em Meticais:20.000mt
Repayment Term (Numero de Prestações Mensais): 14
Loan Use (Uso do empréstimo, em 1 frase) compra e venda de potes
Disbursement Hluvuku (Data de Desembolso do Empréstimo): 26/05/08
Dêscription (Historial


Rosalina nasceu em gaza tem 40 anos de idade e casada e mãe de cinco filhos com idades compreendias entre 5 e 23 anos de idade, quatro dos filhos e que vão à escola a mais velha já esta empregada.
Rosalina sai de Gaza quando seu irmão mais velho convida lhe para morar com ele na cidade capital com objectivo de custear os seus estudos. Chegado a capital continua com os seus estudos e teve que interromper na 6ª classe, pois ela fica grávida do seu namorado e seu tio expulsa lhe de casa alegando que não podia responsabilizar se por ela e do seu recém nascido. A vida fica difícil ela consegue arranjar um emprego como empregada domestica onde trabalhou durante três anos, com fundo coletado ela inicia o seu próprio negócio de venda de potes adquiridas em Maputo e revendidas em Namaacha uma vila na fronteira da Suazilândia onde conhece o seu actual esposo que reside naquele distrito.
 Anos depois ela junta se com seu esposo e passa a viver juntos e assim tornou mais fácil o seu negocio. Hoje é proprietária de uma banca de potes no mercado informal que funciona duas vezes por semana (quartas e sábados). Graças a Hluvuku e Kiva tem feito duas viagens em cada semana para reforçar o seu stock. Tem como melhor pote o de numero 1x20 e 4x20. Compra cada a 120.00MT e 250.00MT e revende cada a 270.00MT e 350.00MT consecutivamente. Rosalina, com o empréstimo da hluvuku viu seu negocio crescer e tem de um lucro mensal no valor de 7.000.00MT e consegue poupar 1.000.00MT porque para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pelos seus sogros que vivem com ela em sua casa. Encontra se também a mobiliar a sua casa.

Este e o terceiro empréstimo de Rosalina Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva. Os dois primeiros foram usados para reforçar o seu negócio de potes e pede este terceiro para aumentar o volume do seu stock e está confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para construir um estabelecimento estável para a revenda dos seus potes.
texts.en:
Rosalina was born in Gaza, she is 40 years old, she is married and has five children who are between 5 to 23 years old, 4 of her children go to school and her oldest if pregnant. Rosalina left Gaza when her oldest brother offered her to live with him at the capital city in order to pay for her studies. When she arrived to the capital she studied but interrupted her studies when she got pregnant with her boyfriend. Her uncle turned her away saying he couldn't be responsible of her and her new born. Her life turned difficult and she was able to get a job as domestic assistant where she worked for 3 years, with the money she saved, she started her own business selling pots bought in Maputo and sold in Namaacha a village near the frontier with Suazilandia where she met her current husband who lived in that district. Years later she moved in with her husband and life and business turned easier. Today she owns a spot to sell pots at the market that works twice a week (Wednesdays and Saturdays). Thanks to Hluvuku and Kiva she has been able to travel twice a week to increase her stock. Her best pots are the numbers 1x20 and 4x20. She buys them at 120mt and 250mt and sells them at 270mt and 350mt respectively. Rosalina watched her business grow with the loans obtaining a monthly income of 7.000mt and gaining a profit of 1.000mt. Besides her two children she is responsible for her parents in law who live with her at home. She is also looking to buy furniture. This is her third loan with Hluvuku and her second with Kiva. The first two were used to increase her business and she is requesting the third to increase the volume of her stock, she is confident she will pay it back on time and will request a new loan to build a stable store to sell her pots.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in her business

loans.name: Said

texts.ru: Саидов Саид более 3 лет занимается земледелием. До этого он 10 лет работал учителем. Т.к. заработной платы не хватало, он начал свой бизнес. Саид проживает в районе Хамадони. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Клиент  просит у нас кредит, чтобы собратьурожай и посеить новый. Он выращивает в основеном рис. Саид получая второй урожай  может получить хорошую прибыль, которая покроит его расходы.
texts.en:
Said S. has been engaged in agriculture for more than three years. Before this, he worked for ten years as a teacher, but his wages were not enough and thus he began his business. Said lives in the region of Hamadoni. He is married and has five children. The client is asking us for a loan, in order to to gather in the harvest and to prepare the new one. On the whole, he cultivates rice. Said receiving a second harvest will be able to receive a good profit that cuts his expenses.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant a harvest as well as new crops

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ana Carla Teresa

texts.pt:
Name (Nome do Cliente): Ana Carla Teresa chichongue capece
Internal Client ID (Numero do Expediente do Empréstimo)18566
 Location (Localização / Sucursal): Namaacha
Primary Activity (Atividade Primaria): Pecuária 
 Loan Requested (Valor do Empréstimo em Meticais:10.000mt
Repayment Term (Numero de Prestações Mensais): 14
Loan Use (Uso do empréstimo, em 1 frase) compra de pintos para engorde
Disbursement Hluvuku (Data de Desembolso do Empréstimo): 01/06/08
Dêscription (Historial



Ana Carla nasceu em Namaacha que faz fronteira com a vizinha Swazilandia tem 26 anos de idade é estudante freqüentando a 12ª classe solteira e sem nenhum filho.

Ana Carla inicia os seus negócios após a morte do seu pai este que morreu por vitima de doença, então vê se obrigada a fazer negócio para custear os seus estudos e ajudar a sua mãe aumentando assim a renda familiar. Ela consegue montar um salão de beleza em sua casa, esta actividade não teve sucesso porque foram surgindo salões muito mais sofisticados e deste modo ela perde os seus clientes e fica na beira da falência. Ela aproxima se á hluvuku solicitando um empréstimo para dar inicio a uma outra activivdade de venda de roupas diversas adquiridas na África do Sul e revendidas na cidade de Maputo. O seu negócio foi crescendo com o empréstimo que teve e ela agradece muito a Hluvuku e Kiva. Com os rendimentos consegue diversificar de actividades. Hoje é também criadora de frangos e pretende ir avante com a actividade e solicita mais um aempréstimo no valor de 10.000.00MT para aumentar o volume de criação comprando 3x100 caixas de frango gastando 21.000.00MT vendendo cada frango a 100.00MT tendo assim de lucro 9.000.00MT, se não houver muitas mortalidades. Para alem da sua irmã responsabiliza se pelo seu sobrinho que vive junto com ela.

Este e o terceiro empréstimo de Ana Carla na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva. Os dois primeiros foram usados para actividades diferentes o primeiro para o salão de beleza e o segundo para a venda de roupa diversa e foram pagos sem nenhum problema. Estes 10. 000.00MT serão usados  para aumentar o volume de criação de frangos, esta muito feliz e acredita que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto.
texts.en:
Ana Carla was born in Namaacha which is at the frontier with Swazilandia, she is 26 years old and is studying her last year of high school, she is single and has no kinds. Ana Carla started her business after her father died due to a illness, she started her business to pay for her studies and help her mother with the family income. She was able to set up a beauty parlor at her house, this activity was not successful because there were several more sophisticated establishments around, so she lost her clients and ended up near bankruptcy. Then she approached Hluvuku for a loan in order to start another business selling clothes bought in South Africa and sold in Maputo. Her business is growing thanks to a loan from Hluvuku and Kiva. With her profit she was able to diversify her activities. Today she also raises chickens and wants to keep on with this activity and is requesting a loan of 10.0000mt to increase the volume of the chickens she raises, buying 3x100 boxes of chicken for 21.0000mt and selling each chicken at 100mt, getting a profit of 9.0000mt, if not too many die. Besides her sister she is responsible for her nephew who live with her. This is the third loan she requests to Hluvuku and second with Kiva. The first two were used for different activities, the first for the beauty parlor and the second to sell clothes and both were paid without any problem. The 10.000mt loan will be used to increase the volume of chicken she raises, she is very happy and sure she will pay her loan before the due date.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock in her business

loans.name: Milo Luis

texts.pt:
Name (Nome do Cliente): Milo luis B.
Internal Client ID 18573
 Location (Localização / Sucursal): Namaacha
Primary Activity (Atividade Primaria): comercio 
 Loan Requested (Valor do Empréstimo em Meticais:10.000mt
Repayment Term (Numero de Prestações Mensais): 14
Loan Use (Uso do empréstimo, em 1 frase) compra e venda de produtos
Disbursement Hluvuku (Data de Desembolso do Empréstimo): 01/06/09
Dêscription (Historial

Milo nasceu em Namaacha, uma vila na fronteira com a Swazilândia tem 24 anos de idade, é solteiro e trabalhador e ainda sem filho. Estudou ate a 10ª classe e teve que interoper para se formar num curso básico da Policia da Republica de Moçambique (P.R. M).

Apos a morte do seu pai, este que era proprietário de uma barraca no mercado central da Namaacha, dá inicio do seu próprio negócio com o fundo da indiminização que teve no serviço do seu pai no valor de 20.000.00MT. Anos depois ele teve que se formar se num curso básico da (P.R. M) que durou um ano. Logo que terminou o curso é afecto no Ministério do Interior como guarda central e já trabalhada amais de quatro anos com salário mensal de 3.000.00MT. Mas porque ele e único na família empregado, não conseguem satisfazer as suas necessidades e solicita um empréstimo no banco proCredito (Banco de Microfinancas) em Maputo para retomar de volta o seu negocio no valor de 20.000.00MT que foram pagos por 2.816.00MT mensal no período de um ano. Devido à aderência dos seus produtos ele já não conseguia satisfazer a necessidade dos seus clientes na totalidade. Numa conversa com seu amigo soube da existência da hluvuku e aproxima se solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00MT para aumentar seus produtos. venda diversos produtos, obtém de lucro no valor de 6.000.00MT mensalmente e conta com ajuda de um empregado que recebe 1.500.00MT por mês e ainda consegue poupar 2.000.00M. 
Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Milo na Hluvuku e primeiro com kiva. Será usado para aumentar o volume dos seus produtos e tem como objectivo satisfazer a necessidade dos seus clientes. Está convencido que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para dar inicia da sua obra.
texts.en:
Milo was born in Namaacha, a village near the frontier with Swazilandia, he is 24 years old, single, hard working and has no kids. He studied until the 10th grade in high school and had to interrupt his basic course to be a Police officer for the Republic of Mozambique (P.R.M.). After his father died, who was the owner of a spot at the central market in Namaacha, Milo started his own business with the money from the indemnity he got from his father's death of 20.000mt. Years later he had to take the basic curse for (P.R.M.) which lasted for a year. After he finished his course he worked at the Interior Ministry as security guard with a monthly salary of 3.000mt. But because he was the only one working in the family they were not able to fulfill their needs and requested a loan to the bank proCredito (Micro-Finance Bank) in Maputo for 20.000mt that he paid at 2.816mt monthly during a year. Because of the high demand for his products he wasn't able to satisfy his client's needs in full. After talking with a friend he learned about Hluvuku and approached to request a loan for 10.000mt to increase his products, and he obtain a monthly income of 6.000mt and has the help of an employee who is paid 1.5000mt a month and is able to profit 2.000mt. This is his first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. The loan will be used to increase the volume of his products in order to fulfill his client's needs. He is convinced he will pay before the due date and request a new loan to start building a house.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the stock in his business

loans.name: Alice

texts.pt:
Name (Nome do Cliente): Alice T.
Internal Client ID (Numero do Expediente do Empréstimo18499
 Location (Localização / Sucursal): Namaacha
Primary Activity (Atividade Primaria): comercio 
 Loan Requested (Valor do Empréstimo em Meticais:10.000mt
Repayment Term (Numero de Prestações Mensais): 14
Loan Use (Uso do empréstimo, em 1 frase) compra e venda de produtos
Disbursement Hluvuku (Data de Desembolso do Empréstimo): 26/05/09
Dêscription (Historial


Alice nasceu em Goba - Namaacha, uma vila na Fronteira com a Swazilandia, tem 40 anos de idade e mãe de quatro filhos com idades compreendas entre os oito e 25 anos de idade, os três mais novos frenquentam a escola.

Alice apois concluir o ensino Primário é transferida para vila de Namaacha que dista 25 km da localidade de goba onde ela nasceu. Continua com os seus estudos e consegue fazer a 7ª classe, mas esta fica grávida e passa a viver com seu marido abandonando assim a escola, Este que era um grande comerciante. Anos depois o seu marido faleceu por motivo de doença e a vida fica difícil, então ela consegue arranjar um emprego na cidade capital (Maputo) como doméstica e trabalha durante dois anos onde recebia 2.300.00MT. Mas teve que abandonar, pois vivia longe dos seus filhos e regressa novamente a Namaacha onde inicia o seu próprio negócio de venda de pão e rebuçados no quintal da sua casa. Na tentativa de aumentar o volume do seu negócio aproxima se a Hluvuku solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00MT para. Tem como melhor produto pão de forma adquirido na vizinha Swazilândia. Para além dos seus filhos Alice não se responsabiliza por ninguém. Consegue, por mês, poupar algum valor. Diz que poderá pagar o empréstimo sem dificuldades e pedir outros para fazer crescer o negocio assim como satisfazer outros planos futuros.
texts.en:
Alice was born in Goba - Namaacha, a town on the on the border of Swaziland. She is 40 years old and the mother of 4 children with ages between 8 and 25 years old. The three youngest are in school. Alice, after completing elementary school, was transferred to the town of Namaacha, which is 25km from Goba where she was born. She continued with her schooling and made it through the 7th grade, but she became pregnant and went to live with her husband abandoning her education. Her husband was a great businessman. Years later her husband passed away from an illness, and her life became difficult. She was able to arrange a job in the capital (Maputo) as a housekeeper, and she worked for 2 years and earned 2,300MT. She had to quit since she lived far from her children so she returned again to Namaacha where she started her own business of selling bread and candies from her yard. In the attempt to grow the volume of her business she approached Hluvuku and solicited a loan in the amount of 10,000MT. Her best product is bread which she acquires in neighboring Swaziland. Besides her children Alice is not responsible for anyone. She is able to save a little each month. She says that she will be able to pay off this loan without difficulties, and she will request other loans to grow her business as well as realize her other future plans.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stocks in her business

loans.name: Odil

texts.ru: Лолаев Одил проживает в районе Явана. Возраст 23 года. Женат, имеет 1 ребенка. Одил более 6 лет занимается земледелием. Он сеит бахчевые растения и семечки. Клиент просит у нас кредит, для посева бахчевых растений и семечек, собрав продать их.
texts.en:
Odil L. lives in the region of Yavana. He is 23 years old, married and has an infant. Odil has been involved in farming for more than six years. He tends melon plants and seedlings. The client requested a loan from us to plant melon plants and seedlings, collecting them to sell.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to plant melon plants and seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of goods

loans.name: Gulomhaidar

texts.ru: Рахимов Гуломхайдар более 3 лет занимается торговлей. Он имеет торговую точку на рынке"Мехргон". Гуломхайдар торгует овощами. Роживает он в районе Явана. Возраст 30 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить сезонные овощи для продажи.
texts.en:
Gulomhaidar R. has been involved in trade for more than three years. He has a trade point in the Mehrgon market. Gulomhaidar trades in vegetables. He lives in the Yavana region. He is 30 years old, married and has two children. This client is requesting a loan in order to purchase seasonal vegetables for sale.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal vegetables for resale

loans.name: Aterei A Alungata Agnes Group

texts.en:
A. Agnes is 28 years old and married with three children of whom two are in school. More so, she is looking after one dependent who is also in school.

Agnes owns a retail shop and she has been operating in her retail business for over a year. She is using the loan to purchase retail items such as sugar, maize, millet flour, salt, matchboxes, soap, cooking oil, etc., adding stock to meet her customers’ demands. Agnes is a hardworking businesswoman whose future prospect is seeing her children educated.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to meet her customers’ demands

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional seeds for the new harvest.

loans.name: Aterei A Asiangi Hedwig Group

texts.en:
A. Hedwig is 39 years old and married with eight children, who are all in school. She is a very hard-working business lady. She has sold fish and tomatoes for over three years.

She is requesting the loan to purchase fish and tomatoes in order to increase her inventory to satisfy customer demand. She also hopes to buy cattle to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fish and tomatoes.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela K. is a married, Tanzanian woman. She makes and sells traditional clothes called Batick at Mnyamani ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the raw materials from wholesale shops at Kariakoo market. She makes different types with different colors of Batick. Many African women use Batick to make dresses.

She has been in the business for three years and needs a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more raw materials to expand her business.

loans.use: To buying raw materials to make Batick.

loans.name: Aterei A Akurut Christine Group

texts.en:
Christine A. is 38 years old and married with six children, who are all in school. She also takes care of three dependents. Christine has sold fish and groundnuts for over ten years in business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase fish and groundnuts in bigger volume in order to improve her inventory. She is a hard-working business lady. Her dream is to educate her children to great heights.

loans.use: To purchase fish and groundnuts in bulk.

loans.name: Argentina De Lurdes

texts.pt:
Argentina nasceu na província de Maputo, de 43 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de três filhos com idades compreendidas entre quatro e 13 anos, estando os dois mais novos a estudarem na escola publica.

Estudou a te sétima classe do antigo sistema e tendo parado porque os seus pais não tinham capacidade financeira para custear os estudos (vivia longe da escola do nível mais alto e precisaria de dinheiro de transporte diário).
Argentina é negociante a mais de 15 anos e possui bastante experiência nesta actividade. Aprendeu fazendo negócios de diversos produtos. Vende lençois que compra na vizinha África do Sul a 450 randes (ZAR) cada jogo de dois lençois com respectivas fronhas  e revende-as a 2.500,00MT cada jogo. Consegue um rendimento diário de 400,00MT com o qual sustenta os filhos e outros gastos familiares, resultado de vendas diárias que variam entre 2.500,00MT - 5.000,00MT. Vive numa casa própria que construira com bastante sacrifício.

Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo com a Hluvuku em parceria com KIVA. Tomou conhecimento da existência da Hluvuku-Adsema através de amigas. Pretende expandir cada vez mais o seu negocio e diversificar os produtos para satisfazer a demanda e ganhar mais rendimentos.
Tem plano de, no futuro mais breve, construir uma casa para os filhos e é por isso que conta com KIVA para mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
Argentina was born in the province of Maputo and is 43 years old. She is a single mother with three kids between the ages of 4 and 13, the two youngest children study at the local public school. Argentina studied through the seventh grade of the the old Mozambican education system, but was forced to stop as her parents could not afford the costs of her studies (they lived far away from the high school and could not afford money for transport to and from school). Argentina is a very experienced businesswoman with 15 years of experience and has dealt with many different products. She currently sells scarves and blankets that she buys in neighboring South Africa for 450 rand (ZAR) and is able to resell in Mozambique for 2,500.00MT each. She is able to make 400,000MT a day which she uses to support her children and pay for other family expenses. Argentina lives in a home that she owns and built with much sacrifice. This is the first time that Argentina has borrowed money from Hluvuku-Adsema through Kiva. She learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through friends. She intends on further expanding her business and diversifying her products to satisfy demand and earn more money. She has plans in the near future to build a house for her children and hopes that Kiva loans will help her to achieve this.

Translated from Portuguese by Cameron Morris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her business inventory

loans.name: Sensa

texts.en:
Sensa M. is a Tanzanian micro entrepreneur and a married woman. She sells traditional clothes called Khanga and Vitenge at Kisiwani ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the goods for her business from the traditional wholesale and retail trading center at Mnazi Mmoja and sells to retail customers. She also runs a cafe at Buguruni and employs two workers.

She needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more goods for her clothing business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her clothing business.

loans.name: Aida Siquice

texts.pt:
Name : Aida Siquice G.
Internal Client ID : 18547
 Location; Boane
Primary Activity: HABITACAO
 Loan Requested; 10.000,00mt
 Repayment Term: 16 
Loan Use; Compra de materiais de construcao
Disbursement Hluvuku; 01/06/09

Dêscription



Aida Siquice G., nasceu na província de inhambane no distrito mais populoso de Massinga. Tem 43 anos de idade é viúva e não teve a sorte de nascer, vive com três sobrinhas. Não conseguiu frenquentar escola porque os pais não tinham condições financeiras para suportar os encargos escolares.
Saiu de inhambane (a 600 km mais a norte do capital do pais) quando separou se do primeiro marido. Chegado a boane casa se com um outro marido, relação que durou apenas 4 anos, que faleceu no ano de 1991 devido à guerra civil que terminou no ano seguinte.
Viu se obrigada a procurar emprego e tendo conseguido na Estação agrária de Umbeluzi (Boane é atravessado por um rio de nome Umbeluzi) onde labora ate hoje.
Solicitou e pagou 3 empréstimos (de 5.00,00MT; 8.500,00MT) com a Hluvuku-Adsema para construir a sua casa porque quando o marido faleceu, morava numa casa de material precário.

Nunca teve credito com outros bancos.  Com o credito de 10.000,00MT pretende ir terminando a sua casa, que esta construindo em fase e habitando na mesma.
No futuro pretende solicitar outros empréstimos para finalizar a habitação.
texts.en:
Aida Siquice G. was born in Massinga, the most populous district of the province of Inhambane. She is 43 years old, is a widow and lives with her three nieces. She was not able to attend school as a girl because her parents could not afford transport to and from school. She left Inhambane (600km north of the capital city, Maputo) when she separated from her first husband. When she arrived in Boane she married another man, the relationship only lasted 4 years as her husband lost his life in 1991 during the Mozambican civil war. After her husband's death she was forced to find work and found it at the Umbeluzi Agriculture Station (the Umbeluzi river passes through Boane) where she has worked to this day. She has received and repaid three loans (5,000.00MT, 8,500.00MT) with Hluvuku-Adsema helping her to build a home to replace the precarious home she was living in after her husband's death. She has never obtained credit from another bank. With this loan of 10,000.00MT she will start finishing the construction of her house. She is building her house in phases and is living in it while construction is being finished. In the future she hopes to request further loans to completely finalize construction of her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Cameron Morris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Jorge

texts.pt:
Name : Jorge T.
Internal Client ID : 18559
 Location; Boane
Primary Activity: HABITACAO
 Loan Requested ; 10.000,00mt
Repayment Term: 16 
Loan Use; Compra de materiais de construcao
Disbursement Hluvuku; 01/06/09

Dêscription

Jorge T., de 55 anos de idade, nasceu na cidade vizinha da Matola, casado e pai de 3 filhos menores de 18 anos. Estudou ate quinta classe, tendo terminado devido à insuficiência financeira dos seus pais. Vive com sua mãe idosa na mesma casa.
Funcionário Publica como servente no Instituto Agrário de Boane a mais de 12 anos onde tem como salário mensal no valor de 2.650,00MT. Consegue suportar os encargos familiares e ainda poupar um pouco para momentos de crise.

Já teve outros créditos com outras instituições de credito que operam no distrincia tendo solicitado o primeiro de 2.000,00MT e o segundo no valor de 3.000,00MT. em grupo solidário.
Diz ter tomado conhecimento da existência da Hluvuku-Adsema logo depois de abrir seus escritórios neste ponto da província do maputo, através dos seus colegas e amigos. Com a hluvuku gosta da metodologia individual que lhe possibilita empréstimos de valores, relativamente, maiores. 
Já levantou o primeiro no valor de 5.200,00MT, o segundo de 7.800,00MT. Esta é a seu terceiro empréstimo com a hluvuku e primeiro com KIVA, no valor de 10.000,00MT.
Esta construindo a sua casa em fases e pretende terminar num futuro breve para poder materializar o sonho de construir uma mini loja de produtos diversos.
texts.en:
Jorge T. is 55 years old, was born in a city that neighbors Boane called Matola, is married and is the father of three children under the age of 18. He studied through the 5th grade but had to stop as his parents could not continue to afford the costs of his studies. His elderly mother lives with his family. Jorge is a civil servant that has worked at the Boane Institute of Agriculture for the past 12 years where he receives a monthly salary of 2,650.00MT. With his salary he is able to support his family and save a little bit to use in times of crisis. Jorge has received loans from other institutions that operate in the area. The first loan was for 2,000.00MT and the second was for 3,000.00MT and were both taken out as group loans. He says that he first learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through colleagues and friends after he opened offices in this part of the Maputo province. He likes Hluvuku-Adsema because he can take out personal loans (as opposed to group loans) of relatively larger amounts. He has previously taken out loans of 5,200.00 MT and 7,800.00MT. This will be his third loan with Hluvuku-Adsema and his first with Kiva with the amount being 10,000.00MT. Jorge is building his house in phases and hopes to complete construction soon so that he can realize his dream of opening a mini market with various products.

Translated from Portuguese by Cameron Morris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
Name : Jose M.
Internal Client ID : 18561
 Location; Boane
Primary Activity: Comercio
 Loan Requested ; 10.000,00mt
Repayment Term: 16 
Loan Use; Compra e venda de produtos
Disbursement Hluvuku; 01/06/09

Dêscription



Velho Zé é assim que é mais conhecido pelo seu protagonismo. Tem 59 anos de idade casado e pai de 2 filhos menores de 18 anos e todos frenquentam a escola na vila de boane. Estudou ate 5 classes por falta de visão por parte dos seus pais que não priorizam estudos como assunto importante. Para alem dos seus filhos, sustenta também seus 2 sobrinhos.
Nasceu em Gaza (a 200 km mais a norte da capital dos pais) e quando tinha 21 anos desceu á cidade capital dos pais à procura de emprego e tendo casado pouco tempo depois.
É negociante e dono do negocio a mais de 5 anos, não tem empregados, e aprendeu fazendo como estratégia de sobrevivência. Vende também recargas para telefones celulares. Recargas de 100 e 200 são o seu forte do negocio.
Este é o seu segundo empréstimo. O primeiro foi de 8.000,00MT para venda de produtos diversos e diz ter conhecido a hluvuku através dos amigos.
Com este empréstimo de 10.000,00MT pretende aumentar o volume do seu negocio e diversificar os produtos para satisfazer a demanda.
No futuro pretende contrair mais empréstimos para fazer crescer o seu negocio cada vez mais.
texts.en:
Velho Ze, as he is known by his friends, is 59 years old, married, and is the father of two children under the age of 18 that are in school in Boane. He studied until the 5th grade, but did not continue as his parents didn't feel that school was important. Aside from his two children, Velho Ze supports his two nephews. He was born in Gaza (200 km north of the capital city, Maputo). When he was 21 he moved to the capital city, Maputo, in search of work and married soon thereafter. He has been a salesman and a business owner for the past 5 years, he doesn't have employees, and he learned his trade as a means of survival. He sells phonecards for cellphones. Phonecards of 100 and 200 units are his strength. This will be his second loan, his first was for 8,000.00MT to buy various products. He learned about Hluvuku from friends. With this loan of 10,000.00 MT Ze intends on increasing his businesses volume and diversify his products to satisfy demand. In the future he hopes to take out more loans to help his business grow even more.

Translated from Portuguese by Cameron Morris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Lidia José

texts.pt:
Lídia Jose D. C., jovem D. 29 anos D. idaD., nasceu na vizinha cidaD. da Matola, solteira e residente na vila D. boane há quase vinte anos.
Ainda com seus pais, não tem esposo nem filhos.
Está a fazer a 10 classe na Escola secundaria Joaquim chissano D. Boane e é também trabalhadora no Estado e afecta na Direção Distrital D. Educação local como auxiliar administrativo e com o salário mensal D. 2.000,00MT. Trabalha já a 8 anos na quela instituição.

Com o salário não consegue poupar nada, mas sim pagar o credito. Este D. 20.000,00MT é a seu quarto empréstimo com a hluvuku e primeiro com KIVA e compromete se a pagar, bem tal como o fez com outros empréstimos. Levantou os primeiros na seguinte ordem D. montantes; 5.500,00MT; 7.000,00MT e 7.500,00MT.

Está a construir a sua própria casa D. matéria convencional e no futuro pretenD. apetrecha-la para depois sonhar fazer um mini estabelecimento comercial, para pequenos negócios.
texts.en:
Lidia is 29 years old and was born in the city of Matola. She is single and has lived in the village of Boane for almost 20 years. She lives with her parents, she is not married and has no children. She is completing 10th graD. at the Joaquim Chissano school in Boane. Lidia also works for the government in the local education office as an administrative assistant, with a monthly salary of 2,000.00 MT. She has been working there for 8 years. She is not able to save any money from her salary, but still pays back her loans. This loan of 20,000.00 MT is her fourth loan with Hluvuku and the first with Kiva. She promises to pay this loan just like she has the others. Her first 4 loans were for the following amounts: 5,500MT; 7,000MT and 7,500MT. This loan is to build her own home. In the future she hopes to furnish it and in then able to open a small business in her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Cameron Morris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr: K. C. Aminatou est née vers 1938 à Savè, une Commune du Département des Collines au Centre du Bénin. Aminatou est mariée à OBEY Mouftaou, un militaire mais actuellement à la retraite. Aminatou a eu trois enfants qui ont été tous à l'école. Mais Aminatou même n'a jamais été à l'école ni appris un métier. Depuis son adolescence, Aminatou a été initiée au petit commerce par sa mère qui vendait des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique (seaux, bassines, récipients, etc.). Devenue majeure, Aminatou s'est mise à son propre compte et a continué la même activité. C'est cette activité que Aminatou exerce encore aujourd'hui. Mais, entre temps, Aminatou a diversifié la vente des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique avec la vente de divers articles (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.). Aminatou a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits de ALIDé; crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu amener ses activités à un stade supérieur. Pour renforcer son fonds de roulement dans l'optique de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Aminatou sollicite un troisième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
K. C. Aminatou was born around 1938 in Savè, a community in the Department of Collines in the center of Bénin. Aminatou is married to Obey Mouftaou, a soldier who is presently retired. She has three children who all went to school, but Aminatou herself neither went to school nor learned a trade. Since adolescence, she was taught petty trading by her mother, who sold kitchen utensils made of plastic (buckets, basins, containers, etc.)

Once she was an adult, Aminatou went out on her own, continuing the same business. This is the business that Aminatou is in today, but she diversified from selling plastic kitchen utensils to selling various items (candy, cookies tins of milk, sardines, tomatoes; sugar, pasta, detergent, dish soap and hand soap, etc.) Aminatou has already had two loans from ALIDé, loans she reimbursed correctly and which allowed her to raise her business to a higher level. To bolster her working capital so as to better satisfy her clientele, Aminatou is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a case of tinned tomatoes, 1/2 case of tinned milk, 1 jerry can of 25 liters of vegetable oil, one case of detergent, 4 sacks of charcoal, and 4 trays of eggs

loans.name: Iván

texts.es:
El señor Iván G. ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales pago puntual mente.
En esté momento está solicitando nueva mente un préstamo para poder terminar los acabados del exterior de su casa ya que gran parte es para la seguridad de su familia. 
 Iván trabaja en una maquiladora en el departamento se sistemas, esté es el ingreso que tiene para su familia y con el cual una parte lo destinara para el pago del crédito.
Cuando se realizo le visita al domicilio del señor Iván G. el se encontraba trabajando horas extras, portal motivo la que nos entendió fue su esposa la señora Blanca Esthela García y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Iván G. has previously obtained loans from FVP, which he paid punctually. At this time, he is once again requesting a loan so that he can do finish work to his house’s exterior because it is mostly for his family’s safety.

Iván works in the IT department in an assembly plant. With this job, he is able to provide an income for his family, and some of the money will be used to repay the loan.

When we visited Mr. G.’s house, he was working overtime, which is why his wife, Blanca Esthela García, and their children welcomed us.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home exterior finish work

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
Name : Antonio M.
Internal Client ID : 18542
 Location; Boane
Primary Activity:  HABITACAO
 Loan Requested ; 10.000,00mt
Repayment Term: 16 
Loan Use; Compra de materiais de construcao
Disbursement Hluvuku; 01/06/09

Dêscription

Antonio M., natural de Manhica (distrito a 120 km de Boane), jovem de 33 anos de idade, casado, e é estudante e freqüenta 3˚- ano na Universidade Pedagógica na cidade de Maputo. Vive somente com a sua jovem família, esposa e 3 filhos menores de 9 anos, o mais velho frenquenta escola e esta na segunda classe.
Chegou ao distrito de boane na companhia dos seus progenitores no segundo mês de vida.

Para alem de estar a estudar, trabalho como professor na escola publica de boane porque também tem a formação media como professor. O seu rendimento mensal é de 5.500,00MT com o qual suporta as despesas escolares e de alimentação da família e vive em casa própria.

Nunca teve empréstimo com nenhum banco e este é o seu primeiro com a hluvuku – KIVA, no valor de 10.000,00MT para compra de materiais de construção da sua casa que vem construindo em fases. Teve conhecimento da existência da hluvuku através dos seus amigos e colegas de escola. Depois da formação tenciona levantar mais empréstimos para finalizar a sua moradia e desenvolver outros planos de negócio para aumentar a renda familiar.
texts.en:
Name : Antonio M. Internal Client ID : 18542 Location; Boane Primary Activity: HABITACAO Loan Requested ; 10.000,00mt Repayment Term: 16 Loan Use; Compra de materiais de construcao Disbursement Hluvuku; 01/06/09 Antonio M., 33, married, is a student in his third year at the Pedagogical University of Maputo, Mozambique. Born in the district of Manhica, he currently lives with his wife and three kids in Boane (where he has himself lived since he was 2 months old). His oldest son, in 2nd grade, is 9 years old. Antonio supports his family as an elementary public school teacher, with a monthly salary of 5500,00 MT. He owns the house they live in, which is still under construction. He decided to apply for a loan after hearing about Kvuluku from friends and classmates (he has never had a loan from any other institution). Antonio will use his first loan, in the amount of 10000,00 MT, to buy construction material to keep working on his house. After he graduates from college, he hopes to take out other loans to invest on finishing the house and maybe starting a business to improve his income.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en: D. purchases eggs in bulk from poultry farms and sub-sells to other smaller retailers. She started this trade three years ago and is doing fine but needs a loan of N100,000 to increase her inventory in order to meet with her customers’ demands. D. is 34 years old, married, and has two children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase eggs in bulk

loans.name: Olaruwaju

texts.en:
O. sells frozen food in large and small quantities. She has been in business for eight years and purchases goods from Cotonu, a border town by Lagos State. She goes to get goods once every week in order to meet up with her customers’ demands.

O. is 40 years old, married, and has four children. She needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase goods in bulk to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders and to LAPO who has been lifting her through the years to her present level.

loans.use: To purchase frozen food to sell

loans.name: Zina Bibi Ussene

texts.pt:
Zina Bibi nasceu na cidade de maputo é mulher de 35 anos de idade, frequntou escola ate 6 classe e por dificuldades financeiras dos seus progenitores não conseguiu continuar com os estudos para realizar o sonho se formar cedo no nível secundário.
Casada e mãe de três filhos, sendo a mais velha com 13 anos de idade que freqüenta escola com outro que lhe segue. Vive em campoane, zona periférica de boane juntamente com o seu marido e o seu irmão na sua responsabilidade.
Saiu de maputo no ano de 2001 com sua família porque viviam numa casa alugada e em campoane vive já numa casa própria que esta construindo com seu marido.

Não trabalha e o principal ingresso familiar tem sido o salário do marido que ganha 4.000,00MT por mês. Na foto aparece com o seu filho menor.
Nunca fez empréstimos com outros bancos e que este valor de 18.000,00MT vai aplicar no acabamento da casa onde habita propõe se a pagar sem dificuldades.
No futuro tenciona construir uma mercearia para aumentar a renda familiar, daí que com mais outros empréstimos logo que terminar de pagar o presente credito.
texts.en:
Zina Bibi, 35, married, was born in Maputo, Mozambique. Her dreams of graduating early from high school were interrupted when she was in 6th grade, due to her parents' financial difficulties. She is the mother of 3 kids, the two oldest being already in school (in the photo, she appears with her youngest). In 2001, she moved with her family from Maputo, where they had been renting, to Campoane, periphery of Boane, where they were able to buy a place, and where they have, since, gradually been building their house. Since Zina doesn't work, her husband supports their family (including Zina's brother, who lives with them) with a monthly salary of 4,000.00 MT. This is the first time she's applied for a loan, which she hopes to repay without difficulty. She will use the 18000,00 MT to finish her house, and when this loan is paid in full, she plans to apply for others, to start a grocery store and help improve the family's income.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material

loans.name: Quách Thị
loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Betsabé

texts.es: Betsabé tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada. Buscando mejores oportunidades de ingresos se inclinó por instalar una sala de video juegos en su misma casa, la cual viene funcionando desde hace 3 años, y es una manera de obtener ingresos económicos sin descuidar a sus hijos. Durante este tiempo ha notado la buena rentabilidad de su negocio, puesto que tiene gran demanda por los jovencitos de su barrio. Y aunque tenga que permanecer durante todo el día, sin salir de su casa, lo hace por su deseo de progresar. Para un futuro cercano, Betsabé quiere comprar más televisores, que son la base de su negocio. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, ella está muy satisfecha por la oportunidad que le brindan en cada préstamo, por lo que renueva su compromiso de ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que está solicitando es para mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, ya que pintará e implementará otra habitación donde pondrá los televisores, así tendrá un espacio adicional para la venta de golosinas y generar ingresos adicionales.
texts.en:
Betsabe is 27 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in a rented house. Looking for income opportunities, she decided to open a video game room in her home. She has been running this for the last three years. It is a good way to generate income and at the same time take care of her children. This activity has proven to be very profitable since there is a big demand among the young people in her neighborhood. Even though she has to stay in her house all day, she is doing it to get ahead. In the near future, Betsabe wants to buy more television sets, which is the basis of her business. This is her third loan with MFP, she is very happy with the opportunities that each loan provides and renews her promise to be on time with her payments. The money that she is requesting is for the improvement of the infrastructure of her business, she will open up and paint another room for the television sets. This will give her additional space to sell snacks and therefore generate additional income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the infrastucture of her business

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
C. Nguyễn Thị (417970534) is a 57 year-old female living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has 4 adult children. To making a living, C. owns & operates a business raising ducks for sale. C. has been engaged in this business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1997, C. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.  C. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  C. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND to be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be C.’s 7th loan from TYM Fund.  C. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: José De Dios

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor José De Dios V. le está haciendo falta la barda alrededor y un portón, esto es para la seguridad de su casa ya que El y su esposa la señora Betzabe Márquez, trabajan casi todo el día y la vivienda se queda sola. 
El señor José De Dios V. trabaja en una compañía de paquetería en el departamento de repartidor y su esposa trabaja en el aria de administración de una compañía, esto son sus ingresos para darles lo mejor a su familia.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Betzabe Márquez ya que el señor José De Dios no se encontraba en su casa en ese momento.
texts.en:
Mr. José De Dios V.’s house needs a protective wall and a gate for safety because he and his wife, Ms. Betzabe Márquez, work almost all day long, so their house is empty.

Mr. José De Dios V. works in the delivery department of a courier company, while his wife works in administration for a company. They have these jobs to be able to give their family the best.

The woman in the photo is Ms. Betzabe Márquez because Mr. José De Dios was not home at the time.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a protective wall and install a gate

loans.name: Vũ Thị

texts.en:
C. Vũ Thị (431990955) is a 62 year-old female living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has 3 adult children. To making a living, C. owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products to the local community. C. has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1999, C. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.  C. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. C. is now requesting a loan of 15,000,000 VND so that she can purchase additional products to sell.  This will be C.’s 8th loan from TYM Fund.  C. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Rafael Muabsa

texts.pt:
Name : Rosa Rafael Muabsa C.
Internal Client ID : 18555
Location; BOANE
Primary Activity:  COMERCIO
 Loan Requested ; 18.000,00mt
Repayment Term: 16 
Loan Use; Compra e venda de produtos
Disbursement Hluvuku; 01/06/09


Rosa nasceu em vilanculos (a 800 km de boane) tem 45 anos de idade, casada e mãe de cinco filhos. frenquentou escola ate 4 classe. Parou de estudar por motivos sociais e financeiros dos seus progenitores. O primeiro filho tem 17 anos de idade e o mais novo é que estuda na Escola secundaria de Boane.
 É residente da Matola a 24 anos. Chegou a maputo a covinte da sua irmã que arranjou lhe emprego no bairro peri urbano da cidade de Maputo (chamanculo), onde trabalhou somente um ano e tendo depois contraído matrimonio com seu marido e passaram a viver na Matola ate hoje na cas própria.

No ano de 1992, logo depois do acordo geral da paz, iniciou um negocio de venda de artigos diversos e já tem uma experiência de pelo menos 19 anos nesta actividade. Vende mantas/cobertores que as compra na áfrica do sul e revenda a 1.200,00MT cada, como seu principal objecto de negocio. Nesta e estação de inverno aqui em Moçambique, vende mais e o rendimento diário varia entre 2.000,00MT e 2.300,00MT.

Não tem empregado porque consegue fazer pessoalmente sem problemas. Este é seu segundo empréstimo com a hluvuku e primeiro com KIVA no valor de 18.000,00MT para aumentar o volume do negocio e responder a demanda de mantas neste momento de frio. Nunca teve empréstimos com outras instituições financeiras e que ouviu falar da hluvuku em conversa com as amigas.
Propõe se a pagar sem problemas para pedir mais empréstimos com objectivo de expandir mais o negocio assim como construir um salão de cabalaria e construir mais uma casa.
texts.en:
Name : Rosa Rafael Muabsa C. Internal Client ID : 18555 Location; BOANE Primary Activity: COMERCIO Loan Requested ; 18.000,00mt Repayment Term: 16 Loan Use; Compra e venda de produtos Disbursement Hluvuku; 01/06/09 Rosa was born in the city of Vilanculos, situated 800 Km from Boane, Mozambique. 45 years old, married, and the mother of 5 kids, Rosa's studies were interrupted in 4th grade, due to her family's financial constraints. Her oldest son, now 17, is enrolled in High School, in Boane. She moved from Vilanculos to Maputo when her sister found her a job in the neighborhood of Chamanculo, where she worked for a year before marrying her husband and moving to Matola. They have been in Matola, where they own their own place, for the past 24 years. After the General Peace Treaty was signed, in 1992 [ending Mozambique's 16-year civil war between the ruling party and the opposition], Rosa started a business of buying and selling, among other things, blankets and bedspreads--buying them in South Africa and reselling in Matola for profit. Her daily income varies from 2.000.00 and 2.300,00 MT. She has been in this business, which she runs by herself, for 19 years. Rosa heard about Hluvuku through friends. This is her second loan with Hluvuku, and the first with Kiva (she's never had loans with other institutions). These 18.000,00 MT will allow her to buy more blankets to answer the increase in demand during the upcoming winter months. She anticipates paying her loan back without difficulties, and plans to take other loans out in the future, to continue improving her business as well as to start a hair salon and build another house.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stocks in her business

loans.name: Vũ Thị

texts.en:
Y. 431990947 (431990955) is a 64 year-old female living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has 2 adult children. To making a living, Y. owns & operates a business manufacturing & selling incense products to local businesses and community members. Y. has been engaged in this business for over 9 years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1999, Y. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Y. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Y. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND to be used towards the purchase of raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be Y.’s 10th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

loans.name: Taki

texts.fr: Taki C., 60 ans est veuve avec 02 enfants  en charge. Son activité est la vente de denrées alimentaire. Elle compte acheter des légumes (carottes, choux, oignons), du jumbo et divers condiments pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Taki C., 60, is a widow raising two children. Her business is selling foodstuffs. She intends to buy vegetables (carrots, cabbage, onions) , Jumbo bouillon cubes, and various other condiments to bolster her little business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of foodstuffs

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y el menor de sus hijos que tiene 20 años. Se dedica a las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas, principalmente vende los cereales (granos) que ella misma siembra, además, a la actividad que más tiempo le brinda es a la crianza de ganado vacuno, los cuales vende en las principales ferias ganaderías de su zona. Catalina trabaja junto a su esposo para ambas tareas, pues es muy importante que velen por el desarrollo de sus productos, así como por el crecimiento de sus animales, ya que entre más grandes sus granos y más gordos sus animales, obtendrán mayores ganancias al momento de la comercialización. Para el futuro, Catalina quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, así y tener otra fuente de ingresos para afrontar los tiempos difíciles, cuando los precios de los productos agrícolas no les favorezcan.Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, está comprometida a realizar un trabajo honrado y transparente en la gestión del dinero que solicita, tanto en invertirlo adecuadamente como en la devolución del mismo. En esta oportunidad comprará semillas de cereales y un torete.
texts.en:
Catalina is 50 years old and lives with her husband and the youngest of their children who is 20 years old. She works in agriculture and livestock; mainly selling cereals (grains that she plants) and raising cattle, which are sold at major cattle fairs in her area.

Catalina works with her husband , since it is very important to ensure the development of their products and the growth of their animals. Because the bigger the grains and the fatter the animals, the higher returns they get at the time of selling. In the future, Catalina wants to start a grocery shop at home to have another source of income that allows them to cope with difficult times when prices for agricultural products are not good.

This is her second loan with MFP. She is committed to work honestly in the management and investment of the money they are requesting, as well as in the repayment of the loan. She will buy cereal seeds and a bull.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and a bull

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (404970112) is a 48 year-old female living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. T. owns & operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing & selling wood products to local businesses and community members. T. has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1999, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. T. is now requesting a loan of 20,000,000 VND in order to renovate her business. This will be T.’s 7th loan from TYM Fund.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina tiene 55 años,  vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Junto a su esposo, se dedica a la fabricación artesanal de chupetes (a base de hielo) y helados (de crema), actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años. La idea surgió del consumo de sus propios hijos, y al contar con una refrigeradora dejó de hacerlo sólo para su familia y empezó a elaborar en mayor cantidad para emprender este negocio. Todas las tardes elabora los chupetes que deja congelando hasta el día siguiente, con el tiempo se ha implementado de diversos moldes y otra nevera, así como gran cantidad de barquillos para los helados, los cuales prepara hasta las 11 de la mañana, y luego sale a repartir sus productos a las escuelas cercanas a su casa. También cuenta con algunas personas que le ayudan a vender, a quienes les paga por ello. La época más rentable es durantes los meses de verano, sin embargo, como en su región hay un fuerte sol durante el día, sus ganancias se mantienen estables, lo que ha convertido a este negocio en un sostén económico muy importante para la familia. Sus planes para el futuro son de mejorar los utensilios y el equipo que utiliza para tener una mayor producción y de mejor calidad. Es la tercera vez que Josefina tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las socias más activas de su banco comunal y ahora renueva su compromiso de seguir trabajando en equipo y de manera responsable con sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de otra congeladora y nuevos moldes de helados.
texts.en:
Josefina is 55 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in their own home. Along with her husband they have been making home made popsicles and ice cream for the last 6 years. They had the idea to start this business when they saw how much their kids enjoyed their popsicles, so since they had a freezer they just began to make them in larger quantities to undertake this business. She makes the popsicles every afternoon and lets them freeze until next day. Over the time she has acquired various popsicle molds, another freezer, and a large number of waffle cones for the ice cream.

She makes ice cream until 11am and then goes to distribute their products to schools near her home. She hires some people to help to sell the products, and pays them for their job. The most profitable time is during the summer, however, because in her region they get a strong sun during the day most of the year, her earnings are stable. It has transformed this business into a very important financial support for the family.

Her future plans are to improve her business tools and equipment to increase the production and improve the quality of the products. This is her third loan with MFP. She is one of the most active members of her community bank, and renews her commitment to continue working as a team and be responsible with her payments. The money she requested will be invested in the purchase of a freezer and popsicle molds.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer and popsicle molds

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa 2 Group

texts.en:
This group has been with the Fundación for two years and comes from the neighborhood of San Lucas, just outsiD. of Ciudad del Este.  The group is maD. up of 19 women, all friends and neighbors.  3,500,000 Gs is their savings.  There is much support and responsibility amongst this group of women.  They are also very interested in learning more about finances so that they can better run their businesses.  

1	Felipa D. M. N.	Dressmaker 
2	Celia G.	Small grocery store 
3	Filomena L.	Small grocery store
