6	Ester R.	Dressmaker 
7	Josefina A.	Jewelry sales 
8	Rafaela V. 	Undergarment sales 
9	Valeria T.	Clothing sales 
10	Angelina R.	Candy sales 
11	Carmen Q.	Dressmaker 
12	Maristela B.	Furniture sales 
13	Sunilda M.	Cleaning product sales 
14	Adelaida S.	Diner 
15	Aparicia G.	Electronics sales 
16	Teresa O.	Clothing sales 
17	Maria R.	Food sales 
18	Leonora G.	Dressmaker 
19	Fidelina G.	Clothing sales

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as fabrics, foodstuffs, electronics, clothes, jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge Alberto Q. y su esposa han planificado bien su familia en el tiempo que tiene de matrimonio solo tiene una hija. El pensar de Jorge es que quiere dejarles un buen patrimonio para que vivan bien y cómodamente. El ha tenido prestamos de aquí por lo que ha pagado bien y es como ha empezado su proyecto de extender su casa el ahora esta por terminar una recamara la cual es para su única hija.
El señor Q. ya tiene 5 años de repartidor de refresco en un compañía muy conocida y su esposa trabaja de obrera en una maquiladora y todo este esfuerzo es para darle un mejor calida de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto Q. and his wife have planned their family well. They have had only one child. Jorge’s hope is to leave a good heritage to his family, so they will live well and comfortably. He has had loans that been repaid and this is how he started his home remodel project. He is about to finish a bedroom for his only daughter. Mr. Q. has worked for the last 5 years as a delivery truck driver for a very well known soda company. His wife works in a “maquiladora” assembly plant. All their efforts are to get a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material

loans.name: Đỗ Thị

texts.en:
N. Đỗ Thị (435970112) is a 39-year-old female living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has three school-aged children.

N. owns and operates a business raising chickens for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 1998, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

N. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 7th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: María

texts.es: Maria tiene 28 años, vive con su único hijo de 7 años en la casa de sus padres. Desde hace un año vende cosméticos por catálogo, ofreciendo sus productos todos los días, en cualquier oportunidad que se le presente, a sus amistades y compañeras de trabajo en un restaurante donde labora por las mañanas, ocupándose en las tardes de visitar las casas de sus clientes. Hasta el momento ha notado que sus ventas son exitosas, lo cual la anima a continuar con este negocio. Para más adelante, Maria desea tener un restaurante porque está aprendiendo la dinámica diariamente en su trabajo, pero por el momento seguirá vendiendo sus cosméticos, con el deseo de que cada mes se incrementen sus pedidos. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella ha demostrado ser muy responsable en sus pagos dentro de su banco comunal, y confirma una vez más su deseo de seguir siendo  colaboradora en su grupo. Con el dinero que está solicitando comprara, al por mayor, más cosméticos para cubrir los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
María is 28 years old and lives with her only son, seven years old, in her parents' house. For the last year she has sold cosmetics by catalog, offering her products every day at whatever opportunity presents itself to her friends and coworkers in a restaurant where she works in the morning. She spends the afternoon visiting the houses of her customers. Up until now, she has observed that her sales are flourishing which encourages her to continue with this line of work. Looking to the future, María would like to have a restaurant because she is learning how that works daily on the job. But for the time being she will continue selling her cosmetics with the hope that every month her orders increase. This is the third time that she has had a loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. María has shown herself to be very responsible with her payments into her communal bank and she affirms yet again her desire to continue collaborating with her group. The money that she is requesting will mostly be used to buy more cosmetics to fill the orders that she has.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Akinbade

texts.en: R., a 42-year-old widow, has three children and sells drinks/juice. She started this business a year ago, but previously had been trading in seasonal goods. R. is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase drinks/juice to sell.

loans.name: Babalola

texts.en: C. is 45 years old, and is married with four children. For over ten years she has run a business selling items such as candles and oil. Due to a constant increase in demand, and also to reduce the risks involved in being on the road often, she needs a loan of 100,000 NGN to enable her to purchase goods in large quantities and at a discount. She says this will enable her to meet her customers' needs. C. sends her thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase 'spiritual' items to sell

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
Hoà Trần Thị (1114060440) is a 53-year-old female living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has three adult children. To making a living, Hoà owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector selling agricultural equipment. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling animal feed and mash to local farmers. Hoà has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2001, Hoà joined Kiva partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hoà has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This loan was used to purchase agricultural equipment to sell. Hoà is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be her sixth loan from TYM Fund. Hoà plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar tiene 25 años, vive con su madre y una D. sus hermanas en L. casa D. sus padres. Se dedica a vender todo tipo D. productos para las actividades agrícolas y ganaderas, tales como semillas, abono, fertilizantes, alimentos y antiparasitarios para animales, etc. Tiene un local ubicado en una zona céntrica D. L. ciudad, el cual viene atendiendo desD. hace más D. 7 meses. Oscar permanece en su negocio hasta las 5 D. L. tarD. para luego ir a estudiar a L. universidad, entonces lo remplaza su tío en L. atención D. los clientes. Con este trabajo, Oscar pueD. contar con independencia económica, y le agrada realizarlo, puesto que le permite estar en el campo, al aire libre, las ocasiones cuando entrega los productos a sus clientes en sus chacras. Nos comenta que L. mejor época D. ventas es durante las temporadas D. siembra y cosecha, sin embargo, normalmente mantiene estable sus ventas y sus ingresos, por lo que a futuro quiere incrementar su mercadería para atender mayores pedidos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que tiene grandes expectativas D. progreso, y se compromete a responder responsablemente en el pago D. sus cuotas. El dinero que está solicitando será destinado a L. compra D. más mercadería (fertilizantes, semillas y otros) para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Oscar is 25 years old and lives with his mother and one of his sisters in their parents' house. He works selling all types of products for agriculture and raising livestock, such as seeds, compost, fertilizer, feed and anti-parasitics for the animals, etc. He has a shop situated in the city center where he's been operating for the last seven months. Oscar stays in his shop until 5:00 pm but later he goes to study at the university and then his uncle stands in for him in tending to his customers. Oscar is satisfied with the economic independence his work provides him and he enjoys it because it allows him to be in the open air in the countrysiD. on the occasions when he delivers products to his customers at their farms. He tells us that the best time for sales is during the planting and harvesting seasons, however his sales and his income are usually stable. For the future, he wants to increase his merchandise so he can take care of more orders. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and he has great expectations of progress. He promises to act responsibly in making his payments. The money he is requesting will be used to buy more merchandise (fertilizers, seeds and other things) in order to stock up his business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his inventory.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị
loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina Garcia Ramírez ha pasado por una situación como lo están pasando muchas familias su esposo cruzo a los Estados Unidos a trabajar para poderlos mantener y mandarles dinero desde allá pero migración lo detuvo y ahora esta preso. Para Carolina fue un golpe muy fuerte ya que el mantenía a la familia ahora ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Pero no quiere que su casa se descuide por lo que quiere hacerle alguna mejoras por dentro y por fuera de su casa como (enjarre, pintura) para que se vea bien la casa.
texts.en:
Carolina Garcia Ramírez has gone through a situation familiar to many families: her husband went to the United States to work so that he could support them and send them money but he was stopped by immigration services and has been detained. It was a big blow to Carolina, as her husband supported the family. Now she works selling used clothing, but doesn't want her house to be neglected. She wants to make some improvements, such as new plaster and paint, so that the house looks nice.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fixing the house

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
L. Trần Thị (1108060238) is a 51-year-old female living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has three adult children.

L. owns and operates a business raising fish for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2001, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

L. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 8th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es: Valeriana vive con su hija y sus nietos en su casa propia. Se dedica a bordar trajes típicos de su zona, actividad que realiza desde que tenía 20 años, con este largo tiempo de experiencia ha adquirido una gran destreza para que sus manos avancen rápidamente los laboriosos bordados, además siempre utiliza su creatividad en cada diseño de flores o paisajes que incorpora en sus trabajos. La mejor temporada para Valeriana cuando tiene mayor cantidad de solicitudes de estos fustanes o trajes típicos es durante los meses de julio y agosto, fecha de las festividades costumbristas de su zona, en esta época contrata a  personas para que la ayuden a bordar y con las ganancias rentables retribuye bien el esfuerzo que hacen. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, su larga trayectoria en esta institución le ha enseñado el valor de la responsabilidad, por lo que una vez más se compromete a seguir siendo puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de telas e hilos de colores, dorados y plateados por conos y por paquetes grandes, así estará preparada ante cualquier requerimiento de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Valeriana lives with her daughter and grandchildren in her own house. She embroiders clothes that are typical of her zone. She has been doing this since she was twenty years old. With this long time of experience, she has acquired great skill so that her hands rapidly while doing the laborious embroidery. Also, she is creative with every flower design or landscape that she incorporates in her work. The best season for Valeriana, when she gets the most orders for these skirts or typical clothes, is during the months of July and August. This is when the customary festivals are in her zone. During this time she contracts people to help her embroider. With the good profits, she pays them well for their efforts. This is her fifth loan with MFP. Her long experience with the institution has taught her the value of responsibility. Therefore, one more time, she promises to continue to be punctual with her payments. The money is to buy fabrics, colored thread, and large packages of gold and silver spools of thread. This way she will be prepared for whatever her customers require.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material for her embroidery

loans.name: Diéba

texts.fr: Diéba D., 45 ans est mariée avec 06 enfants  en charge. Elle s’active dans le commerce de tissus. L’accès à ce prêt va lui permettre de s’approvisionner en tissus Khartoum et Wax pour  renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Diéba D., 45, is married and is raising 6 children. She sells fabrics. The access this loan will give her will allow her to stock up on fabrics of the Khartoum and Wax brands to bolster her little business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling fabrics

loans.name: Đỗ Thị

texts.en:
Bí Đỗ Thị (1108060236) is a 57-year-old woman living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Bí owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members. Bí has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, Bí joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bí has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Bí is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 9th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. Bí plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: used to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy protection for the windows

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es: Zoraida tiene 32 años, vive con su hijo en la casa de sus padres. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de ropa, su metodología de trabajo consiste en visitar las casas de sus vecinos y amistades ofreciendo sus prendas, las que luego cobra al crédito, y así obtiene mayores ganancias, ya sea en cuotas semanales o diarias. Cada mes, Zoraida viaja a otra ciudad donde se abastece de mercadería, adquiriendo principalmente lo que más demandan sus clientes, aparte de modelos nuevos para ofrecer. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, está muy contenta de formar parte de su banco comunal y quiere seguir trabajando de la misma forma, manteniéndose responsable en sus pagos. El dinero está solicitando será destinado a la compra de más prendas de vestir al por mayor.
texts.en:
Zoraida, 32, lives with her son in her parents’ house. She has been selling clothes for one year. The way she works is to visit her neighbors’ and friends’ houses and offer her garments. Then, she charges on credit; that way she earns more with weekly or daily payments. Each month Zoraida travels to another city to stock her merchandise. She primarily gets what her customers ask for; she also gets new styles to offer. This is her second loan with MFP. She is very happy to be part of her Community Bank. She wants to keep working the same way, keeping herself responsible in her payments. The money is to buy more wholesale clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es: la Sra. Maria Leticia Q. tiene 39 años de edad, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de refrescos, agua y jugos. como esta ciudad de choluteca es muy caliente muchas personas compran este tipo de productos para quitarse la sed, ella tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion, la cual queda en un punto muy estrategico ya que por ahi pasan muchas personas ya que queda cerca una estacion de buses. en estos momentos ella necesita comprar mas productos para tener mejores ganancias, ella piensa comprar otro refrigerador para poner mas refrescos. nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que todo le esta saliendo bien y espera mejorar pronto su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Leticia Q. is 39 years old and makes a living buying and selling soft drinks, water and juices. Because her city of Choluteca is very hot, many people buy this type of product to quench their thirst. She runs her business out of her home, which is located in a very strategic spot because many people pass by it since it is close to the bus station. Currently she needs to purchase more products to increase her profits. She plans on purchasing another refrigerator to stock it with more drinks. She tells us that she feels very happy because everything is going well and she hopes to improve her business soon.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and juices in cans and bottles and bottled water

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

In 1996, P. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. P. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. P. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in further expanding the business. This will be the 13th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. P. plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to further improve and expand her business.

loans.use: used to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción E. C. y su esposo quieren tener mejor seguridad en su casa. La señora obtuvo su casa de interés social pero las ventanas de la vivienda  están cerca de la pasada de los extraños y para poderla dejar abierta toma un riesgo.
En estas casas son muy calientes y es por ello que las quiere abrir para que el aire corra por la casa y la temperatura ambiental no la mantenga caliente así con las protecciones la deja abierta y sin ningún problema que un delincuente entre a robar a su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Concepción E. C. and her husband want to have greater security in their home. She obtained her home from a public housing program. The windows are close to a busy passageway and leaving them open poses a risk. It is very hot in these houses, which is why she wants to leave the windows opens and allow air to pass through the house and cool it. With protective measures, she will be able to leave her windows open without criminals breaking in and robbing her humble abode.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home protection

loans.name: Adeyinka

texts.en: A. is 47 years old, married with six children. She sells kerosene and also has a bar which she operates at night. She started these businesses two years ago. A. needs a loan of N 100,000 to purchase drums of kerosene to sell.

loans.use: purchase kerosene to sell

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.es:
El señor José Guadalupe P. es padre de familia tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad los cuales están por terminar la preparatoria, pero tiene le problema que en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder pagar la mensualidad y empezar el tramite del certificado. 
Don José tiene ya más de 13 años trabajando para a una agencia en el departamento de tramitador este la forma que genera ingresos para su familia.
La persona que aparece en la foto es su hijo quien se va a terminar sus estudios, ya que el señor José Guadalupe se encontraba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
José Guadalupe P. is the father of two sons who are about to finish preparatory school, but at the moment he does not have the money needed to pay their monthly dues and begin processing their certificates. José has worked for more than 13 years in the processing department of an agency, and this is how he generates an income for his family. The person in the photo is his son, who is about to finish his studies. José was not able to be photographed because he was at work.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay school dues and process school certificates

loans.name: Vissè

texts.fr:
Cette femme est une résidente du quartier de Vokpossito, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce chaussures, elle exerce son activité de façon ambulante. Elle vend parfois à crédit et récupère l’argent dans huit jours voire une semaine. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2005 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé.  Cette activité est très bénéfique pour elle car elle en tire énormément de bénéfices. Elle voudrait agrandir son stock afin de mieux vendre et réaliser plus de profit.
Avec le profit tiré de son commerce, elle aide son mari dans les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
This lady is a resident of the Vokpossito neighborhood. She is married and the mother of 3 children. She works selling shoes, door-to-door. She sometimes sells on credit and recuperates her money after a week or so. She has been in this business since 2005 and stocks up at the big open-air market of Lomé. This business is very beneficial for her since she makes a lot of profit from it. She wants to expand her inventory so as to make more sales and thus more profit.

With the profit from her business, she helps her husband support the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Mame Fatim

texts.fr: Mame Fatim K., 26 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre de banc villageois depuis 2 ans. Son activité est le commerce. Elle compte acheter et revendre des arachides et du sucre pour renforcer son activité.

loans.name: Justino

texts.es:
El señor Justino V. tiene ya más de 12 años dedicándose a la fotografía este es su ingreso familiar. A su negocio le está haciendo falta un equipo de cómputo para elaborar credenciales, ya que en las escuelas que tiene contratos les están solicitando que se encargue de generar ese tipo de producto.
Pero en este momento cuenta con el dinero necesario para llevar a cabo la comprar del equipo, es por eso que está solicitando el préstamo.
texts.en:
Justino V. has worked in photography, his source of family income, for more than 12 years. His business is lacking computer equipment to produce credentials. He has contracts with schools who are asking him to make these products. At the moment, he does not have the necessary funds to purchase this equipment, which is why he is seeking a loan.

loans.name: Anne-Marie

texts.fr: O. Anne-Marie est née vers 1953 à Ouidah, une ville historique du Bénin dans le Département de l'Atlantique. Anne-Marie est veuve et mère d'un seul enfant qui a été à l'école. Anne-Marie a appris dès sa petite enfance à vendre de la tomate fraîche. Après son mariage, Anne-Marie s'est mise à son propre compte dans la même activité mais pour une courte durée. En effet, Anne-Marie a plutôt préféré vendre de céréales. Anne-Marie vendait des céréales au marché de GBEGAMEY, un des marchés locaux de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Anne-Marie continue de vendre aujourd'hui encore de céréales mais à son domicile au quartier GBEDAGBA. Anne-Marie a déjà eu deux crédits de ALIDé pour renforcer son capital. Anne-Marie sollicite un troisième prêt de ALIDé pour développer son activité et s'approvisionner en maïs, farine de manioc et haricot.
texts.en:
O. Anne-Marie was born in 1953 in Ouidah, a historic town in Bénin in the Atlantique Department. Anne-Marie is a widow and the mother of one child who went to school. She learned from childhood how to sell fresh tomatoes. After her marriage, Anne-Marie went out on her own in that same business for a short time. In fact, however, Anne-Marie found that she preferred selling cereals. She sold cereals at the market of Gbegamey, one of the local markets of Cotonou, economic capital of the Republic of Bénin.

Anne-Marie still continues to sell cereals, but out of her house in the Gbedagba neighborhood. She has already had 2 loans from ALIDé to bolster her working capital. She is requesting a third loan from ALIDé to develop her business and stock up on maize, manioc flour, and dried beans.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 5 sacks of 100 kg of maize, 1 sack of 50 kg of manioc flour, and 50 kg of dried beans

La señora María Magdalena P. ya ha tenido un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente.

Y por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de hacer la mejora. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder tener su casa en mejore condición. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es su hijo el señor Luis Antonio Lopez quien vive con ella.
texts.en:
María Magdalena P. has had a loan with FVP, which she repaid punctually. She is now asking for a new loan to be able to reconstruct the roof on the rooms on the second floor of her house. The roof that is there now is in bad shape. She does not currently have the money to be able to buy the material and pay someone to make the improvement. That is why she is asking for a loan, to be able to improve the condition of her house. The person who appears in the photo is her son, Luis Antonio Lopez, who lives with her.

loans.name: Wédayamana  2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Wédayamana 2  est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Sirakélé de la ville de Koutiala région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec  en moyenne 35ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Elles excellent uniquement   dans la culture de l’arachide.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe   Wédayamana 2 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre prêts précédents, elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter,  une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture,   au grand marché de Koutiala ville.
 Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Wédayamana 2 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 80 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Wédayamana 2 Group is a group of married women from the village of Sirakélé in the main city of Koutiala in the Sikasso region (Mali's third administrative region). The women live in traditional large, extended families and have an average age of 35 and at least five children each. Their sole business is growing peanuts. Anxious to make their agricultural business profitable, the members of the Wédayamana 2 Group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program five years ago. Having fully repaid their first four loans, they are now on their fifth farming loan. The current loan will be used to buy sufficient quantity of peanut seeds and small items of farm equipment and fertilizer at the main market in Koutiala. At the end of the off-season, the harvested crops are placed in storage for a certain period to gain value before being sold at the main market of Koutiala and surrounding markets at retail (and often wholesale) prices. The produce is sold for cash to customers who generally come from the large towns. Once their agricultural produce has been sold, the members of the Wédayamana 2 Group each expect to make a profit of CFA 80,000, which will be used to repay the loan interest and cover everyday family expenses.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and small items of farm equipment

la señora Reyna Estrada G. tiene 40 años de edad,  vive en union libre con el señor Jose Rosalio Rodriguez el cual se dedica al negocio de taxis, dependen de ellos dos hijos que estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la venta de comida almuerzos y desayunos y golosinas desde hace 10 años, Reyna necesita el prestamo para comprar leña y carnes, verduras, minimo verde y refrescos.
 
la sra. Suyapa C. M. tiene 35 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Samuel Flores, ellos tienen tres hijos. Suyapa se dedica al negocio de pulperia desde hace 08 años,  ella necesita el prestamo para surtir el negocio, desea comprar azucar,arroz, jabon, manteca, pollo, frescos, etc.
 
la Sra. Milagro C. M.  tiene  33 años de edad , vive en union libre con el señor Nelson Javier Ramirez, de ellos dependen tres hijos,  dos ellos estan en la escuela y uno en el kinder. ella se dedica a la venta de verduras. necesita el prestamo para comprar mas verduras.
texts.en:
'Las Amigas' (The Friends) solidarity group is made up of three women, residents of the Buena Vista district, who have known each other for a long time. Reyna Estrada G. is 40-years old and lives with her partner, Jose Rosalio Rodriguez, who works in the taxi business. They support their two children, who are in school. Reyna has worked selling food (lunch, breakfast, candy), for ten years. She needs the loan to buy firewood and meat, vegetables, herbs, and soft drinks. Suyapa C. M. is 35-years old and lives with her partner, Samuel Flores, and their 3 children. Suyapa has dedicated herself to her business, a neighborhood store, for 8 years. She needs the loan to stock her business. She wishes to buy sugar, rice, ham, lard, chicken, soft drinks, etc. Milagro C. M. is 33-years old and lives with her partner, Nelson Javier Ramirez. They support 3 children; 2 are in school and 1 is in pre-school. Milagro sells vegetables; she needs the loan to buy more vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables, soft drinks, meat, beans, rice, sugar, lard, bread, churros (fritters), firewood

Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles soeurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 30ans et au moins 4 enfants.
Elles font uniquement  la culture de l’arachide.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe   Wédayamana  4 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre prêts précédents, elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter,  une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de Koutiala ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.

The Wédayamana 4 Group is a group of married women from the village of Sirakélé in the main city of Koutiala in the Sikasso region (Mali's third administrative region). The women live in traditional large, extended families with their children, husbands, in-laws, etc. They have an average age of 30 and at least four children each. Their sole business is growing peanuts. Anxious to make their agricultural business profitable, the members of the Wédayamana 4 Group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program five years ago. Having fully repaid their first four loans, they are now on their fifth farming loan. The current loan will be used to buy sufficient quantity of peanut seeds and small items of farm equipment and fertilizer at the main market in Koutiala. At the end of the off-season, the harvested crops are placed in storage for a certain period to gain value before being sold at the main market of Koutiala and surrounding markets at retail (and often wholesale) prices. The produce is sold for cash to customers who generally come from the large towns. Once their agricultural produce has been sold, the members of the Wédayamana 4 Group each expect to make a profit of CFA 65,000, which will be used to repay the loan interest and cover everyday family expenses.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and small items of farm equipment

loans.name: Cao Thị

texts.en:
V. Cao Thị (656060050) is a 48-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has four adult children. To make a living, V. owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling poultry products in the local community. V. has been engaged in this business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2006, V. joined Kiva partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. V. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. V. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be her third from TYM Fund. V. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
Hoà Trần Thị (608970292) is a 47-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Hoà owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Hoà has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1997, Hòa joined Kiva partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hoà has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Hoà is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND, which will be used to renovate existing shelter for her livestock. The loan will be her twelfth from TYM Fund. Hoà plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To renovate existing livestock shelter

loans.name: Lê Thị

texts.en:
H. Lê Thị (627981315) is a 39-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has two school-aged children.

H. owns and operates a business primarily selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a months.

In 1998, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

H. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 11th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kuña Tekorory Group

texts.en:
The women of this committee are all neighbors and live in the same district, San Miguel. The group has been with Fundación Paraguaya for almost two years and is in its fourth loan cycle. The women meet every week to pay their loans and resolve problems if someone cannot pay. At these meetings they also have many other activities, including the weekly raffle of a gift that goes to one of the women. The group has savings of 850,000 PYG.  

The members are:
1  Lourdes F. – food sales 
2  Serviana M.	 – purse sales
3  Maria M. – small grocery store 
4  Feliciana C. – clothing sales 
5  Norma M. – merchandise delivery 
6  Maria Cardoso – small grocery store 
7  Rosa Cardoso – food sales 
8  Isabel Benitez – small grocery store 
9  Maria V. – bedding sales 
10  Antonia M. – clothing sales 
11  Rossana C.	 – beverage sales 
12  Mirna D. – food sales 
13  Lilian E. – clothing sales 
14  Maida D. – clothing sales 
15  Cinthia V. – jacket sales

loans.use: To purchase food items to sell

loans.name: Marie F.

texts.fr: Marie Françoise, 45 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants  en charge. Son activité est le commerce de tissu, ensembles et chaussures. Elle compte acheter des chaussures, des tissus d’art, du lin, confectionner des ensembles et vendre pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Marie Françoise, 45, is married and raising 5 children. Her business is selling cloth, outfits, and shoes. She expects to buy shoes, artistic cloth, and linen and make outfits to sell to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling cloth, outfits and shoes

loans.name: Gilbert Koudy

texts.fr: Gilbert koudy D. est un menuisier métallique dans le village de sandiara situé à 80km de Dakar. A l’approche de l hivernage il répare les semoirs  les matériels agricoles des villageois. Avec les revenus de  son travail il  entretien sa famille. Pour acheter des pièces est accessoires des semoirs et machines à labourer, il sollicite un prêt.
texts.en:
Gilbert Koudy D. is a metal worker in the village of Sandiara, situated 80 km from Dakar. As the rainy season approaches, he repairs tools for sowing seed and other agricultural implements for the villagers. With the income from his work, he supports his family. In order to buy parts and accessories for the tools for sowing seed and the plows, he is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital for his metal business

loans.name: Ricardo Israel

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo Israel H. y su Espasa tienen ya más de tres años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada en diferentes sitios de la ciudad. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para darle lo mejor a sus dos hijos pequeños que tiene.
En este momento al señor H. le están ofreciendo una mercancía de ropa  nueva a muy buen preció, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder obtener ese oferta que se le esta presentando. Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder compara la mercancía sin descapitalizar el negocio y los ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Ricardo Israel H. and his wife have been selling used clothing around the city for over three years. This business is how they make a living and support their two children. Right now Mr. H. is getting his merchandise at a good price, but he doesn’t have the money to buy it. This is why he is asking for a loan, so he can buy merchandise without using up all of his business’s and family’s income.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compara ropa nueva para el negocio

loans.name: Francis Jaqueline

texts.es:
la Sra. Francis Jaqueline B. A. es soltera, tiene 37 años de edad,  no tiene hijos y se dedica
a la venta de articulos varios como ser relojes, carteras de hombre, cuadernos, lapices, juguetes, su puesto esta ubicado en el mercado viejo de san lorenzo, tiene 2 años de estar ahi vendiendo este tipo de productos y ademas tiene un empleo como dependienta de una comercial, el negocio se lo atiende un amigo por las mañanas y en las tardes ella se dedica a su negocio.
 
nesecita el prestamo para comprar mas productos y asi tener mayores ganancias, su meta es poder alquilar o comprar un local para poner una tienda grande.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francis Jaqueline B. A. is a single, 37 year old woman who doesn’t have children. She sells a variety of things like: watches, men’s wallets, notebooks, pencils, and toys in a stall in the old San Lorenzo market. She has been selling these products for two years. She also has a job as a clerk in a store so her friend takes care of her business in the mornings and she takes over it in the afternoons. She needs a loan so she can buy products and earn more money. Her goal is to be able to rent or buy a space so she can have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de carteras, radios, relojes, dvds, juguetes, lapices, cuadernos,

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Wédayamana 5 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Wédayamana 5  est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Sirakélé de la ville de Koutiala région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec  en moyenne 45 ans et au moins 6 enfants.
Elles  font uniquement la culture de l’arachide.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe   Wédayamana  5 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre prêts précédents, elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, de semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture,  au grand marché de Koutiala ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Wédayamana 5 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 45 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Wédayamana 5 is a group of married women in the Sirakélé neighborhood, in the city of Koutiala (Sikasso Region, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large extended traditional families, average 45 years of age, and have at least 6 children. Their only business consists in growing peanuts. Eager to make their farming activities profitable, they decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, five years ago. After having repaid the previous four loans without problems, they are now seeking their fifth farming loan.

The loan will be used to buy, at the grand market in Koutiala, peanut seeds, small material, and fertilizers for the fields. After the rainy season, crops are stocked for a while to gain market value, before being sold at the grand market in Koutiala and in the surrounding villages, retail (often wholesale), to a clientele usually coming from the larger cities.

After selling their production, the members of the Wédayamana 5 group count on turning a profit of XOF 45000 (ca US$ 100), to be used to repay the loan and to pay for the daily expenses of the family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seed, small material, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: Seyni

texts.fr: Seyni N. est un couturier de profession, il exerce ce métier depuis plusieurs années dans le village de Sandiara situé à 80 km de Dakar capitale du Sénégal. Mais comme tous les villageois il  fait de l’embouche bovine en période hivernale, c’est ainsi qu’il sollicite un prêt  pour faire de l’embouche. Les revenus tirés de cette activé lui permettent de faire des investissements dans sa maison  construire une chambre ou acheter un lit.
texts.en:
Seyni N. is a tailor by profession. He has been working at this trade for several years in the village Sandiara, located 80 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. But like all villagers, he fattens cattle during the off-season. Thus, he’s requesting a loan for fattening livestock. The revenues derived from his business enable him to make investments in his house, to build a room or to buy a bed.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr: Ngoné D., 41ans est mariée avec 03 enfants et 02 autres membres de sa famille en charge. Elle s’active dans la vente de jus de fruits et de glaces Ce prêt va lui permettre d’acheter pain de singe (fruit du baobab), lait, bissap, sucre, sachets, de préparer les jus et vendre pou mieux assurer la prise en charge familiale;
texts.en:
Ngoné D., age 41, is married and has three children plus two other family members to support. She is active in selling fruit juices and ice cream. This loan is going to enable her to buy “monkey bread” (the fruit of the baobab tree), milk, dried hibiscus flowers, sugar, and bags for making juice drinks to sell, in order to provide for her family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell fruit juices and ice cream

loans.name: Wédayamana 6 Group

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut seed, small material, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
el señor Esteban R. tiene 40 años de edad,  esta casado con doña Marta Lidia Mendoza con quien procreo tres hijos de los cuales dos radican en los estados unidos y una se encuentra estudiando en la ciudad de San Lorenzo. 
Esteban esta solicitando credito para comprar mas mercaderia ya que en su negocio trabaja el y su esposa, los dos trabajan juntos en la venta de ropa y reparacion de zapatos.
nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que su negocio es muy bueno y que le genera ingresos para poder cubrir todos los gastos de su casa.
su meta es poder poner una tienda grande de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Mr. Esteban R. is 40 years old and married to Mrs. Marta Lidia Mendoza with whom he has 3 children, two of which are settled in the United States, the other studying in the city of San Lorenzo. Esteban is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise. He and his wife run their business together, working with both clothing sales and shoe repair. He commented to us that he is very pleased given that his business has been good and has generated enough income that he has been able to cover all of the costs of his house. His goal is to be able to open a big clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of clothing for women, men, and children

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr: Yaya B.   est un commerçant détaillant  qui vend des denrées alimentaires à sandiara village situé à 80km de Dakar la capitale sénégalaise. A trente sept (37) ans il est marié et père de famille. Il est dans le secteur du commerce depuis huit  ans  tout ses biens sont acquis avec les revenus du commerce. Il sollicite un prêt pour renforcer son fonds de commerce et acheter des quantités plus importantes de marchandises.
texts.en:
Yaya B. is a retail merchant who sells grocery items in the village of Sandiara village, located 80 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. He is 37 years old, married, and the father of a family. He has been in this field of business for eight years. All of his goods are gotten with the revenues from his business. He’s requesting a loan to boost his working capital and to buy more significant quantities of merchandise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ndeye Samb

texts.fr: Ndeye Samb N. est une coiffeuse de métier. Apres des études primaires qui n’ont réussit, elle a commencé à apprendre le métier de coiffeuse  pour enfin ouvrir son salon où elle forme aussi  de jeunes filles du village au métier de coiffeuse. Les revenus généré par l’activité lui permettent de satisfaire à ses besoins personnels et à ceux de se enfants. Pour acheter des produits (mèche  produits de traitements des cheveux) pour le salon, il sollicite un prêt
texts.en:
Ndeye Samb N. is a hairdresser by trade. After primary schooling, which was unsuccessful, she started learning the trade of hairdressing in order to open a salon, where she also trains village girls in hairdressing. The revenues generated by this business enables her to support herself and her children. To buy goods (hair extensions and hair treatment products) for her salon, she's requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and wigs

loans.name: Wédayamana 8 Group

loans.use: To buy peanut seed, small material, and fertilizers for the fields

loans.name: Coumberou

texts.fr: Coumberou  S. est une femme berger son activité principale est l’élevage des ovins. Elle fait ce métier depuis longtemps. Elle a passé toute sa vie à errer  en brousse avec ses moutons. A chaque approche de l hivernage, elle achète des moutons qu’elle embouche pour les revendre à la tabaski c’est ainsi qu’elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter des moutons. Les  revenus tirés de son activité d’embouche lui permettra d’acheter des vivres pour sa famille et de réparer sa case.
texts.en:
Coumberou S. is a shepherdess. Her main work involves raising sheep. She has been practicing this trade for a long time. She has spent her whole life roaming in the brush with her sheep. With each approach of the off-season, she buys sheep that she fattens for resale for the Tabaski holiday (Eid al-Adha). This is why she's requesting a loan, so as to buy sheep. The revenues derived from her business fattening livestock will enable her to buy provisions for her family and to repair her hut.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Dior

texts.fr: Dior S. est une femme berger son activité principale est l’élevage des ovins. Elle fait ce métier depuis longtemps. Elle a passé toute sa vie à errer  en brousse avec ses moutons. With each approach of the off-season, she buys sheep that she fattens for resale for the Tabaski holiday (Eid al-Adha). This is why she's requesting a loan, so as to buy sheep. The revenues derived from her business fattening livestock will enable her to buy provisions for her family and to repair her hut.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es:
la sra. Elsa Marina R. tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos, que dependen de ella al 100%.
uno de ellos esta en la escuela y la otra en el colegio.
Elsa se dedica a la venta de comida y golosinas como ser tacos, enchiladas, tortillas con quesillo, almuerzos, desayunos, baleadas, chicharras, pan con frijoles, burritas de carne, pollo frito etc. tiene 05 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, la cual le genera ingresos para mantener su familia.
Elsa necesita el prestamo para comprar pollo ,carne de res,frescos,arroz, frijoles, aceite, verduras para preparar sus comidas, ya que ahora tiene mucha demanda y no le ajustan las comidas que prepara.
su sueño es tener un restaurante completo para poder atender bien a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elsa Marina R., 40, is a single mother with two dependent children. One goes to elementary school, and the other one goes to high school. She sells sweets and food such as tacos, enchiladas, tortillas with cheese, lunches, breakfasts, baleadas (Honduran tortillas filled with mashed, fried beans and other ingredients), chicharras (fried pork rinds), bread with beans, meat burritos, fried chicken, etc. She has been in this business, which generates income to support her family, for five years. She needs a loan to buy chicken, beef, soft drinks, beans, oil, and vegetables to prepare her meals. She does not have enough food to meet the current demand. Her dream is to have a full restaurant to be able to giver her customers good service.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tortillas, soft drinks, vegetables, pastas, salsas, chicken, pork, beef, cabbage, fried pork rinds, lemons, spices, salt, oil, shortening, beans, bread

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 13 y 8 años en su casa propia. Se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de renovación y tapizado de sillones, trabaja todas las mañanas recorriendo las calles de su localidad en busca de nuevos clientes, su principal herramienta de trabajo es su muestrario de telas que siempre lleva con ella, una vez que ha conseguido un contrato se lo comunica a su esposo, pues trabajan juntos, tienen un taller en su casa donde elaboran los tapizados al gusto del cliente. Según la calidad de la tela y el trabajo realizado definen el precio de su servicio, este negocio lo vienen realizando desde hace 2 años y han notado que sus clientes van en aumento debido a las recomendaciones de sus clientes anteriores. Para más adelante tienen planes de implementar su taller con mayor cantidad de herramientas y abastecerse de nuevos modelos de telas. Esta es la primera vez que Elisa tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella fue invitada a formar parte de su banco comunal, y se siente muy contenta de esta decisión por lo que se compromete a ser responsable en sus pagos. El dinero que está utilizando será invertido en la compra de telas, además del pago para una persona que contratará para que les ayude en su taller.
texts.en:
Elisa, 37, lives in her own home with her husband and two children ages 13 and 8. She reupholsters chairs. She works every morning traveling the streets of her area looking for new customers. Her primary work tool is her sample board of fabrics that she always takes with her. Once she has gotten a contract, she lets her husband know. They work together. They have a shop in their home where they make the upholstery to the customers’ liking. According to the quality of the fabric and the work done, they determine a price for their service. They have been doing this for two years, and they notice that they have an increased number of customers due to the recommendations of previous customers. In the future they have plans to outfit their shop with more tools and stock new styles of fabric. This is the first time that Elisa needs a loan with MFP. She was invited to be part of her Community Bank. She is very happy about this decision, and she promises to be responsible with her payments. The money is to buy fabric and to pay a person who she will contract to help them in their shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material and pay a helper

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa tiene 39 años, vive soL. con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a L. venta ambulante D. un plato típico D. su zona a base D. carne D. cerdo, lo hace todos los días por L. tarD. hasta L. noche, en una zona cercana a su casa. Siempre busca el lugar D. más concurrencia D. gente, y D. esta manera lleva trabajando más D. 10 años. Con esta actividad sostiene las necesidades D. su familia y L. educación D. sus hijos, y para generar mayores ingresos planea empezar a vender los tejidos que realiza. Elisa ve con grandes expectativas su futuro, por lo que desea conseguir un local donD. pueda estabilizar su negocio. Esta es L. primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta D. formar parte D. su banco comunal, donD. se compromete a ser una socia muy activa. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en L. compra D. los ingredientes, al por mayor, para L. elaboración D. su platillo; como aceite por bidones, papa y carne D. cerdo.
texts.en:
Elisa, 39, lives with her three children in her own house. She is a traveling street vendor, and she sells pork dishes that are typical in her zone. She does this every day from the afternoon until night. She sells in a zone that is close to her house. She always looks for the place that has a big gathering of people. She has been working this way for over ten year. This business supports the family’s necessities and her children’s education. In order to generate more income, she plans to start selling the weavings that she makes. Elisa has great expectations for the future. She wants to get a place where she can establish her business. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very happy to be a part of her Community Bank. She promises to be a very active member. The money is to buy wholesale ingredients like cans of oil, potatoes, and pork to make her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for meal preparation

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina tiene 38 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos D. 16 y 18 años. Se dedica al procesamiento D. la papa, que es el principal producto D. su zona, su trabajo consiste en sancochar la papa, pelarla y hacerla secar al sol, una vez seca sirve para la elaboración D. diferentes platos típicos. Este trabajo generalmente lo realiza sola, pero en algunas ocasiones, cuando están libres D. sus estudios, sus hijos la apoyan. Lo que produce lo venD. por sacos a los principales comerciantes D. abarrotes D. su localidad y hasta el momento esta actividad le ha permitido sostener los gastos familiares, complementando con el trabajo D. su esposo. Para un futuro cercano, a Josefina le gustaría tener una tienda D. abarrotes. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella está muy contenta D. ser parte D. su banco comunal y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita será para mejorar la infraestructura D. su casa para acondicionar un almacén para sus sacos D. papa procesada.
texts.en:
Josefina, 38, lives in a house she owns with her husband and their 2 children, 16 and 18, respectively. She operates a business processing potatoes, the main crop in the region. She parbroils the potatoes, peels them and dries them in the sun. Once they're dried, they can be used to make a range of traditional dishes. She generally works alone but, on occasion, when her children are free from their studies, they help her. She sells what she makes to the principle grocers in her neighborhood and, so far, the business, along with her husband's work, has allowed her to keep up with family expenses. In the near future, Josefina would like to have a grocery business. This is her first MFP loan. She's very happy to be part of her commity bank and has committed to repaying her loan on time. The money that she's requesting will be used to improve the infrastructure of her house so that she can create a storage space for her sacks of processed potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Set up a store for food business.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Julia R. D. tiene 23 años, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Victor Raul Haya de la Torre distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio Secundaria Completa, tiene 1 hija que depende económicamente de ella.
Maria  se dedica al alquiler de peliculas en cinta y DVD, este negocio se inicio hace 3 meses, antes vendía medicina,  su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Lideresas en Acciòn  II, lo invirtió en la compra de medicinas.
El crédito de 400 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de peliculas en cinta y DVD para implementar su negocio.
Maria tiene como sueño tener su tienda de peliculas en cintas y DVD mas implementada para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Julia R. D., 23, lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She completed high school. She has 1 daughter in her care. Maria operates a business renting films on tape and DVD. She started the business 3 months ago and, before that, she sold medicines. She operates the business in her house. She invested the first loan, for 300 soles, that she received from her community bank, Lideresas en Accion II [(Women) Leaders in Action II], in medicines. The 400 soles loan will be invested in the purchase of movies on tape and DVD to establish the business. Maria has dreams of owning a more established video store selling movies on tape and DVD and growing as an entrepeneur.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Set up a video rental business.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina tiene 52 años, vive en una casa arrendada con sus dos menores hijos de 10 y 12 años. Desde hace más de 20 año se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, todas las mañanas, junto a sus hijos procesan la papa manualmente, pelándola y haciéndola secar en el sol para venderla en el mercado principal de su comunidad. Este trabajo es muy sacrificado puesto que requiere de largas horas de trabajo bajo el intenso sol, a pesar de eso, continúa, porque sabe que esta actividad le brinda las ganancias para sostener a su familia. Martina quiere seguir mejorando su producción y para más adelante emprender otro negocio. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, por lo que tiene grandes expectativas de conocer y ser parte de esta nueva experiencia de un trabajo solidario en su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de costales y el pago del transporte de la papa que va a cosechar.
texts.en:
Martina, 52, lives in a rented house with her two young children, 10 and 12, respectively. She has made a living doing farm work for more than 20 years. Every morning, with her children, she processes potatoes by hand, peeling them and drying them in the sun before selling them in the town's main market. The work is very difficult because it requires long hours of labor in the blazing sun. She goes on, despite this, because she knows that the business provides the living that supports her family. Martina wants to continue improving her production and, in the future, set up another business. This is her first MFP loan and she's very much looking forward to learning about and being part of a community bank, a new experience for her. The money that she's requesting will be used to purchase bags and to pay to transport the potatoes that she will harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for bags and transportation for food business.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es: Roberta tiene 60 años es viuda, vive con sus 2 hijas mayores en su casa propia. DesD. hace más D. 10 años se dedica a la venta D. productos alimenticios D. su zona (truchas, papa, quesos, etc.), cada 15 días viaja a otras ciudades para comercializarlos en los mercados o ferias locales y también dejar los pedidos D. sus clientes regulares. Con el tiempo y la experiencia Roberta ha sabido superar los riesgos D. su trabajo, tales como la descomposición D. alguno D. sus productos en el camino cuando la carretera está bloqueada debido a las fuertes lluvias, pese a estas circunstancias, su esfuerzo ha sido compensado con las ganancias que recibe. Para el futuro, Roberta desea seguir dedicándose a esta actividad hasta donD. den sus fuerzas. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, está muy entusiasmada por la oportunidad que tiene D. formar parte D. un banco comunal, donD. se compromete a ser  muy responsable. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra D. mayor cantidad D. los productos que venD..
texts.en:
Roberta, 60, is a widow. She lives with her 2 grown daughters in the house she owns. For more than 10 years, she's maD. a living selling local food products (trout, potatoes, cheese, etc.). Every 15 days, she travels to other cities in order to sell her products at local markets or fairs and to drop off orders for her regular customers. With time and experience, Roberta has learned how to mitigate the risks of her business, risks such as losing part of her stock to decomposition when the roads are blocked because of torrential rains. Even so, her efforts have paid off with the earnings that she's maD.. For the future, Roberta wants to continue working at the business that she's put so much effort to build. This is her first MFP loan and she's excited by the opportunity to be a part of a community bank and committed to being responsible to it. The money that she's requesting will be invested in the purchase of larger quantities of the products that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Rossana

texts.es: Rossana tiene 31 años, vive con sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de comida al paso en la esquina de su casa, por la mañana prepara todo lo necesario para empezar a vender por las tardes. Una de las dificultades que se le presentan es la lluvia, ya que vende bajo una pequeña una carpa que no la protege en su totalidad del frió y ni del agua, a pesar de esto, Rossana se mantiene perseverante porque desea incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ya tuvo la experiencia del trabajar en equipo en otras organizaciones, pero ahora se ha comprometido con su banco comunal para apoyar en el crecimiento de todos. El dinero que está solicitando será utilizado para adquirir alimentos comestibles no perecibles (en grandes cantidades) y un balón de gas para su cocina.
texts.en:
Rossana, 31, lives with her 3 children. For 3 years, she's operated a business selling meals to passers-by at the corner by her house. She prepares what she needs during the morning so that she can sell her meals in the afternoon. One of the difficulties that she faces is rain. She has a small canopy under which she sells her meals but it doesn't completely protect her from the cold or the wet. Even so, Rossana perseveres because she wants to increase her income. This is her first MFP loan. She already has experience working in teams with other organizations, but now she's promised her community bank to help everyone grow. The money that she's requesting will be used to buy non-perishable food products (in large quantities) and a gas cylinder for her kitchen.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and equipment for food business.

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es: Yeni tiene 30 años, vive con sus padres en la casa de ellos. Por 9 años trabajó en una pastelería y durante ese tiempo aprendió el manejo de ese negocio, por lo que decidió abrir su propio establecimiento en una zona céntrica de su ciudad. Ella misma elabora los pasteles y ha contratado a una joven para que la ayude en la atención al público. Hasta el momento las ventas han sido exitosas, debido a que utiliza ingredientes de muy buena calidad para la preparación de cada uno de sus pasteles. Para el futuro, Yeni se proyecta a tener sucursales de su pastelería para expandir su mercado de ventas. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, tiene grandes deseos de aprender y trabajar con su banco comunal, por lo que se le nota muy entusiasmada. El dinero que está solicitando será destinado a la compra de sacos de harina, manteca y demás ingredientes para la preparación de sus pasteles.
texts.en:
Yeni, 30, lives with her parents in their house. She worked in a bakery for nine years. During that time she learned how to manage the business. So, she decided to open her own establishment in a central zone of her city. She makes the cakes herself, and she has hired a young helper to wait on customers. Her sales have been successful because she uses very good quality ingredients to make each one of her cakes. In the future, Yeni projects having branches of her bakery in order to expand her sales market. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very enthusiastic because she has a big desire to learn and work with her Community Bank. The loan is to buy sacks of flour and other ingredients to make her cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make cakes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a small-businesswoman who is in her first year of her business in Ciudad del Este. Before, she and her husband worked selling clothes in Buenos Aires. Now, they have their own store in a local market, which they inherited from her family. 

Her clothing store is a small boutique that is currently selling clothes for the winter, as the weather is getting colder. She used her loan to buy this kind of merchandise, and to keep stocking her business. Despite the fact that she has much competition, Antonia has a well-established clientele base. In the future, Antonia would like to expand her business from not only clothes, but to selling shoes as well.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for sale

loans.name: María Asunción

texts.en:
Maria is married to a painter, with whom she has two school-aged children. She has been a dressmaker for over six years, and is currently working on a project making school uniforms for neighborhood families. She can make about four sweaters a day. Additionally, she just started a small grocery store that she is starting to stock bit by bit. 

This is her first loan with Fundación Paraguaya, so she is only taking out a small amount to get started. She hopes to be able to later take out larger loans in order to stock her small grocery store. In the future she would also like to buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy yarn to make sweaters

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.en:
ClotilD. is married and has two children who are both in college, one in his first year and the other in his fourth. One of her sons also owns a business selling car alarms. The family is very close and they all support each other financially. 

ClotilD. owns a hamburger stand as well as a motorcycle wash. She has owned both of these businesses for over fifteen years. She has a well-formed clientele that comes from all around the neighborhood to eat and drink at her stand. She says that in the summer, business is the best, but even in the winter she has enough customers to get by. In the future she would like to make her stand bigger in order to serve a larger customer base.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Maria Liboria

texts.en:
Maria V. R. has been a client of Fundación Paraguaya for five years. She is married, and her husband is a photographer. Together they have three children, all school-aged.

Maria has owned her clothing store for over ten years. It has been growing and she has a well-established clientele base. Maria travels every so often to Brazil to buy more merchandise to sell. Her dream is to build a second floor to her store in order to offer more products to her clients.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Kadidiatou

texts.fr: kadidiatou G. est une jeune mére de famille de 28 ans qui excelle dans le domaine de la menuiserie bois. Elle fabrique tout meuble de maison ou de bureau et est l'une des rares femmes qui ont choisi ce métier destiné généralement aux hommes. Avec son activité elle parvient à aider son pére pour les besoins sociaux et prendre en charge l'éducation de son unique fils qui est actuellement en internat dans une école de la région de kolda. Elle voudrait augmenter son stock de bois pour honorer ses engagements.
texts.en:
Kadidiatou G., age 28, is a young mother of a family who excels in the field of woodworking. She makes any home or office furniture and is one of the rare women who've chosen this trade, generally set aside for men. With her business, she manages to help her father with societal demands and with educational expenses for his only son, who is currently in a boarding school in the Kolda region. She would like to increase her stock of wood to honor her commitments.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood for making furniture

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basila began her business of selling plastic wares six years ago with only a few items. Before receiving a loan she worked as a trash collector for the city. Fueled by her desire to succeed, she joined her local Committee of Women and benefited greatly from the support of her neighbors and friends. After four years, she felt secure in her business and left the Committee to receive individual credit. 

Today, Basila’s plastics shop is filled with a wide range of goods and she is happy to service a large clientele. Her daughter often works with her and her son owns his own electronics shop in the center of the city. Although her work has long hours and isn’t easy, she is proud to own her shop and has aspirations to continue to make her business better.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.en:
Gustavo has been a carpenter for 20 years after learning the basic skills from his brother-in-law. He works from home building and designing many different furniture pieces from wood, including a combination ironing board-bookshelf piece. He has a seller who picks up the completed items and sells them to clients all around the city. It is thanks to his success as a carpenter that he is able to afford a car and live comfortably in a house that he has made many improvements to himself over the years. 

His wife is also actively involved in the family’s finances, operating her own business of creating and selling floral table arrangements from home. She is also a member of her local Committee of Women. Together Gustavo and his wife have two children studying in primary school that they are very proud of and they hope to send them both to college one day. 

Written by Maya Rusten, Fundación Paraguaya Intern

loans.use: To purchase materials for his business

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: C'est un jeune de kolda qui s'est lancé dans la réparation de motocyclettes et la vente de leurs piéces détachées. Il est célibatare mais responsable dans la gestion quotidienne de la maison où il vit avec sa maman. Avec ses revenus il essaye d'aider sa maman et de préparer un peu son avenir. Cependant le manque de moyens ralentit ses activités qu'il aimerait voir se développer
texts.en:
This is a young person from Kolda who got started in the motorbike repair business along with their spare parts. He is unmarried but in charge of the everyday managing of the house, where he lives with his mother. With his revenues, he tries to help his mother and to prepare a little for his future. However, a lack of means is slowing his business, which he would like to see develop.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair motorbikes and to sell spare parts

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia began her business for the same reason that many other entrepreneurs do: to be her own boss. Recognizing the need for a hardware store in their neighborhood, she and her husband decided to make a dream a reality. In the year and a half that Sonia and her husband have owned their own business, they have learned that it is a time-consuming and demanding endeavor.  They still appreciate the flexibility it allows.

With a loan from ACCION USA, they will be able to acquire working capital and buy inventory for the store. They will purchase a key-making machine, supplies, tiles, and drills.

Sonia splits her time between the store and her job in pharmaceuticals, and will continue to do so until the family business is able to generate greater profit. Fortunately their 9-year-old son is able to offer a helping hand on occasion. Looking to the future, Sonia and her husband plan to continue growing their business and hope to someday be able to hire additional employees.

loans.use: A key making machine and other tools

loans.name: Espiritu Santo Group

texts.en:
Pablina M. started this group almost one year ago. The group is now in its fourth cycle of loans with the Fundación Paraguaya.

They are neighbors and friends from the Mburukuja neighborhood of Ciudad del Este. They do activities every weekend together to earn money on the side for when one member may not be able to pay their loan or is encountering difficulties with her business. Their official group savings is 5,000,000 Gs. During their weekly meetings, the women have a raffle of basic needs products within the group. They are very supportive and responsible, and always pay their loan on time, if not in advance. 1 Cristina M. - Handicrafts 2 Daisy R. - Sandal sales 3 Pablina M. - Food sales 4 Lorenza L. - Cosmetic sales 5 Ada P. - Beverage sales 6 Leonarda B. - Lottery ticket sales 7 Nicolasa B. - Convenience store 8 Geronima A. - Food sales 9 Maria S. - Sandal sales 10 Cintia M. - Clothing sales 11 Maria R. - Dressmaker 12 Maria G. - Cleaning product sales 13 Evanir H. - Small grocery store 14 Rosalina N. - Undergarment sales 15 Liz V. - Clothing sales 16 Rosa V. - Cleaning product sales 17 Antonia P. - Cosmetic sales 18 Maria G. - Costmetic sales 19 Marlene H. - Diner 20 Patrocinia M. - Cosmetic sales 21 Alcida A. - Food sales 22 Apolonia V. - Small grocery store

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.en:
