Liliana is 30 years old and single. She lives in Capiata with her mother. They feed employees from a nearby factory, as well as other clients. They have served meals for six years.

Before that, Liliana worked in a restaurant as a cook, but she decided to start working on her own so her profit margin would increase. Thanks to her efforts, she was able to finish building her mother’s home.

This loan is for the purchase of merchandise in bulk, because it is cheaper to buy that way, meaning more profit.

loans.use: Purchase in bulk to save money.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo Valentín (de la misma edad), quien es chofer, y con sus hijos Magali de 22, Mayra de 20 y Valentina de 3 añitos en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años se viene dedicando a la atención de sus cabinas públicas de Internet, las cuales implementó en su casa. Nos cuenta que anteriormente tenía que alquilar un local, pero gracias a un préstamo con MFP pudo arreglar su casa para instalar sus cabinas allí mismo. Ahora trabaja más tranquila y le gusta mucho su negocio ya que se le hace más fácil dedicarse de lleno a él, aunque muchas veces trabajar sola implica tener que resolver algunas dificultades con las computadoras, felizmente siempre ha sabido salir adelante y sabe que si quiere seguir progresando tiene que trabajar mucho, además está pensando poner a un costado de su local un centro de llamadas telefónicas. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, y dinero que solicita será para seguir mejorando su local, además de instalar cabinas telefónicas para generar otros ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana, 45, lives in her own house with her husband, Valentín, and her two children. Valentín is a chauffeur, and he is the same age as Ana. Her children are Magali, 22; Mayra, 20; and Valentina, 3. For two years she has been in the business of public Internet access, which is set up in her house. She previously had to rent a place, but thanks to a loan with MFP, she was able to arrange to set up the cubicles in her house. She now works more calmly. She really likes the business since it is easier to work on it full time, even though many times all she has to do is resolve problems with the computers. Happily, she has always known how to get ahead, and she knows that if she wants to keep progressing, she needs to work a lot. She is also thinking of putting a center for making phone calls on the side of her place. This is her fourth loan with Prisma. The money is to keep improving her place and to install telephone booths to generate other income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her place and set up a calling center

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis tiene 30 años, es soltera, vive con sus hijas Celeste de 8 años y Erica de 2 años y medio de edad en su casa propia. Ella se describe como una persona muy curiosa, y por esta curiosidad nació su iniciativa de dedicarse a la venta de productos de belleza, ya que le permite aconsejar a sus clientas sobre los cosméticos le van mejor de acuerdo a su tez y color de piel. Además de eso también elabora bonitos collares, pulseras, anillos, aretes, etc., siendo una mujer muy creativa. Desde que incursionó en este negocio ha pasado un año, en el cual le ha ido muy bien, ya que todo lo que ofrece y diseña es muy requerido por su clientela, por ello tiene ingresos mensuales seguros, resultándole muy rentable. A Gladis le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que no tiene un jefe, ella misma decide qué hacer y cuándo hacerlo, lo que le da tiempo para el cuidado de sus hijas. Pero su trabajo no es nada fácil, pues requiere de gran dedicación y esfuerzo para realizar cada una de las joyas, además de buena visión y puntería. En un futuro cercano, Gladis quiere tener un gran bazar donde ofrecer toda su mercadería. Este es su primer crédito individual  con MFP, donde se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos, cuando trabajaba con un banco comunal. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de cosméticos para cumplir con sus pedidos y también adquirirá mostacillas y otras piedras para realizar sus lindas joyas.
texts.en:
Gladis is thirty years old and single. She lives in her own house with her daughters; Celeste is eight, and Erica is two and a half. She describes herself as being a very curious person. Her initiative to sell beauty products was born from this curiosity. She gives her customers advice about which cosmetics are best for them according to their complexion and the color of their skin. Being a very creative woman, she also makes beautiful necklaces, bracelets, rings, earrings, etc. She has been in this business for one year, and it been going very well. Everything that she designs and offers is much in customer demand. Because of this she has a secure monthly income, which is very profitable. Gladis really likes her work. Since she does not have a boss, she gets to decide herself what to do and when to do it. This gives her time to take care of her daughters. But, her work is not easy. It requires great dedication and effort to make each one of her pieces of jewelry. It also requires good vision and being good at close work. In the near future, Gladis would like to have a large bazaar where she could offer all of her merchandise. This is her first individual loan with MFP. She was punctual with all of her payments when she worked with a community bank. With the money she will buy more cosmetics to fill her orders. She will also buy beads, and other stones to make her lovely jewelry.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise and buy materials

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia, su hijo José ya es independiente. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, ya que desde muy joven aprendió a confeccionar prendas, las cuales distribuye a sus vecinos quienes son sus principales clientes. A Marcela le gusta mucho su trabajo, es por eso que le pone mucha dedicación para hacer bonitos acabados, actualmente se encuentra elaborando polos y poleras para niños. Pero no todo es tan fácil como parece, ya que el obtener una bonita prenda requiere de varias horas de esfuerzo cortando la tela, juntando las piezas, cosiéndolas, etc, felizmente para ella el paso de los años ha hecho que se vuelva muy experimentada en la materia y que lo que antes le tomaba mucho tiempo ahora lo pueda realizar más rápido. Le va muy bien, debido a que tiene bastantes pedidos, no sólo de sus vecinos, si no de otros lugares, como ahora que tiene un pedido en el distrito de San Juan de Lurigancho a 3 horas en auto del distrito de Ventanilla que es donde ella vive. Ver crecer su negocio le da esperanzas de saber que puede mejorar mucho más, es por eso que en el futuro quisiera tener un taller más grande, con gran cantidad de máquinas de coser, remalladoras, etc. Hace 3 años que trabaja con Microfinanzas PRISMA, pero este es su primer préstamo individual, pues antes lo hacía a través de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará tela en gran cantidad para confeccionar mochilas, que es el pedido que le han hecho recientemente, para ello debe comprar cierres y otros implementos para darles un buen acabado.
texts.en:
Marcela, 46, lives with her husband in her own home. Her son, José, is independent of her. She has been selling clothes for five years. She learned to make clothes when she was very young. She distributes the clothes to her neighbors who are her primary customers. Marcela likes her work a lot, so she works with dedication while making her pretty finished products. She is currently making polo shirts and t shirts for children. But, it is not as easy as it seems. To make a pretty garment requires various hours of effort cutting the fabric, joining the pieces, sewing them, etc. Happily for her, the passage of the years has made her very experienced with the material. What used to take her a long time she now does more rapidly. It is going very well for her because she has enough orders, not just from her neighbors but from other places. She now has an order in the San Juan de Lurigancho district, which is three hours by car from the Ventanilla district where she lives. Seeing her business grow gives her the hope of knowing that she can improve much more. That is why, in the future, she would like to have a larger shop with more sewing machines, overcast stitch machines, etc. She has worked with Microfinanzas Prisma for three years, but this is her first individual loan. Previously, she received loans through her community bank. She will use the money to buy a big quantity of fabric to make backpacks, which is the order she recently received. She also needs to buy zippers and other implements to give them a good finish.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sewing materials

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Patricia tiene poco tiempo que se quedo viuda y bajo su responsabilidad tres hijos, quienes ya están creciendo y quieren su propio espacio.
Ella trabaja en la compañía de agua de la ciudad como secretaria sus ingresos son bajos y no cuanta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar la mejora. Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que requiere para la elaboración de una recama la cual para los niños.
texts.en:
Claudia Patricia was widowed a short time ago and she was left to be the sole provider for her three children. They are growing now and they are needing more space. She works for a water company in the city as a secretary. She does not make enough from her job to pay to make a much-needed addition to her home. This is why she is asking for a loan to be able to buy the materials she needs to add a room to her house for her children.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a bedroom for her children.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Javier P. tiene poco tiempo que le entregaron su vivienda por medio de Infonavit. Pero le está haciendo falta las protecciones en las puertas y ventanas.
Está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar a la persona que se encargara de elaborar y colocar las protecciones y así el y su familia podrán ir abitar su nueva casa con mas seguridad.
Don francisco trabaja en una compañía de pinturas este es el ingreso que el genera para su familia y con el cual una parte lo destinara para el crédito.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier Pena recently acquired a house through the organization Infonavit, but it lacks the necessary protection for the doors and widows. He needs a loan so he can hire someone to install protection over his windows and doors so he and his family can live in their new home safely. He gets income for his family from his painting company and he generates income that will allow him to take care of his family and pay back the loan.

(Translated by Elizabeth of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install protection over his windows and doors so he and his family can live in their new home safely.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es: El señor Vidal López García, tiene la edad de 44 años, habita en el barrio San José de los Ríos, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa , ellos tiene cuatro hijos , de 19,17,15y 13 años , todos estudian actualmente y en tiempos libres le apoyan con los trabajos agrícolas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda , desde hace 21 años don Vidal es agricultor , la mayor necesidad que se le ha presentada durante este tiempo es el mal invierno , el inicio este trabajo con ayuda de sus padres y ha venido haciendo prestamos en Afodenic para hacer mejoras a su producción, este es su séptimo ciclo el cual va invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder obtener una buena cosecha y vender a mejor en el mercado
texts.en:
Sir Vidal L. G. is 44 years old, and lives in a neighborhood in San Jose de los Ríos in the city of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife and their four children who are 19, 17, 15, and 13 years old. His children are currently in school and help out with the farm work, too. He plans to improve the living conditions of his family. He has been a farmer for 21 years and his hardest time is during the winter when the crops don’t grow well. He began the farm work with his parents, and now needs loans to improve production. This is the seventh time that he is using a loan to improve his crop yield and sales. He will use this loan to buy fertilizers and materials so that he will have a successful crop and he will then sell his production for the best price at the market.

(Translated by Elizabeth of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and fertilizers to improve his crop.

loans.name: Guadalupe Esperanza

texts.es: La señora Guadalupe Esperanza J., tiene la edad de 37 años, reside en el bario Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijos que estudian, su esposo es jubilado, ella se desempeña como enfermera profesional desde hace trece años. Ha sido un proceso de largas jornada ya que cuando empezó inicio de afanadora en el hospital, pero siguió estudiando su secundaria y luego su carrera que con mucho cansancio y sacrificio para comprar los libro. Pero que ha sido en su vida positivo ya que ha podido lograr tener mejor trabajo como ingresos. Este es su séptimo ciclo en Afodenic lo cual ha invertido en hacer mejoras a su vivienda, con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer una pared, y poder tener seguridad para su familia. Da las gracias  ala institución por los logros que ha tenido en hacer mejoras a su casa a plazo considerables. Sus planes es poder seguir estudiando y apoyar a sus hijos a que sean personas de bien para la sociedad.
texts.en:
Guadalupe Esperanza J. is 37. She lives in the Memorial Sandino district of Managua. She has two children. Her husband is retired, and she has been working as a professional nurse for thirteen years.

It has taken a lot of hard work, since she started as a cleaner in the hospital. However, she continued with her secondary education and then nursing school, although it was very tiring and she had to make lots of sacrifices in order to buy the books. But she was successful and now has a better job with better pay.

This is her seventh loan from Afodenic, to invest in home improvements; with this loan, she will buy construction materials to build a wall to provide security for her family. She is grateful to the institution for enabling her to improve her home while paying in instalments. She plans to continue studying and to provide support to her children so that they can become upright members of society.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a concrete wall

loans.name: Rodolfo De Los Angeles

texts.es: El señor Rodolfo C. tiene la edad de 47 años, casado y con dos hijos que cursan sus estudios, reside en el barrio Hialeah en la capital de Managua, el trabajo que desempeña  es de evanista y maestro de carpintería desde hace treinta y un año, sus planes es incrementar su patrimonio, este negocio lo inicio con sus padres ya que el era ayudante, luego trabajo por cuenta propia, con este crédito quiere comprar materia prima para hacer mueble, poder realizar nuevos diseños para seguir ofertando sus productos de calidad y captar clientes nuevos. Que le permita obtener mejores beneficios de ganancia para poder proyectarse en hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Rodolfo C. is 47 years old. He’s married and has two kids who are studying in school. They live in the neighborhood of Hialeah in the capital of Managua. He has made a living as a cabinetmaker and a carpinter for the past 31 years. His plans are to increase his assets. He started this business with his parents since he was able to be a helper, then he started working for himself. With this loan he plans to buy raw materials to make furniture, powder to make new designs and he will be able to supply his customers with products of great quality. This will allow him to obtain increased profits and to allow his business grow.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Doña candida es una mujer emprendedora, desde hace quince años se dedica a las ventas de electrodomésticos y cosméticos, que inicio con la iniciativa de tener ingresos para poder apoyar a sus cuatro hijos para que estudien. Tiene 56 años de edad, reside en el barrio Hialeah en la capital de Managua, no ha podido crecer por falta de financiamientos. Con este préstamo va invertir en electrodomésticos y variedad de cosmético para ofertar a sus clientes. Da las gracias Afodenic por los créditos otorgados y por el crecimiento que ha tenido con estos dos préstamos. Sus planes es poder incrementar el volumen de venta y tener más clientes.
texts.en:
Candida is an enterprising woman. She has been selling domestic appliances and cosmetics for 15 years. She started the business to obtain earnings so that her four children could continue studying. She is 56 and lives in the Hialeah district of Managua.

Lack of finance prevented her from expanding. She will use the loan to buy domestic appliances and cosmetics to sell to her customers. She is grateful to Afodenic for the loans she has received and because these two loans have enabled her to expand. She plans to increase sales volume and have more customers.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy domestic appliances and cosmetics

loans.name: Luis Ángel

texts.es:
El señor Luis Ángel C. tiene ya más de cinco años dedicándose a la elaboración de herrería, este es el ingreso que tiene para su familia. 
      Pero le está haciendo falta material eléctrica y poder elaborar unos pedidos que tiene para entregar. Como no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la compara esta solicitando un préstamo y así, entregar la mercancía a tiempo  y sus clientes lo podrán recomendar con otras personas, y su negocio crecerá, tendrá mas ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Ángel C. has worked as a blacksmith for over five years. This is the income he has for his family. But, he is lacking electrical material to fill some orders. As he does not have the money to buy the material, he is asking for a loan. Then he could finish the orders on time, and his customers could recommend him to other people. His business will grow, and he will have more income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy electrical material

loans.name: Victoria Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Victoria H. tiene 33 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos que cursan la primaria, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, su esposo trabaja como odontólogo por cuenta propia, el negocio de doña Victoria es la venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos que inicio hace trece años, con ahorro y solo vendiendo cosméticos. Con este préstamo va invertir en la compra de perfumes y cosmético para ofertar a sus clientes la variedad de sus productos. Es te es su noveno crédito y da las gracias Afodenic por que le ha permitido mantenerse en el negocio y ha podido sobresalir adelante en su vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Victoria H. is 33, married, and has two children who attend elementary school. She lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. Her husband is a dentist who works for himself. Victoria has been selling clothes, shoes, and cosmetics. She started thirteen years ago with savings and only selling cosmetics. With this loan she will buy perfumes and cosmetics to offer her customers a variety of products. This is her ninth loan, and she thanks Afodenic for allowing her to stay in her business. She has been able to be get ahead and be successful in her family life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Maria Tereza

texts.es: Doña Maria R. tiene la edad de 53 años, reside en el barrio Villa Fraternidad, casada y con cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, su esposo de trabaja en auto lavados. La señora Maria es una mujer que ha apoyado a su familia en lo necesario, desde hade dieciocho años administra una pulpería que inicio con una liquidación de su trabajo anterior. Luego comenzó hacer préstamos en Afodenic el cual este es su sexto préstamo que ha sido de mucho beneficio ya que incremento su inventario lo cual le ha generado muchas ganancias. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos como: frijoles, arroz y productos lácteos como enlatado que es lo que los clientes demandan.
texts.en:
Maria R. is 53, and she lives in the Villa Fraternidad neighborhood. She is married and has four grown children. Her husband works washing cars. Maria is a woman who has supported her family in their necessities. She has run her mini market, which started from a liquidation of her previous work, for eighteen years. Then she began to get loans from Afodenic. Her sixth loan has been very beneficial by increasing her inventory and generating lots of earnings. This loan is to buy basic grains, beans, rice, and canned milk products to meet her customers' demands.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and milk products

loans.name: Josefa Nubia

texts.es: Doña Josefa Nubia Z., es una mujer que ha logrado salir adelante con sus ventas de ropa y zapatos  desde hace once años  vende ella inicio con ahorros propios, y ahora esta incrementando mas su negocio con prestamos que Afodenic le ha otorgado. Con este crédito comprara ropa para niños y adultos y zapatos variados. Lo cual espera aumentar las ventas y obtener mejores ganancias. Sus planes es comprar una vitrina grande  y poder poner sus productos accesibles a la vista del cliente. También desea poder apoyar a sus hijos a que sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Dona Josefa Nubia Z. is a woman who, for eleven years, has managed to pull herself up with her clothing- and shoe-sales business. She started the business with some savings and is now growing the business with loans provided to her by Afodenic. With this loan, she will buy clothing for children and adults and shoes, all of which she hopes will add to her sales and increase her earnings. Her plan is to buy a large display case so that she can better show her customers what she has to sell. She also wants to be able to help her children continue their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Eveling Violeta

texts.es: Doña Eveling Violeta Sánchez tiene la edad de 50 años, su negocio es la venta cosméticos y alquiler de cuarto, en sus ventas lleva doce años en el mercado, alquilando cuarto cuatro años el cual ha sido de muchos beneficios para apoyar  a sus cinco hijos tres son mayores y dos están cursando sus estudios. La señora Eveling tiene la edad de 50 años, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, su esposo es maestro de obra y esta laborando en el país de Costa Rica. Este es su cuarto crédito en Afodenic y lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras a los cuartos que tiene alquilando así podrá tener mejor precio y mejor servicios a sus clientes. A futuro espera lograr hacer otros cuartos que le generen más ganancias. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo otorgado.
texts.en:
Dona Eveling Violeta S., 50, operates a business selling cosmetics and renting rooms. She's been selling cosmetics for twelve years and renting rooms for four years and the business has provided her a means to support her five children, three now grown and two still in school. Sra. Eveling is 50 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood. Her husband is a construction foreman and he's working in Costa Rica. This is her fourth Afodenic loan. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials so that she can improve the rooms that she rents and, in turn, increase her prices and provide a better service to her customers. In the future, she hopes to be able to rent other room and generate more revenue. She's very grateful to the institution for helping her.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for room-rental business.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es: Agripina es una madre muy dedicada y cariñosa, tiene 35 años y vive con sus 3 hijos Yeni de 17, Denis de 14 y Víctor de 13, en la casa que le heredaron sus padres y lo que más desea es darles una vida digna. Agripina ha trabajado mucho en su vida para salir adelante, desde muy joven entró al negocio de la venta de ropa, actividad que le dio el dinero necesario para vivir. Actualmente su puesto está ubicado en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (Lugar donde se realizan ferias en Juliaca), ella es una vendedora muy alegre y siempre recibe a sus compradores con una sonrisa en los labios. Agripina disfruta de vender ropa y siempre convence a sus clientes de llevarse alguna prenda, anhela tener una tienda donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad su mercadería y atender mejor a sus clientes. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y lo que considera más difícil de su negocio es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto sin poder ir a ningún lado. Su deseo es ver a sus hijos profesionales y está dispuesta a trabajar duro para lograrlo. Este es el sexto préstamo de Agripina con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en su anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora, en su banco comunal es muy activa y es muy querida por el resto de las socias. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa, para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende.
texts.en:
Agripina is a dedicated and caring mother. She is 35 years old and lives with her 3 children: Yeni, 17; Denis, 14; and Victor, 13. They live in a house that she inherited from her parents and what she most wants in the world is to give her children a decent life. Agripina has worked hard all her life to get ahead. At a young age, she started selling clothes, work that provides the money necessary to live. She now has a space on the Explanada Laguna Temporal (where the market fairs are held in Juliaca). She's a cheerful saleswoman and always meets potential buyers with a smile on her face. Agripina enjoys selling clothing and always convinces her customers to walk away with some article of clothing or other. Her greatest wish is to own a store where she can better tend to her customers and sell her merchandise more easily. She's operated the business for 8 years and the most difficult thing for her is having to stay in one place all day without being able to venture out. She wants to see her children take up professional careers and she's ready to work hard to make that happen. This is Agripina's sixth MFP loan. She has been very punctual in repaying past loans and expects to be so now, too. She is very active in her community bank and is well-regarded by the other members. With the three-thousand soles that she's requesting, she will buy more clothing to increase the quantity of merchandise she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stock for clothing business.

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es: Agueda es una mujer soltera de 30 años, vive en la casa de sus familiares, quienes la apoyan mucho, ella desea sobresalir en la vida y sabe que para eso tiene que trabajar mucho. Trabaja arduamente todo los días realizando tejidos artesanales, sus clientes la buscan por la calidad y lo bonito de sus tejidos y es que ella le pone mucho amor a sus artesanías porque le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que puede pasar mucho tiempo en su casa aprovechando su estadía para realizar las labores hogareñas. Son 6 años los que lleva en este negocio y anhela tener un puesto estable donde pueda vender sus tejidos, ya que actualmente sólo distribuye a tiendas artesanales. Ella considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es realizar los acabados de las prendas, puesto que necesitan mucha precisión, ella es consiente que el camino a su desarrollo personal no es fácil y está dispuesta a afrontar cualquier dificultad que se le presente. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a ahorrar, un poco todos los días para lograrlo, es una socia muy alegre en su banco comunal y es muy querida por la demás socias. Con los tres mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana, de mejor calidad, para darles a sus artesanías un mejor acabado.
texts.en:
Agueda is a 30 year old single mother. She lives in her relatives’ house. They give her lots of support. She wants to get ahead in life, and she knows that to do so she has to work a lot. She works arduously every day making her weavings. Her customers look for the quality and beauty in her weavings. She puts a lot of love into her handicrafts because she likes the work so much. She is able to spend a lot of time at home, taking advantage of that time to do housework. She has been in this business for six years. She longs to have her own stable place where she can sell her weavings. She currently only distributes them to handicrafts stores. She considers the most difficult part of her work to be making the finishings for the garments. You need to be very precise. She is aware that the road to her personal development is not easy. She is prepared to confront any difficulty along the way. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She knows that she needs to make payments on time, and she is ready to save a little every day to do so. She is a happy member of her community bank, and she is loved by the other members. She will use the 3,500 PEN she will buy more wool of better quality to be able to give her handicrafts a better finish.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde muy joven ha luchado por forjarse una buena vida, y hoy a sus 53 años todavía lo sigue haciendo, vive en su propia casa y lo que más quiere es tener una vejez tranquila. Tiene una pequeña carretilla en la que vende anticuchos (brochetas), la ubicación que ha elegido está cerca al centro comercial que es muy concurrida por las personas. Antonia atiende a sus clientes con mucha paciencia y cariño, ya que lo que más le gusta es ver a la gente degustando sus deliciosos anticuchos. Son ya 10 años los que lleva en este negocio y se siente muy feliz realizándolo, aunque sufre mucho en los meses fríos del año, porque tiene que permanecer hasta cerca de las 4 de la mañana en la calle para vender sus anticuchos, por eso anhela tener un restaurante de comida rápida donde pueda vender con más comodidad y así mejorar sus ingresos. Este es el primer préstamo de Antonia con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y desea hacerlo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa, siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en sus reuniones. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en comprar ingredientes para preparar más anticuchos y generarse mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Antonia is a very hard-working woman. Ever since she was young she has strived to make a better life for herself, and she continues to do so at 53 years old. She lives in her own home and, more than anything, she hopes to have a worry-free retirement.
She sells anticuchos (kebabs) from a cart that she stations close to a busy shopping centre. Antonia most enjoys seeing people try her delicious anticuchos, so she serves her customers with great patience and care.
She has been happily running this business for 10 years, despite suffering in the colder months when she has to stay out in the street selling her anticuchos until almost 4 in the morning. This is why she dreams of opening a more convenient fast food restaurant that would increase her earnings.
This is Antonia’s first loan with MFP; she knows she has to make all her repayments on time and aims to do so. She is a very active member of her communal bank, always keeping up-to-date on the agreements reached in their meetings. She will use the requested 1000 PEN to purchase ingredients to make more anticuchos and to generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make anticuchos

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz es una mujer soltera que siempre ha luchado por salir adelante, a sus 25 años siente que tiene las fuerzas necesarias para trabajar muy duro, vive en L. casa D. sus padres y anheL. mejorar su calidad D. vida. Tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado Santa Bárbara (mercado importante D. L. ciudad D. Juliaca), donD. venD. mercería (especias) a todas las personas que concurren a realizar sus compras diarias, elL. es muy alegre y siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa, los cuales compran los condimentos que venD. con mucha tranquilidad, ya que saben que Beatriz es una vendedora D. confianza. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas D. venta, ya que eso hace más amenas las largas jornadas D. trabajo y lo que le disgusta es tener que trabajar desD. tempranas horas D. L. mañana, aun así está dispuesta a sacrificarse, con tal D. mejorar su vida. Lleva 8 años en este negocio y anheL. tener un puesto más granD. donD. pueda venD. con mayor comodidad sus condimentos y otros productos adicionales. Este es el quinto préstamo D. Beatriz con MFP y quiere pagarlo puntualmente, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias D. su banco comunal, donD. participa activamente. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más mercería para implementar mejor su puesto D. venta.
texts.en:
Beatriz is single and has always had to work hard, but she is 25 and has lots of energy. She lives at home with her parents and wants to improve her living conditions. She has a small stall in the Santa Bárbara market (an important market in the town of Juliaca) where she sells spices. She is very cheerful and always greets her customers with a smile. Customers trust her and the condiments she sells.

What she likes most about her work is chatting with other stall-holders, which makes the long working day more bearable. She doesn't like having to start work so early, but she is willing to make the sacrifice in order to improve her living standards. She has had her business for 8 years and would like to have a bigger stall, where she would be able to sell her condiments more comfortably as well as selling other products.

This is Beatriz's fifth loan from MFP and she plans to pay punctually since she does not want to cause problems for her partners in the community bank, in which she is an active member. She will use the $675 to buy more merchandise to improve the range on her stall.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: María Teresa R. tiene la edad de 37 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de María es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que sus inicios comienzan por su familia ya que todos le  brindaban el apoyaban para que  siguiera con este negocio, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ropa niños, adultos y cosméticos, pero debido a ciertos tropiezos como lo era el viajar todos los días para realizar la visita en la casa de cada uno de sus clientes además tenia que recoger el dinero mensual, por lo que decide establecer una pulpería en su vivienda y así poder atender a sus hijos y evitar viajar todos los días. Es así que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa para damas, calzado, bolsos y además invertir en golosinas, refrescos naturales y pan. El sueño de María es crecer con su negocio para que sus hijos tengan un medio de supervivencia para el día de mañana.
texts.en:
María Teresa R. is 37 years old, and married. She has two children that are studying. Maria runs a general store, which she's done for the past 6 years thanks to the support of her family. Previously she sold children's clothing, adult clothing, and cosmetics, but due to certain circumstances, such as having to travel everyday to visit each of her clients at their respective houses and collect her money every month, she decided to establish a general store in her home so she could work and take care of her children without having to travel. And so, Maria is requesting a loan to purchase ladies clothing, shoes, bags, snacks, and bread. Maria's dream is to grow her business so that her children can succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina de 34 años, trabaja muy duro para darle lo mejor a su hijo Jorge de 5 años, vive en una casa alquilada y lo que más quiere es mejorar sus vidas y sabe que trabajado duro lo logrará.	Edad, estado civil, miembros de su familia. Se dedica a la venta de ropa en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (Lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), su puesto es muy concurrido, ya que ella siempre trata a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y respeto. Tiene 2 años realizando esta actividad y espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en uno de los principales puestos de la explanada. Catalina disfruta mucho de conversar con sus clientes e informarles sobre las características de sus prendas, de esta manera toma confianza con sus clientes y puede realizar una buena venta. Lo que considera más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto sin poder salir a la calle, ya que tiene que estar siempre alerta a cualquier imprevisto. Catalina quiere mejorar su vida y sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para lograrlo. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados planea comprar más ropa y así implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Catalina is 34 years old and works very hard to give the best to her 5-year-old son Jorge. She lives in a rented home and, more than anything, she wants to improve their lives. She knows that she will succeed by working hard.
She sells clothing in the Explanda Laguna Temporal (where the markets are held in Juliaca). Her stall is very popular since she always treats her customers with kindness and respect. She has run this business for 2 years and hopes that it will grow into one of the esplanade’s top stalls.
Catalina very much enjoys talking with her customers and telling them about her clothing; this way she earns their trust and she can make a good sale. The most difficult part is staying at her stall all day and not being able to go out in the street, since she always has to stay alert. Catalina wants to improve her life and knows she must work hard for it.
This is her second loan with MFP; she knows she has to make her repayments on time and is prepared to do so. She is a very happy and responsible member of her communal bank. She plans to buy more clothing with the requested 1000 PEN and thus better supply her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda tiene 35 años, es una mujer muy alegre, vive en una casa alquilada y tiene mucho ánimo para trabajar duro y salir adelante. Desde muy niña aprendió a ganar dinero ella sola, ya que su familia no tenía los ingresos necesarios para velar por su salud y alimentación. Actualmente, después de muchos sacrificios, ha podido progresar, tiene una pequeña bodega, la cual es muy concurrida y poco a poco va creciendo. Lo que más le gusta a Hilda de su trabajo es que tiene la libertad de elegir qué horas trabaja y qué horas se dedica a sus labores personales. Lleva 13 años en esta actividad y se siente muy feliz realizándola, para el futuro espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes, ya que sabe que de ellos depende el éxito de  su negocio. Este es el quinto préstamo de Hilda con MFP y tiene muchas ganas de pagarlo a tiempo, aunque para eso tenga que juntar poco a poco sus ganancias del día. En su banco comunal es muy responsable y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan sus compañeras. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados implementará mejor su tienda para brindarles una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Hilda, 35, is a very happy woman. She lives in a rented house, and she has the spirit to work hard and get ahead. Because her family did not have the necessary income to take care of her health and nutrition, she learned as a young girl to earn money by herself. Currently, after many sacrifices, she has been able to progress. She has a small convenience store, which is very popular. Little by little it is growing. What Hilda likes most about her work is that she has the freedom to choose what hours she will work and what hours she will do her personal chores. She has had the business for thirteen years, and she is very happy with the work she does. She would like to have a larger store where she could better tend to her customers because she knows that the success of her business depends on them. This is Hilda’s fifth loan with MFP. She has every desire to pay it on time, even though to do so she may have to collect her daily earnings little by little. She is always very responsible in her community bank, and she is always up to date with the agreements her colleagues have made. With the 3,000 PEN she is asking for, she will improve her store in order to offer her customers a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 32 años, es una mujer muy alegre y responsable, vive sola en una casa alquilada y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Cada día, muy temprano se dirige al mercado Santa Maria (mercado exclusivamente de frutas en la ciudad de Juliaca), pasa todo el día bajo el sol en espera de que sus clientes le compren las deliciosas frutas que vende, ella es muy alegre por lo cual su carretilla es muy concurrida, llegada las 6 de la tarde enrumba a su hogar para prepararse para la venta del día siguiente. Lleva 8 años realizando este negocio, lo que más le gusta es que puede conversar con sus clientes y hacer más amena la venta, por otro lado, considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto sin poder moverse, aun así sabe que todos sus esfuerzos los realiza con el único fin de mejorar su vida y tener una vejez tranquila. Para un futuro cercano desea tener una tienda donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad sus productos y atender mejor a sus clientes. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Juana con MFP y está dispuesta a separar una parte de sus ganancias diarias para pagar el crédito sin problemas, en su banco comunal es muy querida, ya que le da alegría a las demás socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más fruta para implementar mejor su puesto de venta, en espera de que esto le genere más clientes.
texts.en:
Juana, 32, is a very happy and responsible woman. She lives alone in a rented house. What she wants most of all is a better quality of life. Every day, very early in the morning, she heads towards the Santa Maria market (a market in the city of Juliaca that sells fruits exclusively) She spends the whole day under the sun, waiting for her customers to buy the delicious fruit she sells. Because she is very happy, her little cart is very popular. At six in the evening, she heads home to prepare for the next day’s sales. She has been in this business for eight years. What she likes the most is talking with her customers; that make selling more pleasant. On the other hand, the most difficult thing is having to stay at her stand all day without moving. Yet, she knows that all of her efforts are to improve her life and have a peaceful old age. In the near future she would like to have a store where she could more comfortably sell her products and tend to her customers. This is Juana’s fourth loan with MFP. She is prepared to put aside part of her daily earnings to repay the loan without problems. With the 1,000 PEN, she will buy more fruit to improve her stand in the hope of getting more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa Emilia B. Hernández tiene la edad de 45 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio con esfuerzo propio anteriormente vendía cosméticos, era uno de los trabajos que mas le gusto ya que lograba conversar con sus clientes y conocía las necesidades de cada uno de ellos, pero por su salud no pudo continuar con este negocio ya que tenia la enfermedad de la artritis en sus piernas y esto le impedía recorrer las calles a ofrecer sus productos por lo que decide establecer su pulpería en su vivienda y manteniendo ese entusiasmo para sus clientes. Es así que decide realizar este financiamiento con el fin de invertir en su negocio para capital de trabajo para granos básicos, golosinas y gaseosas. El deseo de Rosa es que su negocio aumente para beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia B. Hernández is 45 years old and married with 2 children. She runs a general store, which she has done for the past 7 years. Previously Rosa sold cosmetics, which she greatly enjoyed as she was able to talk with her customers and understand their needs. However, due to her health, Rosa could not continue, as arthritis in her legs prohibited her from traveling around to offer her products. So she decided to open up a general store in her home while maintaining the same enthusiasm for her clients. Rosa is requesting a loan to invest in her business and purchase basic grains, sweets, and soda. Rosa's desire is to grow her business and benefit her family.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vicenta Del Socorro

texts.es: Vicenta del Socorro E. tiene la edad de 60 años. Es una mujer casada. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Vicenta dio inicio a este oficio por su esposo ya que no quería que trabajara fuera de la casa y también seria otro medio de ingreso para su familia, Vicenta es una mujer muy trabajadora además disfruta de conversar con sus vecinos por lo que ella ha travesado por muchas dificultades. Es por este motivo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan y productos congelados. El mayor sueño de Vicenta es ampliar su negocio y con los mismos ingresos generados por la pulpería establecer otro negocio.
texts.en:
Vicenta del Socorro E. is 60 years old and married. For the past 5 years, she has run a general store. She began the store with the support of her husband, as she didn't want to work outside her home, but wanted to provide another income source for her family. Vicenta is a hard worker, and likes to talk with her neighbors, as she has overcome many difficulties in her life. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to provide her with working capital to buy basic grains, sweets, natural drinks, bread, and refrigerated products. Vicenta biggest dream is to increase her business, and use the income it generates to open another business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El joven Roberto M. es estudiante está por terminar su carrera profesional en leyes pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar la universidad. Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y así terminar su profesión. 
Roberto M. trabaja en como paramédico en la cruz roja de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, este es el ingreso que obtiene para pagar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Young Roberto M. is completing his law degree, but doesn't have the necessary funds to pay university. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to complete his profession. Roberto M. as a paramedic for the Red Cross of Nuevo Laredo city, which provides the income he uses to pay for his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay his university tuition

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es: La señora María de la Luz vive con su esposo y un hijo; Su esposo es pensionado y ella trabaja en una empresa en el área del comedor, pero obtiene otro ingreso ya que tiene un negocio propio de abarrotes llamado “Abarrotes Gaby “ establecido desde hace 2 años, negocio que atiende su esposo y se turnan para cuando ella regresa del trabajo, son personas muy trabajadoras y el motivo de la solicitud de este crédito es para invertir en la compra de mas mercancía y así su negocio crezca mas.
texts.en:
María de la Luz lives with her husband and a son. Her husband has a pension. She works in the dining room of a business. But, she gets another income from “Abarrotes Gaby”, which is the grocery business they have had for two years. Her husband works in the business until she returns from work. Then she takes her turn. They are very hard working people. The loan is to buy more merchandise, which will increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Carlos Román

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Román vive con su esposa en esta ciudad, son padres de 2 pequeñitos 
Y tienen su propio negocio de nombre "Abarrotes Roman " establecido desde hace 3 años, a pesar de la economía en estos momentos el negocio se ha mantenido estable y más aun sigue creciendo. 
El por el motivo que esta solicitando este crédito es para surtir mucha mas mercancía y así crezcan sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Señor Carlos Román lives with his wife in this city. They are the parents of two small children. They have their own business, Abarrotes Román (Román's Groceries) which has been in business for three years. In spite of the current economy, his business has been stable and furthermore is continuing to grow. The reason he is seeking this loan is to stock up with a lot more merchandise and build up his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the business.

loans.name: Otoniel

texts.es:
El señor Otoniel vive con su esposa la señora Nancy y son padres de 3 hijos, uno de ellos con una discapacidad diferente, motivo que les da por luchar mas cada día para salir adelante.
El señor Otoniel es empleado en el área de maquinaria pesada en una empresa muy importante del país. 
El al igual que su esposa están tramitando este crédito para reinstalar el cableado eléctrico de la vivienda, que anteriormente la estaban rentando pero la dejaron en muy malas condiciones y ellos desean acondicionarla la casa para poder mudarse a ella.
texts.en:
Señor Otoniel lives with his wife, Señora Nancy, and they have three children. One of the children has a disability, and this motivates them to work harder every day to get ahead. Señor Otoniel is employed in the area of heavy equipment for one of his country's very important businesses. Both he and his wife are arranging this loan in order to replace the electrical wiring in their house. Previously they were renting it out but the tenants left it in bad condition and they would like to fix up the house so they can move into it.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install electrical wiring in his house.

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora María de Jesús vive con sus 2 hijos, ella es divorciada, y por sus hijos recibe una muy gratificante pensión alimenticia, motivo por el ella no trabaja ya que solo se dedica al hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos. 
Tiene el proyecto de realizarle unas mejoras en el techo de la casa que le heredo su abuelito, y esto es para lo que la señora esta tramitando el rédito.
texts.en:
Señora María de Jesús lives with her two children. She is divorced and she receives very generous family support income for the children. That's why she doesn't work now that she is single and devotes herself to her home and caring for her children. She has a plan for making some improvements to the roof of her house which she inherited from her grandfather, which is why she is arranging for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the roof of her residence.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe L. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 49 years old. Fe is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Fe runs a food stall where she sells a variety of food products in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,750 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital. Fe is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital. This loan will be Fe's sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima B. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 59 years old. Zosima is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Zosima makes and sells specialty food products in her local community. Zosima has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2002, Zosima joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zosima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase the ingredients needed to make products to sell. Zosima is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which she will be use to purchase ingredients. This will be Zosima's third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma B. is from the village of Casul in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 41 years old. Alma is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a fishing business in which she harvests and sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. Alma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Alma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500.00 PHP from PMPC. Alma is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP that she will use to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. This will be Alma's second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets

loans.name: Nur Hasanah

texts.en:
Nur Hasanah (DNR.M-0684) is a 40-year-old woman who lives in the town of Ds. Sumberkima, in Buleleng, Bali, Indonesia. She is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, Nur Hasanah owns and operates a handicraft business where she sells traditional handicrafts to tourists and the local community. Nur Hasanah has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2009, Nur Hasanah joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nur Hasanah is now requesting a new loan of 3,400,000 IDR which will be used to purchase additional inventory. This will be Nur Hasanah's first loan from DINARI. Nur Hasanah plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Nur Hasanah - (DNR.M-0684) merupakan 40 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Ds. Sumberkima - Buleleng. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Nur Hasanah memiliki and menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor seni. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah mengoperasikan usaha kerajinan. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual kerajinan tradisional kepada wisatawan dan anggota masyarakat setempat. Nur Hasanah sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Nur Hasanah menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2009, Nur Hasanah bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Nur Hasanah telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,400,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli inventaris and modal kerja tambahan. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Nur Hasanah berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi and menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita G. is from the village of Guinabot in Sapang Dalaga. She is 50 years old. Esterlita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Esterlita makes and sells food. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Esterlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP to pay off her motorcycle. She uses the motorcycle to transport food products to her customers, especially those who live far from her shop. This will be Esterlita's fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to support her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan H. is 36-year-old. She is a family leader who has established a small family in the Province of Battambang, where they have lived for many years. She and her husband are rice farmers in the village. Yan H. has five school-aged children.

Yan H. orders fish in bulk on credit from her wholesale supplier and then sells the fish retail in the local market for a profit. She typically generates a profit of $5 each day, which she uses to meet her family's daily requirements.

Yan H. hopes to earn extra money by using the loan to purchase piglets to raise and to accumulate a large quantity of fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and fish

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa T. is from the town of Aloran in Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 38 years old. Analisa is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Analisa owns and operates a business installing glass for local community members. Analisa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Analisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analisa has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Analisa is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP that she will use to purchase materials that she needs for her business. This will be Analisa's sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her business

loans.name: Sani'ah

texts.en:
Sani'ah is 28 and lives in the town of Ds. Sumberkima - Buleleng. She is married and has one school-aged child. Sani'ah operates a handicraft business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling wood handicrafts to tourists and local community members. Sani'ah has been engaged in this business for more than six years and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2009, Sani'ah joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sani'ah is requesting a loan from DINARI for the first time.  Sani'ah seeks a loan of 3,400,000 IDR to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. Sani'ah plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to pay her child's tuition fees.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Sani'ah - (DNR.M-0685) merupakan 28 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Ds. Sumberkima - Buleleng.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Sani'ah memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor seni.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah mengoperasikan usaha kerajinan.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual kerajinan kayu kepada wisatawan dan anggota masyarakat setempat.  Sani'ah sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 6 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Sani'ah menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2009, Sani'ah bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Sani'ah telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,400,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bahan baku untuk membuat barang kerajinan tambahan.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Sani'ah berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk membayar biaya sekolah anak-anak peminjam.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Jamila Riaz Hussain Group

texts.en:
"My name is Jamila and I operate an embroidery business in my native city of Borewala, Pakistan. I own a two-room brick house and have been living in it with my family for the past 10 years. I prepare embroidered dresses to save money for rainy days. My husband's name is R. H. and he deals with vegetables. He buys vegetables from the wholesale market and sells to the vegetable shops. He has been doing this work for the past five years. I am applying for a loan to buy vegetables to expand my husband’s vegetable-selling business."

Shamim A. baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for her tailoring center. Rani baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local, three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sardaran Muhammad Iqbal Group

texts.en:
"My name is Sardaran. I have been living in a city of shrines named Borewala, Pakistan, for the past 10 years. My husband's name is M. I.. He runs a scrap business. I am a very sensitive and hardworking lady. I operate my own business embroidering clothes to lead an independent life and to pay off the utilities. I am applying for  a loan to buy scrap for my husband’s scrap business."

Salma parveen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local, three-wheeled motor vehicle). Mansha baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business. A. rakhi baji wants a loan to buy another motorbike for her bike-rental business. Zahida parveen baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy scrap for the scrap business

loans.name: Jocylyn

texts.en:
Jocylyn M., 43, is from the village of Misom in Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Jocylyn is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, She raises pigs for sale. Jocylyn has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns ~12,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Jocylyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to finance her rice production project, which will help her meet her family's daily food needs. This will be Jocylyn's seventh loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family.

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru: Абдурасул парен , который занимается продажей фруктов на рынке Паншанбе города Худжанда.Он недавно получил кредит , но с сезонностью он хочет досрочно погасить оставшееся погашение и получить повторно чуть побольше.На повторный кредит он хочет оптом привозить малину и раздавать по точкам покупателям , торговцам рынка.
texts.en:
Abdurasul is a young guy who sells fruit at Hojand's Panshanbe market. Recently he has received a loan but he would like to pay it off earlier so that he can receive a bigger loan. He would like to use the second loan for the wholesale purchase of raspberries and selling them retail to different vendors and customers.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fruit sales

loans.name: Yasmeen Muhammad Younas Group

texts.en:
My name is Yasmeen and I live in a city of shrines named Borewala, Pakistan. I own a two room brick house and have been living in it with my family for the past 14 years. My husband, M. Y., has a timber-selling business and has been in the profession for the past 5 years. I handle my embroidered clothes business. I do this work to pay off the utilities and to ease the financial burden on my husband. I am applying for a loan to buy timber to grow my husband’s timber-selling business. 

I’m the group leader of four other women from my locality. Maqboolan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Safia baji wants a loan to buy a donkey for loading. Zarina baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Yasmeen baji wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan and, the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell

loans.name: Sakina Ahmad Din Group

texts.en:
My name is Sakina and I have been living in a city of shrines named Borewala, Pakistan, for the past 10 years. I'm a very sensitive lady and I care a lot for my family. I want to free my family members of all tensions so that we can lead a happy life. I operate an embroidered clothes business to share the financial burden of my husband. I am applying for a loan to buy electric supplies (switches, switch boards and tube lights) for my husband’s electric shop so that he can complete his customers' orders and earn good income.

I’m the group leader of three other women from my locality. Shaheen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Mahwish baji wants a loan to buy newspapers to sell. Sobia liaqat baji wants a loan to buy items (scissors, chairs and creams) for her barber shop.

This is a group loan and, the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy electrical supplies to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
A jeepney barker’s wife is our featured story. A resident of Calabayan, Ozamiz City, she is Mrs. Regina C. L., a 46-year- old married mother of six children who are mostly minors and still dependent on their parents for their needs. As a thoughtful and loving mother, Regina has helped her husband in supporting their children. Presently, she is engaged in snack, rice and vegetables vending, having started this business with an initial capital only of Php 2,500.00. Her business is progressing, patronized mainly by neighbors, students and friends in the village.

Regina is now requesting a loan of Php 5,000.00 under the Medal Pangnegosyo 2 program of PMPC to increase her capital for her business and to purchase school supplies needed for her children. She is very thankful for the support of her husband and the trust of PAGLAUM MPC and KIVA in micro-entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Addtional capital for snack, rice, feeds and vegetable vending

location.town: Calabayan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindan

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира женщина которая торгует на рынке города Худжанда фруктами и малиной.Она имеет двоих детей, муж на заработках в России.Сама Мунира живёт в Олча-Калъача, поэтому привозит малину оптом и раздаёт по торговым точкам.Вечером при закрытии торговли она собирает деньги с продавшей малины с торговцев.Для увеличения завоза малины её понадобились деньги, поэтому она решила получить кредит в "Арванд".
texts.en:
Munira sells fruit and raspberry at Hojand's market. She has two children. Her husband works in Russia. Munira lives in Olcha-Kalacha. She buys raspberries wholesale and distributes it to vendors. In the evenings, after sales are over, she collects money from the vendors. In order to increase raspberry supply, she is applying for an Arvand loan.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fruit sales

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en: Anastacia C. is from the village of Salvador, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, married, and has five adult children. Anastacia owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling groceries and food items in the local community. She has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. On June 29, 2006, Anastacia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Anastacia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. Rubina baji and Gulshan baji each want a loan to buy clothes to sell.

Rubi baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

  Шухрат 1969 года рождения, женат  имеет 4 сыновей. Он работает в адвокатом в Кайраккумском суде. До этого он с матерью жили в городе и когда ей предложили работу в кишлаке они согласились.  Имея большой дом и двор они  пользуясь моментом  сразу приобрели пару овец.  Шухрат посоветовавшись с матерью приобрели также несколько коров.  Сейчас он более 3 лет кредитуется и доволен условиями кредита.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. Shuhrat is thirty years old and is married with four children. He is a lawyer at Kayrakkum Court. Previously he and his mother lived in town but she was offered a job in a village and accepted it. With a large house and yard, they purchased a couple of sheep and cows. Shuhrat has been our client for three years and he is content with the loan conditions.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of  3 cows
