She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Jero Ketut Taman - (DNR.M-0687) merupakan 35 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Jero Ketut Taman memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Jero Ketut Taman sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 8 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Jero Ketut Taman menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2007, Jero Ketut Taman bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Jero Ketut Taman meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membangun tempat berteduh/kandang bagi ternak peminjam. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Jero Ketut Taman berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Mrs. Carmelita T. has been a Paglaum member under the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) program since July 18, 2006. Residing at West Poblacion, Rizal, Zamboanga Del Norte, she is married to Arcolito P. T. and has three children who are all professionals now.

Carmelita is obtaining her loan of Php 10,500 to buy ingredients for her bread-making business. Her plans for her business are to build her own bakeshop someday and for her family to be able to build their new house.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her bread-making business

location.town: West Poblacion, Rizal, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Bushra Naz Sajjad Hussain Group

texts.en:
Bushra naz baji is married to S. H. and they have lived in the city of Lahore, Pakistan, for the past nine years. Bushra baji is a very hardworking lady and the leader of this group. She operates a business sewing clothes to contribute towards her family's financial expenses. She is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine to sew more clothes and to earn more income.

Afroz jahan baji and Maqboolan baji each want a loan to buy clothes for their clothes-selling business.

Razia bano baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Nosheen baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food-selling business.

Shamim A. baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell.

About group loans
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Jorgie

texts.en:
Jorgie S. is making a living from raising pigs to sell. She is 28 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Calaran, Calamba Misamis Occidental. Jorgie has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Jorgie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Jorgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. Jorgie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Mrs. Anecita Q. is 57 years old, married, and blessed with six children. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since May 18, 2007 under the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) program. She is a bona fide resident of Barangay D'ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental.

Anecita has operated a sari-sari (variety) store for more than two years, selling a variety of food products in the local community. Currently, she's requesting her 3rd loan in the amount of Php 20,000 to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Soeun V. was born in 1965 and blessed with nine children. She was married, but divorced her husband when her children were still young. She currently makes a daily income by cultivating rice, while one of her sons works in construction. Soeun V. is a fantastic manager who has provided everything for her children's needs. She will use this loan to buy a variety of fruits to sell for additional profit, and to purchase an old motor for her family's travel needs.

loans.use: To buy fruits to sell for additional profit

loans.name: Rakhim

texts.ru:
Рахим Ахмедов - мужчина средних лет (50 лет). Женат и имеет 4-х детей. Занимается продажей фруктов и овощей на рынке "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда. Он сидит внутри рынка, и соответственно его арендная плата дороже чем у тех, кто сидит снаружи рынка. Но у Рахима очень качественный и свежий товар, и поэтому Рахим продает немного дороже, чем снаружи. Рахим закупает овощи и фрукты у дехканин. Каждое день ранним утром, примерно в 5 часов утра, Рахим ждет своих постоянных поставщиков, закупает овощи и фрукты и начинает свой рабочий день. Таким образом он зарабатывает на жизнь и кормит свою семью. Рахим наш давний клиент, который кредитуется у нас с 2002 года. За этот период кредитования Рахим расширил свой бизнес. В этот раз Рахим просит кредит для закупки новых фруктов и овощей в этом сезоне, тем самым он расширяет свой ассортимент. 
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.
texts.en:
Rakhim A. is middle-aged man (50 years old). He is married and has four children. He sells fruits and vegetables at the "Panchshanbe" market in Khujand City. He is set up inside the market and, accordingly, the rental of space inside the market is more expensive than outside the market. Rakhim has very high quality and fresh products, and therefore he sells slightly more expensive products than those sold outside. Rakhim buys his fruits and vegetables from the farmers. Every day, early in the morning, at about 5 am, he waits for his regular suppliers, buying fruits and vegetables and then starting his working day. This is how he earns a living and feeds his family. Rakhim, our longtime client, has been a borrower with us since 2002. During this period, Rakhim took out loans to expand his business. At this time, Rakhim requests a loan to purchase fruits and vegetables in season and to expand his variety. MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, providing credit services to the population of Tajikistan. MLF “MicroInvest” seeks to transform itself into a micro-loan deposit-receiving organization. In October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded LLC Microloan deposit-receiving organization “Arvand.” “Arvand” at the behest of “MicroInvest", continues to carry out its mission to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Fruits and Vegetables

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosemarie E. has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since March 23, 2004. She is 38 years of age, married, and blessed with three children who are now adults.

Rosemarie has been engaged in nipa-thatching and selling since she got married, earning Php 7,000 per month from her business (the nipa is a palm tree, the leaves of which are used for thatching roofs).

She has good standing in terms of payments on her previous loans. Now, she's obtaining her 8th loan in the amount of Php 8,000 for the purpose of additional capital including buying other materials needed for her business. Her plan for her business is that it will grow and continue to support her family in the future. And for her family, that her children will finish studying until college and are able to find a decent and stable job someday.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her nipa business

loans.name: Jacquelyn

texts.en:
Jacquelyn B. is from the town of Sapang Dalaga. She is 27 years old, and is married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Jacquelyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Jacquelyn earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

Jacquelyn joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacquelyn is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the first she has taken from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock

loans.name: Naseem Tariq Mahmood Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is married to T. M. and they have lived in the city of Lahore, Pakistan, for the past ten years. Lahore is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi food. Naseem baji is a very hardworking lady. She operates a business sewing clothes in order to share the financial burden with her husband. He works in a factory on a monthly wage and his income is not sufficient to meet their expenses. Naseem baji is applying for a loan to buy cosmetics because she wants to start a cosmetics-selling business as sewing clothes is a very time-intensive trade.

Asmat baji and Bilquis baji each want a loan to buy beams for their shuttering business.

About group loans
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to start a cosmetic-selling business

loans.name: Maksud

texts.en: Maksud is a hard-working entrepreneur from Shahrituz, Tajikistan. He has operated his own business of producing wooden doors and window frames for the past nine years. He has extensive experience in this field and his skills are very much in demand. He works hard to earn a good income to support his family. He and his wife have four children. Maksud has requested a loan of 6,500 Somoni to buy some tools and wood that he needs for his business. Maksud appeals to your generosity so that he can improve his family’s living conditions. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy tools and wood for manufacturing doors and window frames

loans.name: Sugran Muhammad Ashraf Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Maqsooda baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics and a dryer for her beauty salon.

Fozia baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Bushra baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

Sugran baji, wife of M. A., has lived in a city named Lahore, Pakistan, for the last fifteen years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Her husband has a tailoring center in the community and sews clothes and earns income. Sugran baji also helps him by sewing clothes. She is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine so that he is able to sew more clothes and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Shahnaz Kosar Abdul Sattar Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz kosar baji has been a citizen of Yadgar in the city of Lahore, Pakistan, for the past seven years. Her husband runs a business selling construction supplies to building contractors. Shahnaz baji sews clothes for people and charges them $2 an item. She saves her money in a committee for rainy days. Shahnaz baji is applying for a loan to buy construction supplies to increase her husband's profit. 

Samina kosar baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

Farzana bano baji wants a loan to buy calling cards to sell. 

Salma begum baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. 

About group loans
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Dira Group

texts.en:
Brank M., age 37, is single with one child aged nine. She has a fruit and vegetable business which she started a year ago. She works daily from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. and is able to earn a monthly profit of around $106.

This will be Brank’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her stock and has repaid the loan successfully. She hopes for the second loan to again increase her stock.

Brank will share this loan with her loan group, Dira, which has eighteen members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Brank is first on the left in the front row.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Nia Njema Group

texts.en:
M. S. M., age 51, is married with two children aged 17 and 4. He has a kiosk business, which he started in 2000, selling all types of things like sugar, wheat flour, beer, soda, juice and water. He works daily from 6 a.m. until 9 p.m. and is able to earn a monthly profit of around $107.

This will be M.’s seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to improve and increase his kiosk business and has repaid the loans successfully. He hopes, with the seventh loan, to even sell sarongs, fabrics, shirts and trousers.

M. will share this loan with his loan group, Nia Njema, which totals eighteen members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, M. is in a blue shirt in the back row.

loans.use: To start selling clothes like sarong, fabrics, shirts and trousers.

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en:
K. Aggrey is a 48-year-old businessman. He deals in timber in a mass market area in the town and has been doing this business for ten years. He has four children of whom two are in university.

He is requesting the loan to bring more timber from the forest and from neighboring countries like the Congo. Since he has a residential house, he is targeting to construct other houses for rent on the same plot to generate more income.

loans.use: To bring more timber from the forest and from neighboring countries like the Congo

loans.name: Jumuyiya Kiluvya Group

texts.en:
Otilya M., age 60, is a divorcee with five children aged 47, 45, 38, 29 and 27. She has run a poultry business for four years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 6.30 p.m. daily and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $340.

This will be Otilya’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first loan to increase her poultry business and has paid the loan back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to increase her business by buying more chicks and chicken feed.

Otilya will share this loan with subgroup D of the Jumuyiya Kiluvya group. The subgroup has seven members who sell vegetables, bricks, wire mesh, or have grocery or other shops. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Otilya is first on the right.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru:
Нигина – 32 года. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Она занимается продажей детской одежды. Она торгует на рынке "Афгонбозор" в районе «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда. Нигина закупает товар в городе Бишкек Республики Кыргызстан. Она ездит за товаром 1 раз в месяц. Её муж мастер строительных работ. Нигина уже 1 год кредитуется у нас. Когда она начинала, у нее было маленькое количество товара. Но сейчас Нигина расширилась, и за свой последний кредит, она закупила партию детской обуви. Теперь у Нигины увеличился ассортимент товара. Нигина просит новый займ для закупки летней партии детской обуви.
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.
texts.en:
Nigina is 32 years old, married and has 3 children. She is involved in sales of children’s clothing at the Afgonbozor market in the Panchshanbe district of Khujand city. Nigina buys her merchandise in the city of Bishkek in the Kyrgyzstan Republic. She travels there once per month. Nigina’s husband is a master builder. Nigina has been a borrower with us for one year. When she first started her business, she had very limited inventory of goods. Nigina has since expanded her business and bought an inventory of children’s shoes, using her last loan. Now Nigina has a better assortment of goods. Nigina is requesting a new loan in order to purchase a stock of summer children’s shoes. MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's summer shoes

loans.name: Razia Kosar Muhammad Shafique Group

texts.en:
Farzana baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Nargis baji wants a loan to buy animal skins to sell.

Kubra baji wants a loan to buy paint boxes to sell.

Nabila shahzadi baji wants a loan to buy iron to sell.

Razia kosar baji, wife of M. S., lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. She has been a part of this city for the last eight years. Lahore is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods.

Razia baji’s husband is a blacksmith and he makes iron rods to sell to his customers. He has been in this profession for the last six years. Razia baji is a very caring lady; she performs her duties very efficiently. She is applying for a loan to buy iron for her husband so that he is able to make more iron rods to sell to his customers.

Note: The sewing machine belongs to Farzana baji.

loans.use: To buy iron for making iron rods to sell

loans.name: Prosy

texts.en:
M. Prosy is a 35-year-old businesswoman. She has a salon in front of her residence, which she started two years ago, but she needs much equipment to respond to her customers’ demands. So she is requesting the loan to purchase some of this equipment. Mostly, the ones required urgently for the salon are hair chemicals, hair treatments, hair gel, a hairdryer, etc.

M. Prosy is blessed with five children who are all going to school. Her future plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase some much-needed equipment for her salon

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 27-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their two children.

Hasan has owned a scrap metal business since 1998. He requested a loan of $800 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase more scrap metal and also some items for the new baby. This is his fourth loan and he has always repaid on time.

His previous loans helped Hasan to buy important missed things for his house. He is special in his work because he buys scrap metal and sells used iron. His clients are old customers. When he first started his business, he faced difficulties in getting along with new customers.

loans.use: To purchase more scrap metal and also some items for the new baby

loans.name: Ni Luh Sumberdani

texts.en: Ni Luh Sumberdani - (DNR.M-0688) is a 41-year-old female living in the town of Manistutu, Melaya. She is married and has two school-aged children. Ni Luh Sumberdani owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500,000 IDR a month. In 2009, Ni Luh Sumberdani joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to build shelter for her pigs. Ni Luh Sumberdani is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. The loan will be her first from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Luh Sumberdani berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Hajji Rashid

texts.en:
Hajji Rashid K. is a 40-year-old businessman. He deals in cosmetics and has been doing this business for seven years in a mass market area in Natete. He is requesting the loan to invest more in his business. That is, to purchase more cosmetics to expand his business.

He has a plot where he wishes to build rental houses. He also wishes to education his children.

loans.use: To invest in his business by purchasing more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Fazilat Muhammad Ashraf Group

texts.en:
Bushra baji wants a loan to buy marble to sell. Shamim akhtar baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. Amna baji wants a loan to buy iron to sell. Siddiqan baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (tube lights, switches and switchboards) to sell. 

Fazilat baji is married to M. A.. They both are citizens of Lahore, Pakistan, where they have lived for the past 17 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Her husband has a cycle-repairing business. He has been doing this work for the past three years. Fazilat baji makes decoration pieces and sells them at the market to earn income. She saves her income in a committee and uses it when needed. She is applying for a loan to buy tools for her husband’s cycle-repairing business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Siddiqan baji is holding in her hand one of Fazilat baji's decoration pieces.

loans.use: To buy tools for cycle repairing business

loans.name: Ni Putu Puri

texts.en:
Ni Putu Puri is 56 years old and lives in the town of Manistutu - Melaya. She is married and has three adult children.  To make a living, Ni Putu Puri raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Ni Putu Puri has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 400,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Putu Puri joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Putu Puri has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI, which she used to purchase breeding livestock. Ni Putu Puri is now requesting a new loan of 3,000,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Ni Putu Puri's third loan from DINARI. Ni Putu Puri plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Putu Puri - (DNR.M-0689) merupakan 56 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 3 anak usia dewasa.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Putu Puri memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Putu Puri sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Putu Puri menghasilkan sekitar 400,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, Ni Putu Puri bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Putu Puri meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli ternak indukan.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Putu Puri berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk tabungan sebagai cadangan bagi keadaan darurat di masa mendatang.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Shohsanam

texts.en:
Shohsanam is a single lady from Shahrituz, Tajikistan. She sells children’s clothing in the local market. She has been in this trade for 11 years. Shohsanam is very friendly with her customers. She tries to please different tastes and make her clothing affordable for everyone. Today she is requesting a loan of 1000 Somoni to increase the assortment of products she has available. Shohsanam is planning to use generated income to expand her business. We believe the current loan will have a positive impact on Shohsanam’s profitability, helping to further improve the economic and social situation of her family.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of clothing

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes K. N. is a businesswoman who works from her home. She rears chickens and keeps pigs and cattle. She also has a small retail shop in front of her house. This 45-year-old lady has two daughters.

Agnes is requesting the loan to purchase more chicks to rear in more shades to generate more income. She is a hardworking businesswoman who wishes to construct more houses to rent.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks to rear to generate more income

loans.name: Sherzot

texts.en: For the past ten years, M. Sherzot has put much effort into his agricultural activities. He learned this humble work from his father. His father taught him everything about farming so that, when he had his own family, he could support his wife as well as his children. Now, Sherzot is busy preparing his farm for their next planting. Sherzot, the father of two small children, says his wish is that he will again have an abundant harvest. He would like to ask for a loan of 1,000 Somoni that will be used for purchasing fertilizers, herbicides and ammonium sulfate. Sherzot is sure that the loan will help him improve his harvest and he thanks everyone who supports him with this loan. loans.name: Bobokul

texts.en:
N. Bobokul is 45 years of age and lives with his wife and 6 children. His wife helps him with household expenses now that she is a merchant with a stall in the oriental market in Shahrituz. Bobokul has worked in agriculture for 15 years. The biggest problem he has is a lack of funding. Bobokul cultivates the lands that he inherited from his father. His plans for the future are to succeed in establishing more farmland to be able to help his children build their homes. He requests this loan to invest in farm supplies.

loans.name: Oinisa

texts.en:
S. Oinisa is a 20-year-old who has been working the land for 3 years. Her husband has no fixed job, which means they have no other steady monthly income. They have a little son, their pride and joy, who is learning the best life lessons from his parents.

Their biggest source of income is the fruit of their labor; they grow potatoes and onions. Oinisa is proud of the quality of her crops and of her knowledge. While waiting for the best moment of production, she is requesting a loan in order to maintain her crops, holding off on the harvest until the market indicates that it is the best time to yield the biggest profits. Her dream is to acquire more land and produce more crops in the future because the land that she loves and has been a part of her life has allowed her to move her family forward.

loans.name: Sagheer Choudhary Iqbal Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Huzaira Bano baji wants a loan to buy juicer machine for her drinks corner.

Samra baji wants a loan to buy cloth for her cloth-selling business.

Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy costume jewelry to sell.

My name is Sagheer and I have been living in a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. My husband's name is C. I. and he runs a scrap business in the community. I operate my clothes-sewing business to share the financial burden with my husband. I am applying for a loan to buy scrap to grow my husband’s scrap business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Ni Luh Sumiarni

texts.en:
Ni Luh Sumiarni - (DNR.M-0690) is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Manistutu - Melaya. She is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Ni Luh Sumiarni owns and operates a business venture raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Ni Luh Sumiarni has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 500,000 - 600,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Luh Sumiarni joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Luh Sumiarni has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Ni Luh Sumiarni is now requesting a new loan of 3,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. Ni Luh Sumiarni plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

loans.name: Saiyohat

texts.en:
M. Saiyohat is 44 years old. She is married with three children. Saiyohat is a market vendor. She sells fodder for animals. The generated income is mainly used for purchasing young bulls to raise and sell. Now Saiyohat applies for a loan in the amount of 3,000 Somoni. She is planning to increase the working capital so as to expand the business and to use the generated income for setting up a private farm for breeding cattle. Saiyohat thanks all supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.name: Saiyora

texts.en:
I. Saiyora is 35 years old and lives with her 3 children and her husband. She has a few plots of land which she inherited from her father. For 3 years, together with her husband, she has grown potatoes, onions and tomatoes, which grow well in the local conditions of this zone.

Saiyora leaves very early in the morning to work on the crops and sometimes gets help from her 3 children, too, after they attend school. Now she needs your support and has applied to IMON International for a loan of 1500 Somoni that she will spend for purchasing necessary supplies for her crops.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en: N. Rukia is a nurse by profession; she has a clinic with a pharmacy. She is 34 years old with two young kids. She is requesting a loan to put more medicine and health equipment in the pharmacy as well in her clinic in order to meet her patients’ needs. She is a hard-working lady whose future plan is to build a residential house on her plot of land.

loans.use: To put more medicine and health equipment in her pharmacy

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar Muhammad Khalid Group

texts.en:
Zarina baji wants a loan to buy ready-made garments to sell.

Shamim Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy costume jewelry to sell.

Rubina baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart to transport loads.

Shahida baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

My name is Naseem Akhtar and I have been living in a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 8 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. My husband's name is M. K. and he deals with the garment-selling business. I also embroider clothes as a business. I prepare embroidered clothes and sell them in the cloth shops and earn an income. I save part of my income for a rainy day and use part of it for daily needs. I am applying for a loan to buy garments for my husband’s garment business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy garments to sell

loans.name: Misbah Tahir Naveed Group

texts.en:
Shahida baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Zakia baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw.

Zakia Parveen baji wants a loan to buy leather and nails for her shoe-making business.

Maryam Bushra baji wants a loan to buy garments to sell.

Misbah baji is the wife of T. N.; they have lived in a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 14 years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband deals in seasonal vegetables. He buys vegetables wholesale and sells to the vegetable shops and earns income. Misbah baji also operates an embroidered clothes business which she does to pay the utilities. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to grow her husband’s vegetable selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to sell to retailers

loans.name: Saidniso

texts.ru:
Саиднисо – 39 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Она занимается продажей хозтоваров и электроприборов. Она торгует на рынке "Афганбазар" находящийся в районе «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда. Саиднисо закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Она ездит за товаром 3-4 раза в месяц. Её муж нигде не работает. Он приехал из Росийской Федерации, потому что из за финансового кризиса работодатели ему не оплатили за работу.  Саиднисо уже 4 года кредитуется у нас. Когда она начинала, у нее было маленькое количество товара. Но сейчас Саиднисо расширилась. Саиднисо просит кредит для закупки новых видов экономичных лампочек. Тогда у Саиднисо увеличится ассортимент ее товара.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.
texts.en:
Saidiniso is 39 years old, married and has 3 children. She is involved in sales of household goods and electric appliances. She sells at the Afganbazar market located in the Panchshanbe district of the Khujand city. Saidiniso acquires her merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. She travels there 3-4 times per month. Her husband is not employed. He returned from the Russian Federation because his employers there could no longer pay him due to the financial crisis. Saidiniso has been a borrower with us for 4 years. When she started her business, she had a limited quantity of merchandise. Since then, Saidiniso expanded her business. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase new types of energy-efficient light bulbs. This will allow Saidiniso to further increase her goods assortment. MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of energy-efficient light bulbs

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
H. Muborak has a successful business selling high-quality underclothes for women. In business for 4 years, she is a very experienced entrepreneur. She offers her customers polite service, reasonable prices and quality products. Muborak is married and has a little son. She has requested a loan of 2000 Somoni to increase her business capital. This loan will allow her to continue investing in her business and pursue her future goals of expanding and opening new sales locations.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of underclothing for resale

loans.name: Shamim Muhammad Iqbal Group

texts.en:
Irshad bano baji wants a loan to buy costume jewelry to sell. 
Sumera baji wants a loan to buy readymade garments to sell. 
Bushra baji wants a loan to buy decorative pieces to sell. 
Safia baji wants a loan to buy plastic beans for her candle making business. 

Shamim baji is married to M. I.. They have lived in a city named Borewala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver and has been in this profession for the past 5 years. "I am applying for a loan to change the body of my husband’s rickshaw, " she says.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members. Each member will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: "Bushra baji is showing her decorative item in this picture".

loans.use: To change the body of auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.name: Tahira Parveen Muhammad Habib Group

texts.en:
Ulfat kanwal baji wants a loan to buy iron to sell. 
Parveen baji wants a loan to buy furniture for her tuition center. 
Shahnaz begum baji wants a loan to buy readymade garments to sell. 
Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. 

Tahira parveen baji is a very efficient and caring lady. She helps her husband in his fruit selling business. She arranges the fruit in the cart to make it easy to call the fruit names and to appear attractive to people. Her husband has been doing this business for the past 3 years. Tahira baji is applying for a loan to buy more seasonal fruits to expand her husband’s fruit selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members; each the members will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: “Parveen baji is showing her vegetable business in the picture”.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: N. Rosemary, 40-years old, is a businesswoman. She has been working for 5 years. She has a movie tape and DVD shop where she also sells stationery items. She sells cold drinks as well. She has three children, one of whom is studying at the university. She is requesting for a loan to purchase more stationery items, computer Diskettes, and soft drinks (like sodas and natural juice) to increase her inventory and increase profit, thereby expanding the business. She has a rental house where she wishes to educate her children at the university.

loans.use: To purchase drinks inventory, Diskettes and stationery for shop.

loans.name: Mumtaz Nazir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Irshad baji wants a loan to buy a lathe machine. 
Saima baji wants a loan to buy cycle repairing tools. 
Musarat baji wants a loan to buy plumbing supplies (taps and pipes) to sell. 
Ruqaiya baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. 

My name is Mumtaz and I have lived in a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. I operate a business sewing clothes, at my home, to help pay the utilities. My husband’s name is N. A.. He is a driver, by profession. He drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) and can’t get the whole money of his struggle. I am applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for my husband so that he gets the whole income of his efforts. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members; each member will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.name: Uurtsayh

texts.en:
Uurtsayh J. lives with his wife and three children in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His 19-year-old son is disabled and stays home. His two daughters are high school students. Uurtsayh has a small business making traditional, winter shoes. He has been making winter shoes since 1998. In order to make these winter shoes, sheep wool needs to be collected and processed specifically for making shoes. He usually purchases sheep wool in the fall, when prices are low and starts making the shoes before winter. Since these shoes are only used during the winter, the business is quite seasonal. In the future, he hopes to have small machinery that can process wool much more efficiently than his manual handling. Since his oldest son was not able to go to college due to his illness, he has high hopes for his daughters to be well educated. He aims to save some of his business profit for the daughters’ tuitions in the near future. 
Uurtsayh requests a loan to purchase sheep's wool for this business.

loans.use: To buy sheep's wool.

loans.name: Razia Maqsood Group

texts.en:
Adeeba baji wants a loan to buy electrical items (fridge, and television) for her electrical items business.

Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy tools for her motor-repair workshop.

Azra baji wants a loan to buy iron for making iron rods to sell.

Irshad baji wants a loan to buy material (colored thread, clothes and beads) for her embroidered-clothes business. 
 
My name is Razia and I have belonged to a city named Lahore, Pakistan, for the past ten years. My husband’s name is M. and he has a musical band. They go to functions like birthdays and weddings and perform for them and earn income. I run a business sewing clothes and use the earning to pay for the utilities. I am applying for a loan to buy a guitar for my husband’s band.

loans.use: To buy a guitar for her husband's band

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
B. Margret is a 27-year-old businesswoman. She has four children and they are going to school.

Margret has a bar where she has been operating her business for over two years. She is requesting the loan to purchase bar items like wines, beer, water, sodas, etc. to earn more profit. Her aim is to educate her children in good schools and lay a foundation for their tuition at university level and also to renovate her rental houses for income generation.

loans.use: To purchase bar items like wines, beer, water, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Razia Ilyas Group

texts.en:
This group loan will be distributed among 5 group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans, so that if one member does not repay, the other members are also responsible.

Khalida will use the loan to buy ready-made garments to sell. 
Ramzana will use it to buy tube lights to sell. 
Nazia will use it to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 
Musarat will use it to buy iron for making iron rods to sell.

Razia, the group leader, is a very hardworking lady. The other members respect her a lot for her good behavior. She operates a clothes sewing business by taking orders from her neighbors, while her husband works in a factory and receives a monthly wage. She will use the money from the loan to buy an electric sewing machine, so that she can sew more clothes and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Rahat Tariq Group

texts.en:
Rafia baji wants a loan to buy material (colored thread, clothes and beads) for her decorative embroidery business.

Azra parveen baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (oil, sugar and dry fruits) for her sweetmeat-making business.

Rahat baji, wife of Mr. T., has lived in a city named Lahore, Pakistan, for the past ten years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. She operates a clothes-sewing business to pay off the utilities.

Rahat baji’s husband has a dairy business. Presently, he has one buffalo at his house. He earns income by selling milk to the milk shops and sometimes in the community. Rahat baji is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her husband’s dairy business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her husband's dairy business

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en: Nụ Nguyễn Thị (20203050077) is a 30-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. Nụ is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 14 (14). Nụ is married and has three school-aged children. She works in someone else's business place operating a handicraft business, primarily selling wood handicrafts to tourists and local community members. Nụ has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month. Nụ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan for the first time from SEDA. She is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Ngô Thị H. (20203050078) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business running a general store. 2. Trương Thị L. (20203050079) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 3. Trương Thị T. (20203050080) is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her service-based business. 4. Nguyễn Thị H. (20203050081) is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business operating a specialized retail store. 5. Trương Thị L. (20203050082) is a 19-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her furniture-making business. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Nụ Nguyễn Thị (20203050077) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Nụ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 14 (14). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán hàng mỹ nghệ bằng gỗ cho du khách và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. Nụ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Nụ kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND. Nụ đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Nụ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Ngô Thị H. (20203050078) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 2. Trương Thị L. (20203050079) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Trương Thị T. (20203050080) là 24 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 4. Nguyễn Thị H. (20203050081) là 22 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 5. Trương Thị L. (20203050082) là 19 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose N. is a 45-year-old businesswoman who has operated a retail business for six years. She has three children who attend school. She is requesting a loan to purchase more retail items such as boxes of Safi drinks, packets of sweets, tomato sauce and cooking oil to expand her business. Thanks to her business, she obtained a beautiful house. Her dream is to educate her children abroad.

loans.use: To purchase more items to expand her retail business.

loans.name: Suraiya Jamil Khan Group

texts.en:
For the past 15 years Suraiya baji, the wife of J. K., has lived in Lahore, Pakistan a city famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. Her husband is a blacksmith who manufactures iron rods that he sells to his customers. Suraiya baji operates a clothes-sewing business to pay for the utilities and to save for rainy days. She is applying for a loan to buy iron for her husband’s business.

The other members of this group are A. Begum baji, who wants a loan to buy shoes to sell, and Razia baji, who wants a loan to buy garments to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy iron for making iron rods to sell.

loans.name: Miss. Kakda Sun Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank, which consists of sixteen members, is located in Chrouy Ampil village in Kandal province. They plan to use the loan, which they obtained, for different purposes. Miss Kakda S. is the village bank president, as selected by the members. She is single and lives with a large famiL.. She owns a small business making kramars (traditional shawls) to sell. Since her business is doing well, she has a lot of consumers with many demands. Miss Kakda S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk to make more kramars to sell so that she can earn more income to support her famiL..

loans.use: To purchase silks to make traditional kramar shawls.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Otgonbayar B., a single mother, lives with her father and two children in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her 10-year-old son goes to a local high school and her 5-year-old daughter goes a local kindergarten. Otgonbayar has a small business making souvenirs. After taking a specialized course on "How to make souvenirs by pearls" in a local school, she launched her small business in handmade souvenirs. She usually makes various pearl-decorated souvenirs including artificial flowers, small paints, jewelries, etc. She sells her products at the local market. She requests a loan to order good quality pearls from Hoh hot, China, where many Mongolian small vendors travel and purchase various household goods. In the future, she would like to expand her business and open her own shop for exclusively pearl-inspired products.

loans.use: To buy pearls from Huh hot, China.

loans.name: Ngô's Group

texts.en:
"B. Ngô Thị (20203050089) is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. B. is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 16 (16).

B. is married and has 5 school-aged children. To making a living, B. works in someone else's business venture in the arts sector operating a handicraft business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling wood handicrafts to tourists and local community members. B. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1.500.000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $84) a month from these activities.

B. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. B. is requesting for the first time a loan from SEDA. She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 dong which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. The loan will be the 1st loan she has taken out from SEDA. B. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Trương Thị

loans.use: To repair a vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Mrs. Phally Kung Village Bank Group

texts.en: Nineteen people, living in Chrouy Ampil village in Kandal province, comprise this village bank loan. They will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Phally K. is a 40-year-old village bank president. She is a widow and owns a business as kramar-maker (traditional shawls). In her business, she wants to make more kramars to support her customers. Thus, Mrs. Phally K. decided to request a loan to purchase more silks to support her business. She hopes to increase income and improve her family’s living standards. Mr. Tat YU. does not come to take the loan, his wife does, so she is presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To purchase more silk to support her business.

texts.en:
Dilbar sells children’s clothing. She brings her merchandise from Bishkek twice per month and also from Istarvshan. She repaid her previous loan ahead of time and wants to obtain another loan in order to purchase summer assortment of children clothing. Dilbar plans to bring in t-shirts for boys and dresses for girls. The photograph shows Dilbar on the day of loan disbursement. Previous photographs show her at her place of business. loans.name: Hurshed

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Хуршед Хакимов 1984 года рождения, он  разведен и детей не имеет. Имеет среднее образование. Пять лет назад начал заниматься бизнесом откорма скота. Он с отцом и братом ездят на рынок и присматривают подходящего быка или корову. Кредит получил в первые 3 года назад. В этот раз он прикупил пару голов скота. За это время от продажи и прибыли он провел дома ремонт и сделал несколько крупных покупок. Благодаря КИВА его благосостояние улучшилось, он благодарен КИВА за поддержку.
texts.en:
Born in 1984, Hurshed H. is divorced and has no children. He has a secondary education. He became involved in the business of raising livestock five years ago. Together with his father and brother, Hurshed goes to a market to find suitable cows or bulls. He received his first loan 3 years ago and used it to purchase a couple of heads of livestock. Since then, he was able to use profits from sale of livestock to remodel his house and to make several large purchases. Thanks to Kiva, his livelihood improved. Hurshed is grateful to Kiva for the support.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two cows

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru:

Мухайё продаёт хозяйственные товары. Она торгует в городе Худжанде. Ей фирмы завезли дешёвый фирменный товар, она хочет погасить оставшуюся сумму предыдущего кредита и получить повторно займ. На полученную сумму Мухаё хочет закупить и фирмы стиральный порошок и туалетные мыла Российского производства. Она хорошо без нарушений погашает свои кредиты.
texts.en:
Muhayo sells household goods in the city of Khujand. Her suppliers deliver inexpensive brand-name merchandise. She wants to repay the remaining amount of her previous loan and obtain another one. Muhayo wants to use this loan to purchase brand-name laundry detergent and toilet soaps manufactured in Russia. Muhayo repays her loans well and without any violations.

loans.name: Mrs. Ny Khen Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank, which consists of twenty-three members, is located in Chrouy Ampil village in Kandal province and they plan to use the loan, which they obtained, for different purposes. Mrs. Ny K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a fruit middle woman in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fruit to resell to earn more income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Un Sophorn, is a construction worker. Mrs. Ny K., 40 years old, is the mother of two children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchasing more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Kufti

Кутфи женщина , которая торгует на рынке «Сомон» детской одеждой, искусственными цветами и обувью. Досрочно погасив кредит она хочет получить чуть побольше, для завоза детской обуви, босоножек, сланцев. Кутфи  кредитуется уже третий год, и её активы заметно увеличились ,и место торговли расширилось. На 
Снимке Кутфи в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Kufti sells children’s clothing, artificial flowers and shoes at the Somon market. She repaid her previous loan ahead of time and wants to obtain a slightly larger loan in order to acquire children’s shoes, sandals and flip-flops. Kufti has been a borrower for the third year, her assets noticeably increased, and her retail outlet expanded. The photograph shows Kufti on the disbursement day.

loans.name: Koem

texts.en: Koem L. is 47 years old and mother to six children: four are single and the other two are married and have already started new families. In the beginning of 2000, Koem L. built a small store in front of her home. In her shop, she sells a few snack products to the neighbors who live near her house in the village. In addition, she always cultivates crops during the approaching of farming season. She is married to Khat Sarun, 44, a local carpenter. After the rains fall and the land is suitable for production, Koem L. will take out a loan to buy fertilizers and vegetable seeds to sow on her existing farmland.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and vegetable seeds to sow on her existing farmland.

Мусабе – женщина , которая продаёт детскую одежду и обувь. Она  за товаром ездит в Бишкек два раза в месяц.  Для завоза летнего ассортимента хочет получить повторно кредит.
Планирует привезти летние трусики, маячки , футболочки. Она благодарна организации за финансирование и поддержку.
texts.en:
Musabe sells children’s clothing and shoes. She travels to Bishkek for her merchandise twice per month. She would like to obtain another loan in order to acquire a summer goods assortment. She plans to bring in summer shorts, tank tops and t-shirts. Musabe is grateful to our organization for the financing and support. Мухаббат –торгует посудой в магазине расположенном в центре города Худжанда.  Она досрочно погасив кредит хочет получить повторно кредит на закуп оптом сервизов и красивой посуды. У неё очень большой выбор посуды и термосов. Постоянно торговля кипит. Мухаббат благодарит всех инвесторов организации за финансирование и поддержку.
texts.en:
Muhabbat sells dishware at a store located in the city center of Khujand. She repaid her previous loan ahead of time and wants to obtain another loan in order to purchase dinnerware sets and decorative dishes wholesale. She has a wide variety of dinnerware and thermoses. Her business is always busy. Muhabbat is grateful to all the investors for the financing and support. loans.use: Wholesale purchase of dinnerware sets

loans.name: Sok Noeun's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sok Noeun C. is a group leader of six members who live in Roteang village in Kandal province. She is a fish seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Khun Sophea, is a fisherman. In his fishing, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough fishing supplies so he earns less income. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Sok Noeun C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a boat for her husband’s fishing. She hopes to increase their income and improve her family's living. She is 29 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a boat for her husband’s fishing.

loans.name: Kny

texts.en: Mr. Kny G. is a villager in Preak Traeng village in Kandal province. He is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Pauk Sary, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Even though this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support their family living. In order to improve the family, Mr. Kny G. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. He is a 45-year-old father of five children, one of whom is a construction worker while the other two are employed in a garment factory and the remaining two are attending the local school. His wife is presented in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Mavdjuda

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”

  Мавджуда Рахмонова 1970 года рождения, замужем имеет 3 детей. Почти всю свою жизнь заниматься откормом скота. Выращивает овец и коров. Более 15 лет ухаживает за скотом. Рано утром скот отправляет с детьми на пастбище для откорма. Скот там пасется до вечера. Муж Мавджуды зарабатывает на жизнь строительством на стройке. 
Первый кредит получила 3 года назад на покупку  корма и несколько овец. Благодаря поддержки КИВА ее дети учатся в приличных школах, а также  она улучшила своё семейное положение.
texts.en:
Mavjuda R. was born in 1970, she is married and has three children. Almost all of her life she has been breeding cattle. She raises sheep and goats and looks after the cattle for more than fifteen years. In the early morning she sends her children to take the cattle to the pastures for feeding. The cattle shepherds there until the evening. Mavjuda's husband earns his living in construction. She has received her first loan three years ago to buy fodder and several sheep. Thanks to the support of Kiva her children are studying in decent schools and she has improved her family's living conditions.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan.
