Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy five sheep

loans.name: Ourn

texts.en: Mrs. Ourn N. lives in Preak Traeng village in Kandal province. She sells Khmer cake and juice sugar. She also is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. On her plantation, she faces a problem because she does not have rice seed to grow in the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed for growing and to use the rest of the money to buy a cart for her family. Mrs. Ourn N. is 44 years old and the mother of a child who is a chop wood seller.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and a cart.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin K., 55, is a busy woman who attempts to earn money from many ventures. She cultivates rice as well as buying it in bulk from other farmers to store in her home. She buys when rice is commanding the lowest price and then sells it to gain income. Besides those sectors, she also provides small loans with a specific schedule of repayment to the villagers. She is a widowed mother who has given birth to four children. Two of her children are single and under her care, while the other two are married and live separately. Yin K. is applying for a loan to hire a machine to plow farmland and to buy more fertilizers to fatten her rice-crop yields.

loans.use: To hire a machine to plow the farmland

loans.name: Sovoen

texts.en: Mr. Sovoen S. is a villager in Praek Taten village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate vegetables. In his field, he wants to grow more plants to earn more income for his family. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy banana plants to grow in the field. His wife, Mrs. Kuy Heang Leng, owns a small business as a furniture seller. Mr. Sovoen S. is 52 years old and the father of four children, one of whom is a grocer. Two other children are Chinese noodle sellers and the remaining one is attending the local school. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy banana plants

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom S. lives in Sdao Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Yun Yoeun, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow vegetables and fruits. In the field, they want to grow some vegetables to earn more money. Thus, Mrs. Sokhom S. decided to request a loan to buy vegetable seed and fertilizer to support the field to make it more productive. Additionally, she would use the loan to buy mangos to resell to earn more income for her family. She is 30 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Nara Yin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eleven people living in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal Province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes.

Mrs. Nara Y. is the 30-year-old village bank president. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store in her house. Her husband, Mr. Tang Lorn, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he grows vegetables. Even though they try hard, they still earn less income than they need, so they face an obstacle to get enough food for the family. Thus, Mrs. Nara Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy food for her family. She has a child who is just four years old.

Mr. Chandara G. did not come to take a loan but his wife did, so she decided to ask for the loan instead. 

All but one member in the group have monthly payment loans. One member has an end-of-term loan and is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy food for her family

loans.name: Matluba

 Исломкулова Матлуба  занимаетс откормом скота.Матлуба сама швея, дома шьет национальные платья.  Ее муж находиться в России на заработки. В данный момент она одна содержит семью.  Первый кредит получила в 2007 году. На кредит она приобрела 2 овцы и корм для них. В этом году за счет продажи коров она провела капитальный ремонт. За это она благодарна КИВА.
texts.en:
Matluba I. breeds cattle. Matluba is also a seamstress and makes national dresses at home. Her husband works in Russia. At this time she supports the family. She received her first loan in 2007 and used the loan to buy two sheep and fodder for them. This year she sold cows and it allowed her to make a complete renovation in her home. She is very thankful to Kiva for this.

loans.use: To purchase two cows

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a widow with four children to look after, all of whom are still in school. Facing difficulties to meet the needs of her children, she decided to join GHAPE and took her first loan of 20,000 CFA ($40) in 2006. She has proven her credibility by receiving and successfully repaying loans totaling $240. With her new loan, she intends to buy ten bags of animal feed for the pigs she raises. She presently has three pigs which she bought with her second loan but is now finding difficulties feeding them. Pigs are a valuable commodity in her community and if these pigs grow up to maturity, she will sell them for a very good price, ranging from 80,000-100,000+ CFA. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru:

Заррина молодая , весёлая , энергичная женщина. Которая занимается продажей фруктов и овощей. При каждом мониторинге убеждаемся , что у неё много своих постоянных клиентов , которых она быстро и качественно обслуживает. Вот и на снимке она очень занята обслуживанием клиентов , продавая огурцы и помидоры. Она за три года она смогла расширить свой бизнес и увеличить торговлю.
texts.en:
Zarrina is a young, cheerful and energetic woman. She sells fruits and vegetables. During every screening she confirms that she has many regular customers whom she services quickly and with care. On the photo she is buy serving her customers by selling cucumbers and tomatoes. During these three years she was able to expand her business and increase sales.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Phạm's Group

texts.en: V. Phạm Thị (20213020001) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. She is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ân Tập 04 (4). V. is married and has three school-aged children. V. owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month. V. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan for the first time from SEDA. She is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Đinh Thị T. (20213020002) is a 45-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her service-based business. 2. Vũ Thị D. (20213020003) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food. 3. Tô Thị D. (20213020004) is a 45-year-old female who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food. 4. Chu Thị T. (20213020005) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** V. Phạm Thị (20213020001) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. V. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ân Tập 04 (4). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán. V. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, V. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND. V. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. V. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Đinh Thị T. (20213020002) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 2. Vũ Thị D. (20213020003) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 3. Tô Thị D. (20213020004) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 4. Chu Thị T. (20213020005) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Amy Demba

texts.fr: Amy DemB. B., 43 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants  en charge.. Son activité est la restauration et le commerce. Elle compte acheter des fruits, de l’huile de palme, du savon et des provisions pour préparer des sandwiches et vendre pour renforcer son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amy DemB. B., age 43, is married and has three children to support. She works in commerce and in the restaurant business. She plans to buy some fruit, palm oil soap, and supplies for making sandwiches to sell in order to bolster her business and to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell sandwiches, fruit, palm oil, and soaps

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr: Hawa D., 56 ans est mariée avec 02 enfants  en charge. Son activité est la transformation et vente des céréales et de beignets. Elle veut acheter mil, mais et provisions pour faire des beignets et vendre pour renforcer améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Hawa D., 56, is married and raising two children. Her business is processing and selling cereals and making fritters. She wants to buy millet, maize, and provisions to make the fritters and sell these goods to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: processing and sale of millet, maize, and of fritters

loans.name: Feyruz

texts.en:
Feyruz M. has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from his young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married with three children.

Feyruz has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. With a starting capital of $200, and thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise six years ago. Over time he has expanded his business and today it has become a family business with his whole family engaged in it. 

Today Feyruz needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of his goods. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of $1500. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuffs for his store

loans.name: Vilayat

texts.en:
Selling cosmetics and home products in his private shop became the only source of income for Vilayat K., a 50-year-old man who's been doing this for fifteen years. He is married and the father of one son. His child is the reason that he works hard in order to provide him with the best and brightest future.

This man has many projects for his future. Vilayat’s wish is to add more cosmetics and therefore have more to offer to his clients. He would pay back this loan and, also with the profits, he would be able to pay for his son’s wedding. This man waits for your help. Let's make his dream come true.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Namiq

texts.en:
Namiq I. is the married father of two sons. His family lives in Imishli City where Namiq runs a small grocery store, selling food downtown. His store is well known in the neighborhood as he serves his customers well and works late hours, which is very convenient for many customers who work late and go shopping after work.

Namiq has been in business for five years. Currently he is seeking a loan of $1,200 to purchase more inventory to increase the variety of goods he offers. He had some struggles when his business was growing and becoming self-sustainable, but he handled all these challenges pretty well and is looking toward to the future with much enthusiasm and optimism.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to increase his variety of goods

loans.name: Zahir

texts.en:
Zahir A. is in the livestock business. He breeds livestock, which provides sustenance for his humble home. Zahir is single and helping his parents financially.

It's important to note that, since he started his business, Zahir has acquired an abundance of experience and knowledge because of his great dedication to breeding his animals. He is looking for support to purchase livestock to sell in order to continue with his arduous work with cattle.

loans.use: To purchase two cattle

loans.name: Almas Group

texts.en:
Salma A., age 30, is single with no child. She sells clothes from her home and also door to door. She started this business in 1968 and works from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $114.

This will be Salma’s 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her clothing business, bought house furniture, bought land and has paid back her loans successfully. She hopes to get her 6th loan to increase her capital and to buy bricks.

Salma will share this loan with her group, Almas, which totals twenty-two members. These members will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Salma is second from the left in a black blouse and yellow skirt.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothing and to buy bricks

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en:
Sheep are raised in order to be butchered, to obtain derived products and to be used for agricultural tasks. Seymur A. has been dedicated to sheep farming for eight years. He is married and the father of two children. He makes a great effort in order to meet the needs of the children in his charge and to bring sustenance to his humble home.

His greatest need now is to buy 10 sheep and fodder for expanding his business. For this reason, Seymur turned to AqroInvest Credit Union in order to obtain a loan of $1,200 that will allow him to purchase these animals and make his business better.

loans.use: Purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Sope Mame Diarra Thioune Ii Group

texts.fr:
LE groupe sope mame diarra 2 est composé de cinq femmes trés dynamiques qui habitent au quartier randoulène de thiès ;elles font du petit commerce depuis quelques années et vendent des pagnes ,des perles et de l'encens
elles ont décidé de contracter ce pret pour augmenter leur fonds de roulement car cette période de l'année constitue leur période favorable de vente
texts.en:
The Sope Mame Diarre 2 group is made up of 5 energetic women who live in the Randoulène district of Thiès. They have been engaged in petty trading for some years and sell "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth), necklaces, and incense.

They decided to request this loan to increase their working capital, since this period of the year is the most favorable one for sales.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increasing their working capital

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin M. is 54 years old and is married with three children. He sells confectionery and other foodstuffs in the market and has been in this business already for nine years. This activity generates the main income for his family.

Since Elchin is very popular in the market selling the fresh and tasty pastries, he tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today, Elchin requests $1,200 for purchasing more food items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more food products to sell

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

 Рустам  Курбонкулов 1969 года рождения, он женат у него 3 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Он имеет магазин в кишлаке недалеко от своего дома. В магазине он торгует продуктами и хозяйственными товарами.Также он занимается бизнесом животноводства. для этого он нанял чабана содержания скота. У него 6 коров и 8 овец.  Бизнес начинал 2 года назад с покупки одной 2 овец. Теперь его  отара по не многу растет и он доволен бизнесом.
texts.en:
Born in 1969, Rustam K. is married and has 3 children. He has a secondary education. Rustam owns a store in a village not far from his house. He sells food products and household goods there. Rustam is also involved in the animal husbandry business. He hired a shepherd to take care of his livestock. Rustam owns 6 cows and 8 sheep. He started his business 2 years ago with a purchase of only one sheep. His herd has since gradually grown, and he is pleased with his business.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow and a goat

loans.name: Khuseynali

texts.en:
Khuseynali A. is 53 years old and married with five children. He is a cattle breeder. He tells us that he comes from a farming family and that he does very well financially because he takes good care of his land. At the same time he raises cattle at his house.

Khuseynali’s wife is his biggest supporter. She helps him in anything she can and takes good care of him and the house. With this loan, he would like to expand his irrigation system which is fundamental when it comes to farming. The loan will greatly improve his income and his family's living standards.

loans.use: To expand his irrigation system

loans.name: Marifat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


   Марифат Шодиева женщина 40 лет. Вдова , имеет 3 детей. Работает  Марифат медсестрой в Кайраккумском центральной поликлинике. также подрабатывает санитаркой в том учреждении. Когда год назад потеряла мужа , брат мужа решил помочь ей. Он посоветовал получить кредит на какой либо бизнес. Кредит получать не решалась, не знала как погасит свои долги. Недавно ее племянник сообщил что от откорма скота остается хорошая прибыль. Она решила получить кредит на покупку корову с теленком.
texts.en:
Marifat S. is 40 years old. She is a widow and has 3 children. She is a nurse at the Kayrakkum central hospital and also works there as a part-time orderly. When Marifat lost her husband a year ago, her brother-in-law decided to help her. He advised her to obtain a business loan. Until now, Marifat has been hesitant to obtain a loan, not knowing how she could repay it. Recently, her nephew informed her that livestock feeding business results in a good profit. Therefore, Marifat decided to request a loan in order to purchase a cow with a calf.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock purchase

loans.name: Akif

texts.en:
Akif J. is a 47-year-old cattleman who is married with three children. Owing to his father, who is a farmer, Akif has been associated with this business since he was young. He purchases the cattle in the local market and then he breeds and sells them. The cattle are kept in the house and it takes a lot of effort to care for them. Every day, Akif gets up early in the morning in order to feed his animals. And all day, until late at night, he is busy looking after the cattle.

Akif says that he works with only one aim in mind - to provide his children with a proper education. Now, Akif would like to expand his business and purchase two cattle. For this purpose, he has applied for $1,200 and with your help he hopes to reach his aim. Be an important part of the growth of Akif’s business.

loans.use: To purchase two cattle

loans.name: Azal

texts.en:
Azal I. is the loving and self-sacrificing father of three children. Ever since he was very young, Azal has been around people raising animals and, thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sale of cattle he has been able to bring stability to his family.

The desire that Azal harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. He requests $1,200 to buy more cattle to expand his business. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing well-being and security to the members of his family.

loans.use: To purchase two cattle

loans.name: Sope Mame Diarra 1 Group

texts.fr: LE groupe sope mame diarra 1 est composé de cinq femmes qui habitent ensemble au quartier randoulène de thies ,elles font du petit commerce de produits pour femmes notamment des pagnes,des perles et de l'encens;elles ont ouvert un compte au sein de la mutuelle et veulent contracter un pret pour augmenter leur fonds de roulement
texts.en:
The Sope Mame Diarra 1 group is composed of 5 women who lived together in the Randoulène neighborhood of Thies. They are engaged in petty commerce, selling products of interest to women, notably "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth), necklaces, and incense. They have opened an account with the credit union and want to request a loan to increase their working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increasing their working capital

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
A livestock breeder from a very young age, Zaur R. is 35 years old, married, and responsible for his wife and three children.

With the goal in mind to increase his income and expand his business, Zaur is requesting a loan of $1,500 that will serve him as business capital. The profit he will make from this business will allow him to improve the living conditions of his household and also enable him to make some investments.

loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: İsmayıl

texts.en:
İsmayıl N. is 60 years old, married, and the father of two children. He owns a grocery store and provides for his family with the revenue generated by it. In addition, he is a cultural section worker.

İsmayıl is requesting a loan of $1,200 to increase the stock of foodstuffs in his grocery store and also to buy construction materials.

İsmayıl is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children will progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing his best. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for his grocery store plus construction materials

loans.name: Ndiabou

texts.fr: Ndiabou G. est une femme de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle vend des denrées alimentaires telles que mil, maïs, riz, pain de singe et aimerait renforcer son activité. Elle souhaite mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Ndiabou G. is a woman of 44 years of age, married and the mother of 6 children. She sells foodstuffs such as millet, maize, rice, and monkey bread, and would like to bolster her business. She hopes to cater better for her family's needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and resale of millet, maize, rice, and monkey bread

loans.name: Soltan

texts.en: Soltan

loans.use: To purchase 5 baby calves

loans.name: Eva Michele

texts.fr: EVA est une femme divorcée qui a en charge un enfant ;elle est éducatrice dans un groupe scolaire situé au quartier mbour 1  de thiès ,parallèlement à son travail ,elle fait du petit commerce de produits cosmétiques et des habits ;c'est pour augmenter son fonds de roulement qu'elle a décidé de contracter ce pret
texts.en:
Eva is a divorced woman who is raising a child. She is a teacher in a school situated in the Mbour 1 district of Thiès. Along with her teaching, she engages in petty trading, selling cosmetics and garments. It is in order to grow her working capital that she has decided to take out this loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: growing her working capital

loans.name: Shammad

texts.en:
Shammad Q. is 44 years old and is married with four children. From the time he was young, Shammad has been learning to work in the small business of cattle breeding. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice, and seeing his family progressing more and more.

His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future for his children, and to see them as professional, ethical, and hardworking people. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of 1200 USD. He wants this loan to buy additional livestock.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Afila

texts.en: Afila A. is 50 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of five daughters. She started her business in 2001 with the aim to help his husband. Now she dedicates herself to raising and selling cows. With the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy. Afila asks for a loan of 1200 USD in order to buy more young cattle to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment Afila will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase three baby calves

loans.name: Sira

texts.fr: Sira D. est une dame de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle tient un étal chez elle où elle vend divers légumes. Elle voudrait avec ce prêt, renforcer son activité pour plus participer à la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
Sira D. is a woman of 51, married and the mother of 6 children. She has a little stand at her home where she sells various vegetables. She would like to use this loan to grow her little business so that she can better help support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of vegetables and various foodstuffs

loans.name: Vaqif

texts.en: Vaqif

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en: Education is the most important inheritance Kamala M.  and her husband can give to their two dear daughters. They are both very responsible parents, and they work very hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their children the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and, with the unconditional support of her husband she buys and sells cattle in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, she now finds herself with more expenses, and she would like a loan of 1200USD in order to increase their capital by increasing their number of cattle.

loans.use: To purchase three baby calves

loans.name: Awa Ngom

texts.fr: Awa Ngom M., 61 ans est veuve avec 05 enfants  en charge. Son activité est le commerce. Ce prêt va lui permettre d’acheter du poisson séché, du poisson fumé et du yet pour renforcer son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Awa Ngom M., 61, is a widow with 5 children for whom she is responsible. Her business is petty trading. This loan will allow her to buy dried fish, smoked fish, and "yet" (fermented dried mollusc used as a condiment) to bolster her little business and improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of dried and smoked fish and "yet"

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr: mbaye kébé est un chauffeur né le 04 N0VEMBRE 1970 à thiès:il est marié et est père de quatre enfant;il est membre de la mutuelle depuis plus de trois ans et a toujours remboursé ses prets correctement:avec la somme qu'il demande il veut réparer son véhicule qui est en panne et qui est sa principale source de revenu
texts.en:
Mbaye Kébé is a driver who was born on November 4, 1970 in Thiès. He is married and the father of 4 children. He has been a member of the credit union for more than 3 years and has always reimbursed his loans correctly. With the sum that he is requesting, he is going to repair his vehicle which is broken down and is his principal source of revenue.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: repairing his vehicle, used as a taxi

loans.name: Jinalyn

texts.en:
Jinalyn B. is a mother who aspires to a better future for her four year old daughter. She and her husband Jomarie agreed to get a loan from ASHI in order to attain her aspiration in life.  In 2007, Jinalyn joined ASHI. That year, she only received PHP5,000 loan. After two years of  maintaining her good performance in ASHI such as a good repayment record and a good attendance in center meetings, she is now qualified to apply for a loan in a higher amount.

Just recently, Jinalyn applied for a loan from ASHI amounting to PHP14,000. This loan will be used as additional capital for  the business she had been doing since the time she joined ASHI - her buy and sell  fish business. 

Through the opportunity Jinalyn receives from ASHI, she believes that her loan will not only enhance her business and child's education but also will provide her family a secured house.

loans.use: To buy and sell  fish

loans.name: Samba

texts.fr: MR samba F. est un chauffeur de profession,il est marié et habite au quartier mbour 1 de thiès;il est membre de la mutuelle depuis 2003 et a toujours remboursé ses crédits avec succés,pour cette fois ci il veut contracter ce crédit dans le but d'acheter un moteur pour son véhicule
texts.en:
Mr. Samba F. is a professional driver. He is married and lives in the Mbour 1 district of Thiès. He has been a member of the credit union since 2003 and has always reimbursed his loans successfully. This time, he wants to take out a loan in order to buy a motor for his vehicle.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a motor for his vehicle

loans.name: Urozali

texts.ru: Урозали Тошев проживает в районе Чоми. Возраст 50 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Урозали 10 лет работал учителем в школе. Но вскоре начал свой бизнес, он занимается посевом бахчевых растений. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы посеить как бахчевые растения, так и семечки. Собрав хороший урожай он хочет продать, а на полученный доход отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en:
Urozali T. lives in the Chomi region. He is 50 years old. He is married and has six children. Urozali has worked as a teacher in school for ten years. But then soon he started own business and sows melons. The client is asking for a loan to sow more melons as well as seeds. He wants to sell it when he collects good harvest and use the profit to repair his home.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sow melons and seeds

loans.name: Ami Collé

texts.fr: . Ami Collé S., 51 ans est divorcée avec 05 enfants  en charge. Son activité est le commerce de denrées alimentaires. Elle veut acheter en gros du riz, du savon, des boissons, des biscuits, bonbons, lait, oignons et autres pour revendre au détail et  renforcer son activité
texts.en:
Ami Collé S., 51, is divorced and raising 5 children. Her business is selling foodstuffs. She wants to purchase wholesale: rice, soap, drinks, cookies, candy, milk, onions etc., to sell retail and bolster her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs wholesale

loans.name: Idjonoi

texts.ru: Турсунова Айджоной проживает в районе Чоми. Возраст 44 года. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж работает таксистом. Айжоной более 11 лет занимается земледелием. Она в основном выращивает овощи и продает их на рынке. Клиентка просить кредит, чтобы купить ядохимикаты для обработки земли.
texts.en:
Idjonoi T. lives in the Jomi district. She is 44 years old, married and has 5 children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Idjonoi has been involved in agriculture for over 11 years. She mostly grows vegetables and sells them at the market. Our client is requesting a loan in order to buy pesticides to apply to the soil.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pesticides

loans.name: Aijan Tokbolotova’S Group

texts.en:
Six years ago, Aijan Tokbolotova opened a small business selling women’s clothing. She owns a small stall in the market in Balykchy, a city in the Issyk-kul region. She buys women’s clothing and shoes in the Dordoi market in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan), which is the largest market in the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS), and then sells them in Balykchy. She has about $70 USD (~ KGS 3,000) to use as working capital and she is planning to use the loan to purchase summer clothes to sell.

Aijan is married and has 3 children, 2 daughters and 1 son. The son and one of the daughters are currently studying at Bishkek universities. Aijan’s husband works as a bus driver.

All the members of Aijan's loan group are neighbors. They are all occupied with various small businesses. Toktogul resells children’s clothes at Balykchy market. Naryngul is planning to spend the loan to purchase sheep and cows for her livestock breeding business. Sonunbubu needs a loan to help her husband pay for car repairs, because her husband is a taxi driver and his car is their only source of income.

loans.use: To purchase summer clothes to sell and to pay the educational expenses of her children

loans.name: Anarkul Saypidinova’S Group

texts.en:
Anarkul S. is the leader of a group of four people. She lives in the small village of Kochkor in the very heart of Kyrgyzstan and she needs the loan to purchase livestock, which is her family's essential source of income and livelihood. By purchasing cows and several rams, she hopes to increase her income. She plans to sell their milk, meat, and wool at the local market. With the money from selling the products of her livestock, she hopes to buy necessities for her family. 

Anarkul has three sons and two very sweet daughters. Her husband is a teacher at the local technical school. Because Anarkul has a large family, she works hard to feed and raise her children.

The other three members of Anarkul’s loan group are also occupied with livestock breeding. Mostly they breed sheep, cows, hens and geese. Kulsayra, Halisa, and Kulkayir are married and have children, most of whom are graduating from primary and secondary schools this year and need to continue their education. All the women hope to increase their family budget by selling the livestock products so they can pay for their children’s education. 

They say that “no matter that will happen tomorrow in the world, they will be always protected, because the livestock is their only hope and support.”

loans.use: To buy livestock to increase her family's income

loans.name: Gulnara Kiribaeva’S Group

texts.en:
Gulnara K. is the director and developer of the Center of Temporary Stay for Orphaned Children in the town of Orlovka. The Center was started five years ago and currently hosts 41 children between the ages of 4 and 17 years. Some of the children came to the center by themselves and the others were guided by neighbors or the city administration. When a foster child turns 17, Gulnara helps him/her to get into college in Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan) and provides all possible assistance with their future. At present, the Center exists on donations from private individuals and various organizations.

Gulnara organized a loan group among her workers, who are mainly homeless people. All of them plan to spend their loans to buy and raise livestock. The workers hope to use their proceeds to maintain their families. Gulnara, in turn, is planning to breed livestock in order to generate income for the Center. Also, Gulnara will be able to sell milk and calves at the market, so she can purchase necessary clothing and materials and pay for utilities.

Gulnara K. is married and has three children. She is a former employee of the district public education department in the town of Orlovka. She used to work with orphans, but when she saw all the problems these children were facing, she decided to open the Center.

loans.use: To buy livestock in order to generate income for the Center of Temporary Stay for Orphaned Children

loans.name: Kadyralieva Group

texts.en:
Gulbaram K. is the leader of a group of five people. She sells fruit and vegetables at the market in Kochkor, Kyrgyzstan.

Several years ago, Gulbaram decided to bring exotic fruits from Bishkek, the capital of Kyrgyzstan, to her tiny village to resell them. The exotic fruits included kiwi, bananas, pineapples and tangerines. These fruits were never before sold in Kochkor and no one had ever tasted them. Thanks to Gulbaram and her hard work, the inhabitants of the village now have the chance to purchase these fruits. Now Gulbaram needs a loan to buy more fruit for her small business and to pay for her children's education.

Gulbaram has three children, two sons and one daughter. They really contribute their help to their mother’s day-to-day hard work. They understand that life in the village is quite hard and they help their mom in whatever ways they can.

The second member of the group, Siynat A., collects old-fashioned bedspreads that are made according to national Kyrgyz traditions. She buys bedspreads from different people, restores them, and resells them at the local market and at the markets in nearby big cities.

The other two members of the group sell vegetables and breed livestock. Gulnara and Latifa are married and have children. Since they have extended families, they spend a lot of time caring for them. They hope to use their loans to buy more livestock so they can sell the livestock products. They will use their profits to buy necessary things for their families and save money for children’s education in the future.

All five of the women in the group are very bright people who have positive attitudes about life.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Tatiana Sinuk’S Group

texts.en:
Tatiana S. (the first person on the left in the photograph) organized a retirement home called “Sunshine” for people between the ages 60-90 years old. She started 5 months ago, after her mother’s death. “I didn’t give all the warmth and care I could to my own parents, so I am giving it today to my new guests,” Tatiana says. Today, Tatiana has 11 elderly people in the home and 5 staff workers.

Tatiana financed the retirement home entirely with her own money. The local government provided an old building (a former kindergarten) to use free of charge for fifteen years. Tatiana managed to make some small renovations in the building. She bought 20 beds (the total capacity is 60 people) and purchased equipment for the kitchen and dining room. Because “Sunshine” does not have enough cash assets, all of the workers work for free and hope to be paid a salary when better times come. Nowadays, the retirement home exists only with the aid of the retiree’s pensions.

Tatiana hopes to use loan money to purchase a cow and two sheep. Milk and meat from the livestock will be used for cooking. Also, some amount of milk and meat can be sold in the market. Additional food and all the necessary materials will be purchased. Also, Tatiana expects the older people to participate in the process of livestock breeding in order to fill their free time with an interesting hobby.

Tatiana S. is married and has three sons. She and her husband operate the retirement home and their sons try to help whenever they have free time. Tatiana comments: “I love this house. I feel like someone is protecting it.”

loans.use: To breed livestock, which will supply her retirement home with milk and meat

loans.name: Oumy

texts.fr: Oumy N., jeune femme de 38 ans est veuve et mère de 4 enfants. Elle fait de la restauration et en même temps aussi du commerce d’effets vestimentaires. Elle prend en charge ses factures d’eau et aimerait améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Oumy N., a young woman of 38, is a widow and the mother of 4 children. She sells cooked food and at the same time, clothing. She is responsible for her water bills and would like to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: serving cooked food

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: MAGUETTE N. dite nogaye est une femme mariée très brave qui fait des activités génératrices  de revenu afin d'aider son mari dans les dépenses courantes;son activité consiste à confectionner des chaussures et des pagnes en vue de les revendre sur le marché local et en mauritanie:elle veut bénéficier de ce pret pour augmenter son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
Maguette N., nicknamed Nogaye, is a very respectable married woman who engages in petty trading in order to help her husband support the family. Her business is making shoes and "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) in view of selling them on the local market and in Mauritania. She wants to take out this loan to increase her working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of shoes and "pagnes"

loans.name: Ndaté

texts.fr: Ndaté K. est âgée de 46 ans, mariée et à en charge 10 enfants. Elle vend des tissus teintés et en meme temps fait un commerce d’huile de palme. Ce prêt lui permettra de maintenir cette activité et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndaté K., 46, is married and raising 10 children. She sells dyed cloth and at the same time sells palm oil. This loan will permit her to keep this business going and improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and resale of dyed cloth

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata N., 47 ans est veuve mère de 04 enfants avec 04 autres personnes  à sa charge. Son activité est le commerce de tissus. Ce prêt va lui permettre d’acheter des tissus teintés en bazin, en khartoum et des meulfeu ( en tissu voile) pour renforcer son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aminata N., 47, is a widow and the mother of 4 children, while caring for 4 other persons as well. Her business is selling cloth. This loan will permit her to buy "bazin" (damask) which has been dyed, and also Khartoum (a sort of cloth) and meulfeu (a voile for turbans) so as to bolster her business and improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling dyed cloth of various sorts

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиер Хикматов проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 35 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Бахтиер имеет торговую точку на рынке, он торгует продуктами питания. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 10 лет. До этого он 5 лет работал музыкантом. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы пополнить оборотные средства.
texts.en:
Bahtiyor H. lives in the Gissar district. He is 35 years old, married and has 4 children. Bahtiyor has a retail stand at a market, where he sells food products. He has been involved in this type of business for over 10 years. Previously, he worked as a musician for 5 years. Our client is requesting a loan in order to increase his working capital.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Vieux

texts.fr: MR vieux N. est un agent de sécurité depuis quatre ans ,pour diversifier ses sources de revenu il fait du commerce de pantalons,de chaussures et de chemises ;c'est pour cela qu'il sollicite ce pret
texts.en:
Mr. Vieux N. has been a security guard for 4 years. To diversify his sources of income, he sells pants, shoes, and shirts. That is the reason why he is requesting this loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling clothing and shoes

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa N., 37 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants et 02 autres membres de sa famille en charge. Elle s’active dans la vente de sucre et de glaces Ce prêt va lui permettre d’acheter le sucre  pour le revendre et entretenir son activité de vente  de glace.
texts.en:
Awa N., 37, is married with 3 children and two other family members in her care. She works selling sugar and ice. This loan will allow her to buy sugar for resale so she can maintain her business selling ice.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of ice and sugar

loans.name: Diouma

texts.fr: madame diouma S. est une marchande sise au quartier cité ousmane ngom ;depuis 2000,elle vend de la glace et des jus,avec ce pret elle veut acquérir un nouveau réfrigérateur pour maximiser ses bénéfices
texts.en:
Mrs. Diouma S. is a petty trader living in the Cité Ousmane Ngom neighborhood. Since 2000,she has been selling ice and juice. With this loan she wants to acquire a new refrigerator to maximize her profit.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a refrigerator

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị H. is a 40 year-old female living in the town of Đô Lương.  She is married and has 2 adult -aged children.  To make a living,  Nguyễn Thị owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice products in the local community.  She has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2500000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007,  Nguyễn Thị  joined the TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from the TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Nguyễn Thị  is now requesting a new loan of 9000000 VND which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  The loan will be the 4th loan she has taken out. Nguyễn Thị plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị M.  (1802070650) is a 50 year-old female living in the town of Đô Lương.  She is married and has 2 adult -aged children.  To making a living, M. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale.  M. has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, M. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  M. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000,000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  M. is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  M. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

loans.use: used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Võ Thị

texts.en:
Võ Thị H. is a 35 year-old woman living in Đô Lương. She is married and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Võ Thị makes and sells food. Her main source of income comes from selling rice products in the local community. She has been in this business for over four years and earns approximately 3000000VND a month.

In 2007, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund to expand her business.

H. is requesting a loan of 12000000 VND to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be her fourth from TYM Fund. H. plans to use revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị is a 37 year-old woman living in Đô Lương. She is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes from selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. Nguyễn Thị has been engaged in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 1500000 VND a month.

In 2007, Nguyễn Thị joined the TYM Fund to access financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She successfully repaid a loan of 7000000 VND from TYM Fund to expand her business.

Nguyễn Thị is requesting a loan of 9000000 VND to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her third taken out from TYM Fund. Nguyễn Thị plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Hà Nguyễn Thị (1803070677) is a 40-year-old female living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has two adult children.

Hà owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2007, Hà joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

Hà is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 4th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Phạm Thị

texts.en:
L. Pham Thị (1815071327) is a 33-year-old female living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has two adult children.

L. owns and operates a business providing cargo transport services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 1,700,000 VND a month.

In 2007, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service.

L. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 4th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
T. Tràn Thị (1816071344) is a 32-year-old female living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has one school-aged child.

T. owns and operates a business providing medicinal services to local community members. T. has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2007, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 4th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Trần Thị

texts.en:
Hòa Tràn Thị (1815071321) is a 32-year-old female living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has three school-aged children.

Hòa owns and operates a manufacturing business, primarily manufacturing and selling bamboo products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2007, Hòa joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating her business.

Hòa is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. The loan will be her 3rd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Y. Nguyễn Thị (1824071468) is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has three school-aged children.

Y. owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling rice products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2007, Y. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

Y. is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. The loan will be her 3rd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
N. Nguyễn Thị (1803070686) is a 55-year-old woman living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has 6 adult children. To making a living, N. owns & operates a restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. N. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $112) a month from these activities.

In 2007, N. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000,000 dong from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. N. is now requesting a new loan of 11,000,000 dong which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food & drinks for her restaurant

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
C. Nguyễn Thị (1824071472) is a 55-year-old female living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has one adult child.

C. owns and operates a business selling home products, primarily selling home furniture to tourists and local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2007, C. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

C. is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 3rd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fama Dieng

texts.fr: fama dieng D. est une femme mariée et a trois enfants en charge;elle fait du commerce de poissons depuis plus de dix ans ;c'est dans le but de satisfaire sa clientèle qu'il sollicite ce pret pour aussi améliorer ses revenus
texts.en:
Fama Dieng D. is a married woman with 3 children. She has been selling fish for more than 10 years. She is asking for this loan to satisfy the needs of her clientele and also to increase her income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling fish

loans.name: Teresa Dominga

texts.es: Doña Teresa tiene 45 años de edad, reside en le barrio La Luz en la capital de Managua, su esposo trabaja en jardinería en un  hotel de la capital Crown plaza, tiene cinco hijos mayores de edad. La señora Teresa trabaja de conserje desde hace ocho años en una empresa privada. Con esta solicitud de crédito quiere hacer un muro en frente de su casa para luego comenzar a hacer las paredes de concreto ya que su humilde casa es de tabla ya muy viaja y necesita remodelarla. Sus planes es seguir mejorando su vivienda para tener una casa digna para su familia. Da las gracias  Afodenic por el beneficio que lograra para tener mejor seguridad en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Doña Teresa is 45 years of age and lives in the La Luz neighborhood of the capital, Managua. Her husband works at gardening for the Crown Plaza Hotel. She has five adult children. Señora Teresa has worked for eight years as a receptionist for a private business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to make a wall in front of her house so she can quickly begin building walls of concrete for her house. Her humble house is made of very old boards and she needs to remodel it. Her plans are to continue fixing up her home in order to have a dignified house for her family. She gives thanks to AFODENIC for the assistance she will receive in order to have better security in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr: moussa N. est un jeune handicapé qui travaille dans une librairie près de la gare routière de thiès;pour diversifier ses revenus,il achète des pièces détachées qu'il revend au détail à ses amis mécaniciens;c'est pour améliorer son activité qu'il sollicite un nouveau crédit
texts.en:
Moussa N. is a young disabled person who works in bookstore near the Thiès bus stop. To diversify his revenues, he buys spare parts that he sells retail to his mechanic friends. He's requesting a new loan to improve his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Leyfou

texts.fr: mr leyfou S. est un homme né en 1946 à khombole qui vit avec sa famille;depuis qu'il est à la retraite il fait de l'aviculture pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants;avec le pret qu'il sollicite il veut renforcer son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
Mr. Leyfou S. is a man who was born in 1946 in Khombole. He lives with this family. Since he retired, he has been raising poultry to provide for his children. With this loan he's requesting, he wants to augment his working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Poultry farming

loans.name: Baye Mor Talla

texts.fr: mr N. est un comptable de profession ;il est marié et est père d'un enfant ,il vit avec sa famille au quartier cité senghor de thiès,il sollicite ce pret pour acheter des meubles pour sa maison
texts.en:
Mr. N. is an accountant by profession. He is married and the father of one child. He lives with his family in the Cité Senghor district of Thiès. He's requesting this loan to buy furniture for his house.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Furnishings

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 39 años, es una madre soltera muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia con su única hija, Karina de 14 años, y desea mejorar la vida que actualmente lleva. Se dedica a la venta de celulares en una tienda ubicada en una de las calles más céntricas de la ciudad de Juliaca, su negocio es muy concurrido, ya que siempre trata muy bien a sus clientes y los recibe con una sonrisa en los labios. A Juana le gusta mucho vender y conversar con las personas, ya que así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas laborales. Lleva 5 años en esta actividad y anhela que su negocio crezca y genere mejores ingresos, considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y está dispuesta a poner todo de su parte para salir adelante. Este es el primer préstamo de Juana con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre bromea con sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más celulares para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende.
texts.en:
Juana, 39 years old, is a hard-working single mother. She lives in her own home with her only daughter, fourteen-year-old Karina. Juana wants to improve her standard of living. She sells cell phones in a store located on one of the streets close to the center of the city of Juliaca. Her business is very popular. She always treats her customers very well and greets them with a smile. Juana enjoys very much selling and talking with people, and her enjoyment makes her long work days more pleasant. She has done this work for five years and longs to increase business and earn a higher income. The most difficult part of her work is staying inside the store the entire day, but she knows that all-day attendance is required, and she will do whatever is required to succeed. This is Juana's first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She knows she must make her payments on time. At her local bank, she is very cheerful and always jokes with employees and other customers. With the $350 requested, she will buy more cell phones to increase her sales volume.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es una mujer muy sincera y honesta, tiene 40 años, vive junto a su única hija Karla de 23 años en su casa propia, y lo que más desea es mejorar su vida. Pasa sus días vendiendo productos de belleza en las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, va puerta por puerta ofreciendo sus productos, es una persona muy alegre y conversadora, por lo cual sus clientes la prefieren. Maria disfruta mucho de aconsejar sobre qué crema, perfume, etc., le quedará mejor a la persona. Lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es que después de cada día de ventas termina muy sucia y cansada debido a las largas caminatas. Para un futuro cercano desea tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos de belleza y otros artículos, para así mejorar su calidad de vida y darle a su hija un mejor futuro. Este el quinto préstamo de Maria con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más cosméticos, para así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Maria is a sincere and honest woman. She is forty, and she lives in her own house with her only daughter, Karla, who is twenty three. What she wants more than anything is to improve her life. She spends her day selling beauty products on the streets of the city of Juliaca. She goes door to door offering her products. She is a happy, chatty person; her customers prefer doing business with her. Maria really enjoys advising which cream, perfume, etc. will go well with a customer. She has been doing this for four years. What she likes the least is at the end of every day of selling, she is very dirty and tired because of the amount of walking she does. In the near future she would like to have a store where she could sell her beauty products and other things. This would improve her quality of life and give her daughter a better future. This is Maria’s fifth loan with MFP. She is prepared to make all of her payments on time. She does not want to cause problems for her community bank, where she is loved by the rest of her colleagues. She will use the 1,000 PEN to buy cosmetics. She will then be able to offer her customers a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, a sus 35 años ha tenido que pasar por muchos sacrificios para mantener a sus 3 hijos; Yuseling de 14, Arturo de 12 y Fernando de 3 años, vive en su casa propia y desea mejorar su vida. A lo largo de su vida ha trabajado mucho para brindarle a su familia las comodidades necesarias, actualmente está en el negocio de la venta de comida, vende salchipollo (comida rápida hecha con salchichas y pollo frito) por las noches en el mercado Santa Bárbara (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), al cual concurren todos sus clientes en busca de algo sabroso para comer. A Marina le gusta mucho trabajar con comida, aunque siempre le es difícil y le demora preparar todo lo necesario para la noche. Ya lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y espera que en el futuro su negocio crezca y pueda tener un restaurante, de esa manera mejorará sus ingresos y le dará una vida más digna a su familia. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y tiene mucha confianza en que podrá pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy tranquila y disfruta de trabajar en equipo con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para preparar una mayor cantidad de salchipollos y así incrementar sus ventas diarias.
texts.en:
Marina, 35, has made many sacrifices to support her three children; Yuseling, 14; Arturo, 12; and Fernando, 3. She lives in her own house, and she wants to improve her life. She has worked hard throughout her life to give her family the necessary comforts. She currently sells food. In the evenings she sells “salchipollo” (fast food made from sausages and fried chicken) in the Santa Bárbara market (important market in the city of Juliaca). The business is popular with her customers who are looking for something delicious to eat. Marina really likes working with food, even though it is always difficult and time consuming preparing everything for the evening. She has been doing this for twenty years. She hopes that in the future her business grows, and she will be able to have a restaurant. That way she will improve her income and give a more decent life to her family. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She has a lot of confidence that she will be able to make her payments on time. In her community bank she is secure, and she enjoys working as a team with her colleagues. With a loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy more ingredients to prepare a greater quantity of salchipollos. This will increase her daily sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for her “salchipollo” (fast food made from sausages and fried chicken)

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth, de 26 años, es una joven muy alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes desea ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Se dedica a la venta de gas, actividad que le ha servido de mucho para poder solventar algunos de los gastos de su familia y brindarles ciertas comodidades. Su mercadería, los balones de gas, los compra en el país de Bolivia y posteriormente los trae a vender hasta Juliaca. Lleva 9 años en este negocio y lo que más le gusta es vender, por otro lado, lo que no le gusta, es tener que cargar los pesados balones, aun así ella sigue adelante en espera de mejorar su vida. Para un futuro cercano, anhela tener una tienda donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad y comodidad, ya que actualmente lo realiza de forma ambulante. Este es el cuarto préstamo de Ruth con MFP y tiene muchas ganas de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es muy querida, puesto que pone el toque de alegría en las reuniones. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados incrementará la cantidad de balones de gas que vende y así mejorará sus ingresos económicos mensuales.
texts.en:
Ruth, 26, is a happy young woman who lives in her parents’ house. She wants to help them with the household expenses. She sells gas. This business has helped her a lot in paying some of the family expenses and bringing them some comforts. She buys her merchandise, gas tanks, in Bolivia. She later takes them to sell in Juliaca. She has been in this business for nine years. What she likes most is selling. On the other hand, what she does not like is having to carry the heavy tanks. Nevertheless, she goes on in the hope of improving her life. She longs to have a store where she could sell with more tranquility and comfort. She currently sells on foot. This is Ruth’s fourth loan with MFP. She has a great desire to make her payments on time. She is much loved in her community bank because she puts a touch of joy in the meetings. She will use the 3,000 PEN to increase the number of gas tanks that she sells. This way she will improve her monthly income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es: Yeny es una mujer muy admirada por sus vecinos, a sus 22 años ya tiene un negocio propio, vive en la casa de sus padres y desea mejorar la vida que actualmente lleva. Esta muchacha siempre ha luchado por tener una vida mejor, actualmente cuenta con un pequeño puesto donde vende quesos en el mercado Las Mercedes (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), es una vendedora muy alegre y carismática que siempre recibe con una sonrisa a sus clientes. Nos comenta que lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender, y lo que no le agrada es que tiene que hacerlo en un espacio muy reducido. Por ello, para un futuro cercano, Yeny quiere tener un puesto más grande, donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y vender sus quesos con mayor tranquilidad. Lleva 5 años en este negocio y hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien, una de las cosas más importantes para ella, es atender muy bien a sus clientes, ya que sabe que de ellos depende el éxito de su negocio. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es muy querida por sus compañeras, ya que es muy alegre. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más quesos para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Yeny is a woman who is very admired by her neighbors. At 22 years of age, she has her own business. She lives in her parents’ house, and she wants to improve her life. She has always fought to have a better life. She currently has a small stand in the Las Mercedes market (important market in the city of Juliaca). She is a happy and charismatic sales person who always greets her customers with a smile. What she likes best about her work is selling. What she does not appreciate is having to do so in a very small space. Yeny would like to have a larger stand where she could better tend to her customers and sell her cheeses more peacefully. She has been in this business for five years, and it is going very well for her. One of the most important things to her is paying very good attention to her customers. She knows that the success of her business depends upon them. This is her third loan with MFP. She has always been punctual with her payments, and she expects to do the same with this loan as well. She is well-regarded by her colleagues; she is very happy. She will use the 2,000 PEN to buy more cheese to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 23 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres junto a su esposo José de 31 años y sus tres hijos; Víctor de 10, Yenifer de 6 y José de 2 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Durante toda su vida ha trabajado mucho para salir adelante, actualmente tiene una tienda en su barrio donde vende zapatos, la cual es muy visitada por sus clientes, ya que ella es muy alegre y siempre los atiende muy bien. A Yolanda le gusta mucho conversar con sus clientes e informarse sobre las cosas que suceden en su barrio, considera que lo que no le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda y soportar el frió que hace, ya que su trabajo le exige quedarse tiempo completo y no puede salir a distraerse en algún momento. Lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y anhela que su tienda se convierta en una de las más conocidas de Juliaca, pero sabe que tiene que trabajar duro para lograrlo.
