Este el quinto préstamo de Yolanda con MFP, se siente muy feliz de la oportunidad brindada, y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es una muy querida por sus compañeras debido a la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más zapatos para implementar mejor su tienda y así ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Twenty-three-year-old Yolanda is a woman very unassuming and cheerful. She lives with her husband José, who is 31 years old, and their three children in a house that they inherited from her parents. Their children, the reason for all their efforts, are ten-year-old Victor, six-year-old Yenifer, and two-year-old José. All her life Yolanda has worked hard to succeed. She has a shoe store in her neighborhood, which is very popular with her customers. She serves her customers attentively and is cheerful in the store. She very much enjoys conversing with customers and being informed of neighborhood news. She does not, however, enjoy spending the entire day in the store and enduring the cold temperature. Of course, her work demands that she be present all day and not leave for even a few minutes. She has done this work for five years and yearns for her store to become one of the best-known in Juliaca, but she knows that she must work hard to achieve this. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma; she feels happy to be given this opportunity and agrees to make all her payments on time. At her community bank, she is very well-liked because of the responsibility she demonstrates. With the $1,000 requested, she will buy more shoes to improve her store and offer greater variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
la sra. Maria C. tiene 50 años de edad, ella esta casada con el sr. Luis Garay quien se dedica a la agricultura, Maria tiene 3 hijos de los cuales uno de ellos vive en España, otro en USA y el otro en Honduras. ellos le mandan dinero para ayudarle economicamente.
Maria se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia que esta ubicada en el barrio Maria Auxiliadora de la ciudad de Nacaome, uno de los productos que mas se vende en esta zona son los productos helados debido a la intensa calor en que viven en esta ciudad, cabe mensionar que Nacaome es el Lugar mas caliente de toda Honduras.
ella necesita el credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener una buena tienda y cumplir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria C. is 50 years old. She is married to Mr. Luis Garay, who is a farmer. Of Maria's three children, one lives in Spain, one in the United States, and the third in Honduras. Her children send her money to help her economically. Maria sells products that are used daily in her local store that is located in the Maria Auxiliadora neighborhood in the city of Nacaome. Very popular are ice-cold products, due to the intense heat in which the residents of the city live. It is appropriate to add that Nacaome is the hottest place in all of Honduras. Maria needs a loan to purchase more merchandise and therefore have a good store and meet all the needs of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of popsicles, ice cream cones, ice cream, strips of fried dough, soft drinks, water in cartons and bottles, soup, rice, sugar, beans, bread, cookies, sweets, salsas, pastas, toilet paper

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba W. est une femme de 41 ans, mère de 7 enfants. Elle fait de la vente en gros d'arachide. ses revenus lui permettent d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Coumba W. is a 41-year-old woman and the mother of seven children. She sells peanuts wholesale. Her revenues enable her to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell peanuts in bulk

loans.name: Milagro Jamileth

texts.es:
la sra Milagro R. tiene 38 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estan estudiando en el colegio de esta comunidad. 
ella se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace varios años, ha logrado obtener bastantes clientes.
estos son los platos que ella mas vende todos los dias: pollo frito, paella, pescado frito, carne asada, chuletas fritas.
su mayor sueño es que sus hijos obtengan un titulo universitario y que tengan mejor vida.
actualmente ella necesita el credito para comprar mas productos para fabricar sus comidas, en estos momentos ella esta teniendo mucha demanda y no se da abasto para cumplir con todas las necesidades de todos los clientes. por tal razon es que esta solicitando el credito.
texts.en:
Milgro R., 38, has two children who attend the community school. She has been making and selling food for several years. She has obtained lots of customers. The dishes she sells most every day are: fried chicken, paella, fried fish, grilled meat, and fried chops. Her biggest dream is for her children to get a college degree and that they have a better life. She currently needs a loan to buy more products to make her food. There is currently a big demand, and she does not have the supply to meet the needs of all of her customers. That is why she is asking for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, rice, vegetables, beans, shortening, oil, salt, spices, chicken, bread, disposable plates and cups, soft drinks, juice, eggs, ham, milk products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Señor De Accha Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “SEÑOR DE ACCHA”, están situados en el distrito de Pisac, perteneciente al valle sagrado de los inkas, ubicado a 1 hora desde la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestros socios alternan sus actividades del hogar con la artesanía, en su mayoría ellos elaboran la artesanía manualmente y llevan a cocerlos en los hornos industriales de algunos amigos, 2 socias se dedican ala venta de comidas y tortas en el paradero principal, los socios requieren el préstamo en razón de poder invertir en la compra de más insumos y hornos industriales para continuar con esta labor que llevan de generación en generación, en el caso de las otras socias ellas desean invertir en su hogar en algunos muebles.

Los socios se muestran muy agradecidos con el préstamo otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago total de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the banking coop "Señor de Accha" live in the district of Pisac, which is located in the Sacred Valley of the Incas, about one hour from Cusco. Our members make native food to sell while working at home. The majority of them make the food at home and then bring it to the commercial ovens of friends to be cooked. The principal job of two of the members is to sell the food and cakes at the main bus stop. In order to insure their business is sustained from generation to generation, the members would like a loan in order to buy more supplies and a commercial oven. Some of the women would like to invest in some furniture for their homes. The members are very appreciative of the money for the loan and they promise to pay all of the debts to which they have committed.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in supplies in order to further develop business

loans.name: Maria Angelina

texts.es:
la Sra. Maria Angelina G. tiene 59 años de edad, esta casada y tienen 5 hijos de los cuales 3 de ellos dependen de ella y estan en el colegio.
ella tiene una pequeña pulperia y su fuerte es la venta de golosinas como ser tacos, enchiladas, tortillas con quesillo, burritas, baledas y refrescos.
el negocio de las golosinas le deja muy buena ganancia y con esas ganancias le esta invirtiendo dinero a la pulperia, porque ella desea tener una pulperia grande y que a la par tenga su negocio de golosinas. su meta en un futuro es tener un supermercado.
ella necesita el credito para poder salir adelante con sus negocios, nos comento que esta muy feliz ya que siente que todo le esta saliendo muy bien y que de ahora en adelante todo sera mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Angelina G. is 59 years old and married. She has five children, three of whom are still in school and depend on her financially. Maria has a small store and she also sells foods like tacos, enchiladas, tortillas with cheese, burritos, baleadas, and soft drinks. The food sales provide good earnings and Maria is using them to invest in her store. She'd like to have a large store and combined with the food sales business, build it into a supermarket. Maria needs a loan to get ahead with her businesses. She tells us that she's very happy because she feels like business is good and now that she is ahead everything will be much better.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ground beef, pork, and chicken, tomato salsas, cabbage tortillas, butter, oil, salt, cheese, and soft drinks

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata K. est âgée de 54 ans, veuve et mère de 5 enfants. Elle fait de la couture et vends des draps et des habits. Elle aimerait avec ce prêt augmenter ses revenus pour mieux subvenir aux charges familiales dont elle fait face.
texts.en:
Fatoumata K., age 43, is a widow and the mother of five children. She is a seamstress and sells bed sheets and clothing. She would like to use this loan to increase her revenues to cover the family expenses which she is facing.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sew bed sheets and clothing to sell

loans.name: Romulo

texts.es:
el señor Romulo M. A. tiene 45 años de edad,  esta casado con la señora Silvia Posada quienes viven en la aldea el Jocote a un kilometro de la fuerza naval de Honduras. Tienen una hija de seis años de edad y esta en la escuela.
 
don Romulo y doña Silvia trabajan juntos, se dedican a la venta de mariscos y tambien tienen una pulperia, los mariscos los vende en el amatillo, nacaome, langue. Los transportan en autobus.
 
Romulo necesita el prestamo para cubrir varios pedidos de camaron, pescado ya que con el dinero que dispone no cubre con todos los costos de la mercaderia a comprar.
 
su mayor sueño es comprar un carro para transportar los productos ya que la distancia donde compran la mercaderia esta muy largo.
texts.en:
Mr. Romulo M. A. is 45 years old and married to Mrs. Silvia Posada. They live in the village of Jocote, about one kilometer away from the Honduras Navy base. They have a daughter who is six years old and in school. Romulo and Silvia work together selling seafood, which they transport on a bus to amatillo, nacome, and langue. They also have a small store. Romulo needs a loan to cover various orders of shrimp and fish. His current cash supply can't cover all the costs of buying merchandise. His dream is to buy a car to transport his products, as the distance to the market is very long.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shrimp and fish

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mervedi Plus Group

texts.fr: Marie K. Mamu est membre d’un des groupes de Hope RDC qu’elle a intégré en décembre 2008 dans le but de renforcer son activité en vue de réaliser son rêve d’ouvrir un jour une boutique générale. Elle vend des beignets depuis 2001 dans un quartier périphérique de Kinshasa. Ses clients fidèles sont principalement des enfants et adolescents. Son capital initial en 2001 était de $1 qu’elle a multiplié grâce aux efforts fournis, une bonne gestion et des bénéfices accumulés qui lui ont procuré un capital de $90 en 2003. De 2003 – 2008, Marie a encore beaucoup travaillé pour atteindre un fonds propre de $180 avant de commencer à recevoir les crédits de Hope qu’elle a totalement remboursés. Vue le nombre croissant de ses clients, Marie a utilisé le crédit obtenu en mai dernier pour acheter 1 sac de farine de froment, 1 bidon de 25 litres d’huile végétale, 1 sac du sucre et 1 boite de levure en vue de satisfaire la demande et d’accroitre aussi le bénéfice de son affaire. Elle a 36 ans, mariée et mère d’un fils étudiant âgé de 20 ans. Marie est très fière de son activité et est déterminée à atteindre son objectif.
texts.en:
Marie K. Mamu is a member of a HOPE RDC group that she joined in December 2008 with the goal of bolster her business. One day she hopes to realize her dream of opening a general store. She has been selling beignets since 2001 in an outlying district of Kinshasa. Her loyal customers are mainly children and adolescents. In 2001, her initial capital was $1, which she multiplied through her efforts, correct management, and accumulated profits, all of which gained her $90 in capital in 2003. From 2003-2008, Marie still worked a lot to attain $180 in capital. She then started to receive loans from HOPE that she repaid completely. Given the growing number of customers she has, Marie used the loans obtained last May for buying: a sack of wheat flour, a 25-liter drum of vegetable oil, a sack of sugar, and a container of leavening in order to satisfy the demand and also to grow her profits. Marie is 36 years old, married, and the mother of son, age 20, who is a student. She is very proud of her business and is determined to achieve her dream.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sack of flour, a drum of vegetable oil, a sack of sugar, and some leavening to make more beignets

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Fatoumata Thièmoko

texts.fr:
Fatoumata Thiémoko T. est une dame divorcée de 51 ans, avec 10 enfants en charge.
Elle fait un commerce de légumes au marché où elle tient un étal. Elle souhaiterait renforcer cette activité pour mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Thiémoko T. is a divorced woman, 51 years old, with ten children in her care. She does commerce in vegetables at the market where she has a stall. She would like to bolster this business to provide for her family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in vegetables

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama K. est une femme de 50 ans, veuve avec 6 enfants en charge. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour s’activer dans la vente d’huile de palme et de divers produits alimentaires. Elle souhaiterait améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariama K. is a 50-year-old woman, a widow, with six children in her care. She's requesting this loan to become active in selling palm oil and various food items. She would like to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell palm oil and various foods

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Su nombre es  ELSA S., su actividad prinicipal es  el comercio, cuenta con una pulperia que esta  ubicada en su casa de habitacion, es casada, tiene 2 hijos los que estan ya casados,  gracias a este negocio ella puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar,  ellos tienen un nieto que vive con ellos y cuidan de el, actualmente el niño esta cursando el 2do grado de educacion primaria, ella se siente muy contenta con este negocio ya que con estos ingresos ha
mejorado su vivienda, actualmente ella quiere surtir un poco mas su negocio y no cuenta con el capital suficiente para satisfacer la demanda de sus cliente, por tal razon es que esta solicitando el credito.
texts.en:
Elsa S.’s business is a mini market, which is located in her house. She is married and has two married children. Thanks to this business, she can help her husband with the household expenses. They have a grandson who they take care of; he lives with them. He is currently in the second grade of elementary school. She is very happy with the business because with the income from the store she has improved her house. She currently wants to stock her store a bit more. She does not have sufficient capital to satisfy the customer demand. That is why she is asking for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, coffee, shortening, eggs, milk, bread, crackers, soft drinks, juices, churros, soap, soup, salsas, pasta

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sumacclla Llamkasum Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Sumacclla Llamkasum está ubicado en el Departamento D. Huancavelica, los habitantes D. la Comunidad D. Huancavelica se dedican  al Comercio y otros poco a la Agricultura y Ganadería fuera D. la ciudad.

Raquel es casada tiene 10 hijos, se dedica a la confección y venta D. ropas, mandiles y frazadas, Raquel inició su negocio desD. que recibió los prestamos D. FINCA Perú, así fue incrementando sus ventas, solicita un préstamo D. 1000 soles para la compra D. materiales D. confección D. mandiles. Su sueño es abrir una distribuidora, le gusta ahorrar pues sabe que tendrá un dinerito extra en caso D. alguna emergencia.

Susan es casada, tiene 3 hijos D. 22, 17 y 9 años, se dedica a la venta D. verduras en un puesto en el mercado modelo D. la ciudad, pero ahora se dedica a la venta D. carne junto a su esposo. Solicita un préstamo D. 600 soles para la compra D. ganados, su sueño es tener un puesto en el mercado asi tendría un lugar fijo para la venta.

Victoria es viuda, tiene 4 hijos D. 21, 18, 16y 12 años, se dedica a la venta D. verduras, tiene que salir fuera D. la ciudad para comprar las verduras al por mayor. Solicita un préstamo D. 500 soles que utilizará en la compra D. verduras por costales, así poder cumplir su sueño D. tener su puesto con mucha mercadería.
texts.en:
The Sumacclla Llamkasum Community Bank is located in the Huancavelica department. The inhabitants of the Huancavelica community work in commerce. A few others work in agriculture and farming outsiD. of the city. Raquel is married and has ten children. She makes and sells clothes, aprons, and blankets. Raquel started this business when she received loans from Finca Perú. Her sales have been increasing. She is asking for a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy materials to make aprons. Her dream is to become a distributor. She likes to save because she knows she will have a little extra money in case of an emergency. Susan is married. She has three children ages 22, 17, and 9. She sold vegetables in the city’s Mercado Modelo (market). She now sells meat together with her husband. She is asking for a loan for 600 PEN to buy livestock. Her dream is to have a stand in the market. Then she would have a fixed place to make her sales. Victoria is a widow. She has four children ages 21, 18, 16, and 12. She sells vegetables. She needs to go outsiD. the city to buy vegetables wholesale. She is asking for a loan for 500 PEN to buy bags of vegetables. That way she could make her dream, having her stand stocked with lots of merchandise, come true.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for their businesses

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
Los señores antes mensionados son  integrantes del grupo  "GENESIS" ubicado en la Comunidad  de la Redonda El Aguila Jamastran de la ciudad de Danli, ellos se conocen muy bien, siempre han trabajado juntos y gracias a este credito que estan solicitando podran seguir mejorando sus negocios y por consiguiente sus condiciones de vida 

a continuacion se detalla las actividades de cada uno:

SANTOS CRISTINA L. R.
desde hace 6 años atras ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, venta de repuestos de bicicletas y molino para maiz.
estos negocios le generan ingresos para suplir las necesidades personales y de su hija, de esta manera le es de gran apoyo a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganaderia siendo estos dos rubros  los que impulsan el desarrollo de la comunidad.
 
NOHEMIU DSEL CARMEN R.   
ella tiene mas de 2 años de vender cosmeticos, ahora ha ido adquiriendo experiencia en el manejo del negocio,  compra mas productos y obtiene mejores ganancias las que le ayudan a mejorar las  condiciones de su vida y la de su familia.

SANTOS JULIAN LOPES R.  
el tiene mas de 5 años de dedicarse al comercio, su actividad es la compra y venta de maiz y frijoles, esta actividad la realiza de forma ambulante y domiciliar esta soltero y en lo poco que puede ayuda a sus padres, es un joven admirado en la comunidad por su espiritu de superacion y buena conducta moral.
el necesita invertir en su negocio para obtener mayores ventas mejores ganancias

KAREN YESSENIA O. 
ella tiene 1 año de dedicarse al comercio ella compra y vende ropa nueva americana y tambien calzado,  es madre soltera tiene una hija de un año.  sus ventas las realiza de contado y credito 
de manera domiciliar y ambulante, Ella desea invertir mas en su negocio ya que tiene la clientela y muchas de las veces tiene que ir y venir otra vez a la ciudad a comprar mas mercaderia y esto le incrementa los gastos de tranporte.
texts.en:
The people listed are members of the Genesis group, which is located in the Redonda El Aguila Jamastran community in the city of Danli. They know each other very well. They have always worked together. Thanks to this loan that they are asking for, they will be able to improve their businesses and, in turn, their life conditions. Details of the businesses are as follows: Santos Cristina L. R. For six years she has been selling popular consumer products, bicycle replacement parts, and she has a mill to grind corn. These businesses have generated income to cover the personal necessities for her and her daughter. This helps her husband with the household expenses. Her husband works in agriculture and is a farmer. Agriculture and farming drive the development of the community. Nohemiu del Carmen R. She has been selling cosmetics for over two years. She has now gained experience in managing the business. She buys more products and gets better earnings, which help improve living conditions for her and her family. Santo Julian L. R. For over five years he has been buying and selling corn and beans. He does this on foot, going to customers and their households. He is single, and he helps his parents the little that he can. The community admires him for his spirit of self-improvement and his fine, moral behavior. He needs to invest in his business to make greater sales and improved earnings. Karen Yessenia O. She has been buying and selling new American clothes and footwear for one year. She is a single mother, and she has a one year old daughter. She makes her sales for cash and on credit. She sells on foot, going to customers and their households. She wants to invest more in her business. She now has customers. Many times she goes to the city and then has to return back again to buy more merchandise. That increases her transportation expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans, corn, bicyle parts, cosmetics, new clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jairo Rufino

texts.es:
el sr. Jairo F. cuenta con una pulperia que opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia F., el tiene mas de 2 años de dedicarse a su negocio, durante todo este tiempo le ha ido muy bien, el esta casado y tiene dos hijos, a los que les brinda educacion, vestimenta y salud. el es un padre muy responsable y siempre ha pensado en el bienestar y aseguarar el futuro de su familia, a la vez tambien trabaja en UNIMER que es una empresa de distribucion de mercaderia al por mayor, el negocio por las mañanas cuando el anda trabajando lo atiende su esposa y luego en las tardes y noches lo atiende el personalmente.
el esta solicitando el credito para surtir mas su negocio, asi poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jairo F. has a mini market called Pulpería F.. He has had this business for over two years. During all this time it has gone very well. He is married and has two children. He gives them an education, clothing, and takes care of their health. He is a very responsible father. He has always thought of their well being and securing a good future for his family. He also works in UNIMER, which is a business that distributes wholesale merchandise. His wife takes care of the mini market in the mornings when he is working. Then, he takes care of it in the afternoons and evenings. He is asking for a loan to better stock his store and get better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, beans, tortillas, shortening, margarine, bread, crackers, soup, pasta, milk products, cold cuts, chicken

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Wilberto

texts.es:
el sr. Wilberto L. cuenta con una pequeña granja avicola, su negocio se llama POLLO WILLY, tiene mas de 1 año de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, durante este tiempo le ha ido muy bien, porque la carne de pollo es un alimento basico en la dieta familiar de esta comunidad ya que es un producto saludable, de facil preparacion y mucho mas comodo que la carde de res y cerdo, por eso es que el pollo es muy vendido en restaurantes y varios lugares en donde venden comidas. el pollo tiene mucha demanda en la compra para consumo diario.
el esta solicitando un credito para lograr un crecimiento en su granja, el es una persona muy emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superacion y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Wilberto L. has a small poultry farm named Pollo Willy. He has been in this business for over one year. Things have gone very well because chicken is a basic food for the families in this community. It is a healthy product, easy to prepare, and much easier to raise than beef and pork. That is why chicken is sold a lot in restaurants and various places where they sell food. There is much demand to buy chicken for daily consumption. He is asking for a loan to expand his farm. He is a very enterprising person with a great desire to improve for the well being of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy small chickens and concentrated food for them

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es:
la sra Carmen L. tiene 37 años de edad, esta casada con el sr. Porfirio Hernandez quien compra y vende ganado, ellos tiene 2 hijos de los cuales estan estudiando. 
ella tiene su negogio de pulperia en donde vende productos de la canasta basica, tiene 4 años de tener su negocio, muchos clientes van a comprar a su pulperia debido a la buena antecion que ofrece a la clientela.
su mayor sueño es tener un supermercado para ofrecerle toda clases de productos y que las personas que lo visiten puedan hacer todas sus compras sin tener que buscar otro lado para comprar.
texts.en:
Señora Carmen L. is 37 years of age and married to Señor Porfirio Hernández who buy and sells livestock. They have two children who are in school. She has had a grocery store for four years now where she sells staple grocery items. Many customers shop there because of the good service she provides them. Her greatest dream is to have a supermarket offering all kinds of products, where the people visiting it would be able to do all their shopping without having to look anywhere else.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, suar, coffee, bread, cookies, soups, lard, milk products, margarine, milk, meat, drinks, water, noodles.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jesús Es Mi Ayudador Group

texts.es:
el grupo Jesus es mi Ayudador esta integrado por tres personas que se conocen desde hace varios años, ya que ellos reciden en la misma colonia por muchos años.
las actividades que ellos realizan se detallan a continuacion:
la sra. Lucia E. tiene 38 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 1 hija, la cual esta estudiando su segundo año de carrera.
Lucia tiene una pulperia en la colonia brisas del sur y ha logrado obtener una muy buena clientela debido a la atencion que presta a cada persona que llega a comprar a su negocio, es una persona emprendedora y desde muy joven le ha gustado el negocio.
su mayor sueño es tener un super mercadito y que su hija tenga un titulo universitario.
la sra. Maria I. tiene 64 años de edad, esta casada y tuvo 11 hijos de los cuales solo uno esta con ella ya que los demas estan casados.
ella tiene una pulperia desde hace 3 años, con la cual a podido dar el estudio a su ultima hija, ella nos comento que sus hijos le ayudan economicamente y que esta solicitando el credito para surtir su negocio, su mayor sueño es que su hija se gradue de la universidad.
el sr.Enyel C. tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su familia, el se dedica a la venta de zapatos y sandalias, tiene 1 año de realizar esta actividad, el vende su producto en el mercado y en diferentes colonias de esta ciudad.
todos ellos necesitan el credito para salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Jesús es mi Ayudador (Jesus is my Helper) Loan Group is composed of three people who have known one another for several years since they have lived in the same area for many years. The activities that they are engaged in are as follows: Señora Lucía E. is 38 years old, married and has one daughter who is in her second year of career studies. Lucía has a grocery store in the Brisas del Sur (Southern Breezes) neighborhood and has succeeded in acquiring a very good clientele because of the service she gives to everyone who comes to shop in her store. She is an enterprising person and has enjoyed business since she was young. Her greatest dream is to have a super market and that her daughter will obtain a university degree. Señora María I. is 64 years of age, married and has had eleven children, only one of whom is still with her and the rest are married. She has had a grocery store for three years now with which she has been able to educate her last daughter. She tells us that her children are helping her economically and that she is requesting the loan in order to stock up her business. Her greatest dream is that her daughter will graduate from the university. Señor Enyel C. is 20 years old, single and lives with his family. He sells shoes and sandals and he's been doing this for one year. He sells his products in the market and in different neighborhoods in the city. All of these people need the loan in order to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, sugar, bread, coffee, chicken, beef, pork,  bleach, bath soap, laundry soap, shoes and sandals.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Progreso E Group

texts.es: El grupo “Progreso E”  se encuentran representados por la señora Benedicta Rosa y conformado por 12 miembros que en su mayoría se dedican a diferentes actividades como la venta D. abarrotes en tienda D. barrio, venta D. cosméticos por catálogos, venta D. verdura, desayuno, ropa y ala atención en farmacias. Un porcentaje considerable tiene puesto fijo y la otra parte son ambulantes por lo que la competencia se incrementa en el mercado pero todas saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas D. salir adelantes. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas que coadyuven en el crecimiento D. sus negocios y al mejoramiento D. la calida D. vida D. sus familias. A pesar D. ser un grupo nuevo cuentan con experiencia en créditos solidarios por lo que saben administrar bien los fondos otorgados.
texts.en:
The group "Progress E" is represented by Benedicta Rosa and consists of 12 members, who are dedicated to different activities such as the sale of groceries in neighbourhood supermarkets, the sale of cosmetics by catalogue, sale of vegetables, breakfast, clothes, and pharmacy attendants. A considerable percentage have permanent stalls, and the others are door to door who, even because of the competition increasing in the market, know how to move forward thanks to their experience and desire to move forward. The destiny of this finance is for the purchase of grocery items, consumables and tools that help in the growth of their businesses and go to the improvement of the quality of life of their families. In spite of being a new group, they are experienced with loans because of their knowledge of administering well the funds granted to them.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Flor De Coca Group

texts.es: El grupo denominado “Flor D. Coca” esta conformado por doce socias que en su mayoría radican en la zona las delicias por  la ciudad D. El Alto, se encuentran representados por el señor Faustino. El grupo esta conformado en su mayoría por socias que se dedican a la venta D. Cd´s, carne, lana, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, zapatos y realizan trabajos como dependientes. Las socias tienen un mercado altamente competitivo pero no les preocupa ya que cuentan con un gran apoyo económico para salir adelante como lo han demostrado en sus anteriores ciclos, a pesar D. ello requieren el financiamiento actual para agrandar sus pequeños negocios y brindarles una mejor calida D. vida a su familias.
texts.en:
The group called 'Flor D. Coca' is maD. up of 12 associates, the majority of whom are settle in the delightful zone of the city of El Alto, is represented by señor Faustino. The group is mainly maD. up of associates who sell cds, meat, wool, groceries in neighbour supermarkets, shoes, and who do work as shop assistants. The associates have a highly competitive market but this doesn't worry them as they now count on great economic support to move forward, as they have demonstrated in their previous cycles, apart from that they require the current finance to extend their small businesses and allow them to offer a better quality of life to their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Cette femme habite le quartier de kégué qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, elle est célibataire. Pour satisfaire ses propres besoins, elle a commencé en 2006 le commerce de produits cosmétiques. Elle s’approvisionne au marché local d’adalawato. Elle réalise de bonnes recettes, ceci est du à l’emplacement géographique de son activité. Vu la manière dont grandit sa clientèle, elle voudrait agrandir sa clientèle, elle sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 8 cartons de lait « Coco butter », 4 cartons de savons « fitso », 5 cartons de perruques, 3 Cartons de mèches tissages et divers produits de beauté.
texts.en:
This is a woman who lives in Kégué, an outlying district of the city of Lomé. She is unmarried. To support herself, she started doing commerce in cosmetics in 2006. She supplies herself at the local marketplace of Adalawato. She makes a good income due to the location of her business. Given the way her customer base is growing, she would like to expand her business. She's therefore requesting a loan from WAGES to buy eight boxes of Coco Butter milk, four boxes of Fitso soaps, five boxes of wigs, three boxes of woven hair extensions, and various beauty products.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of milk, soaps, wigs, and hair extensions

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce depuis 2005 comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente des objets plastiques. Son ancienneté dans ce commerce a fait qu’elle a une bonne maîtrise de son activité. Ses clients lui font confiance. Actuellement elle est en rupture de stock, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter des plastiques et divers.
texts.en:
Since 2006, this woman has been selling plasticware. Her seniority in this business ensures that she masters it. Her clients trust her. At this time, she's out of stock and want to resupply. She's therefore seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy plasticware and other various items.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plasticware and other various items

loans.name: N'djokoun

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de 04 enfants, cette femme habite avec sa famille le quartier de kégué qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. Elle fait comme commerce la vente de céréales. Pour réaliser une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur son commerce elle  s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays à sotoboua où le bol de maïs est moins coûteux. Elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter , 18 sacs de maïs, 7 sacs d’haricots et divers autres céréales.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of 4 children. She lives with her family in Kégué, an outlying neighborhood of the city of Lomé. Her business consists in selling cereals. In order to get the highest possible gross margin, she gets her supplies in the interior of the country, in Sotoboua, where corn is cheaper. She wants to resupply, and she's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 18 sacks of corn, 7 sacks of bean, and various other cereals.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 18 sacks of corn, 7 sacks of bean, and various other cereals

loans.name: Doté Ata Sé

texts.fr: Célibataire et devant subvenir à ses propres charges, ce monsieur a commencé en 2006 le commerce de chemises, il a associé plus tard à cette activité la vente de cartes de recharges. Il veut attirer plus de clients, par l’achat de nouveaux modèles de chemises, c’est pour cette raison qu’il s’adresse à WAGES pour obtenir son second crédit afin d’acheter des chemises et 2 cartons de cartes de recharges TOGOCELL.
texts.en:
Being single and having to provide for himself, this gentleman started a business selling shirts in 2006 and later added rechargeable cell phone cards to his sales activity. Wanting to attract more customers by selling the latest shirt styles, he has approached WAGES for what will be his second loan, so that he can buy shirts and two boxes of rechargeable Togocell cards.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shirts and rechargeable phonecards

loans.name: 27 De Mayo Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "27 D. Mayo" están representadas por la señora Sonia y conformada por 12 personas que en su mayoría se dedican al servicio D. preparación D. comidas y el resto a la venta D. productos como cosméticos por catálogos, pollos y a la elaboración D. pan casero. Dentro del rubros D. los miembros del grupo existe gran competencia D. oferta D. productos es por esta razón que requieren el crédito para la adquisición D. mercadería, materiales e insumos que ayuden al mejoramiento D. sus ingresos y para bríndales una mejor calidad D.  vida a sus familias. La socias cuenta con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a que trabajaron con instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital la cual les brinda un apoyo económico para sacar adelante sus pequeños negocios.
texts.en:
The associates of the communal bank '27 D. Mayo' are represented by señora Sonia and consist of 12 people, the majority of whom are dedicated to food preparation service, and the rest to the sale of products such as cosmetics by catalogues, chickens, and the production of homemaD. bread. Great competition exists within the areas of the group members' work, it is for this reason that they require the credit, for the acquisition of groceries, materials and consumables that help them with the improvement of their profits and to proviD. them with a better quality of life for their family. The associates are experienced with group loans thanks to those who worked with institutions similar to the foundation Agrocapital, which offers them economic support to move their small businesses forward.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Socios Unidos Group

texts.es: Los miembros del banco comunal "Socios Unidos" esta representado por la señora Guadalupe y conformada por 13 miembros que presentan un parentesco familiar entre la señora Guadalupe y Melina que son hermanas pero con ingresos totalmente independientes. Gran parte D. las socias cuentan con tiendas D. abarrote, ventas D. cosméticos por catálogos, ropa, pan comida y al servicio D. amplificación. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda pero las socias saben como salir adelante ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias. El crédito esta destinado para el aumento D. sus mercaderías y la adquisición D. insumos y herramientas que ayuden a incrementar sus ingreso y mejoren la claridad D. vida D. sus familias como lo han ido haciendo con los anterior financiamientos pues este grupo ya lleva junto tres ciclos demostrando responsabilidad y honestidad en el cumplimiento D. sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank 'Socios Unidos' are represented by señora Guadalupe and maD. up of 13 members that incluD. a family relationship between señora Guadalupe and Melina, who are sisters, but with totally independent earnings. A large number of the members have grocery stores, cosmetic catalogue sales businesse, and sell clothes, bread, food, and other services. Like in all commercial areas there is always competition for supply and demand but the associates know how to prosper, now that supporting their families depends on this. The loan is destined to increase their merchandise and for the acquisition of consumbales and tools that help to increase their earnings and improve the quality of life of their families, like they have been doing with previous finances. This group has had 3 cycles demonstrating responsbility and honesty in the fulfilment of their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: San Silvestre Group

texts.es: El grupo “San Silvestre” esta conformada por 16 miembros representados por el señor Leonidas. Una mayoría D. los miembros del grupo se dedican a la agricultura D. arroz y caña, el resto D. los socios se dedican a la venta D. repuestos, empanadas, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio y al tejido D. chompas D. lana. A pesar D. los altos niveles competitivos los socios creen en la calidad D. sus productos pero necesitan capital para invertir en herramientas D. trabajo y materia prima para incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calida D. vida D. sus familias. El grupo es relativamente nuevo pero cuentan con la experiencia D. créditos anteriores en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital quien les brinda un apoyo económico para crecer y mejorar sus pequeños negocios.
texts.en:
The San Silvestre group is maD. up of sixteen members who are represented by Leonidas. The majority of the group members are farmers who grow rice and sugar cane. The rest of the members sell replacement parts, empanadas, and groceries in neighborhood stores. Some members knit wool sweaters. In spite of the great number of competitors, the members believe in the quality of their products. But, they need capital to invest in work tools and raw materials to increase their income and improve their families’ quality of life. The group is relatively new, but they have experience with previous loan from entities that are similar to the Agrocapital foundation. Agrocapital offers them economic support to expand and improve their small businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Kony Alexander

texts.es: La señora Kony Alexander C., tiene la edad de 27 años, habita en el barrio Dennis Larios, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos, menores de edad, actualmente estudian, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida, doña Kony desde hace 10 años se dedica a la actividad agrícola, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento. Ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres. A trabajar las tierras con el financiamiento va comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder tener una buena cosecha y vender a mejor precio al mercado.
texts.en:
Kony Alexander C. is 27. She lives in the Dennis Larios neighborhood with her husband. He works and helps with the household expenses. They are raising their two minor children who attend school. Their future plans are to improve their living conditions. Kony has been in the agricultural field for ten years. The biggest difficulty is the lack of financing. She started this business with her parents’ help. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and supplies to apply to her crops. She will then be able to have a good harvest and sell at a better price at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and fertilizer to apply to the crops

loans.name: Las Pagadoras Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Pagadoras” esta conformado por 12 integrantes y representados por la señora Verónica. En general los miembros del grupo se dedican a la venta D. cosméticos por catálogos, venta D. comida rápida, D. licores artesanales, al servicio D. limpieza y a la confección D. prendas D. vestir. Dentro del marco competitivo los socios del grupo no tienen mayor problema ya que cuentan con experiencia y años D. trabajo. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. materiales, mercadería insumos y herramientas que ayuden a mejorar a mejor su producto y a incrementar sus ingresos mejorando así la calidad D. vida D. sus familias. El grupo va cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y honestidad en el cumplimiento D. sus obligaciones
texts.en:
Twelve members make up the Las Pagadoras group, which is represented by Verónica. Most of the members sell cosmetics by catalog, sell fast food, sell homemaD. liqueurs, offer cleaning services, or make clothing. The members do not have a big problem with the competitive field because they have years of working experience. The loan is to buy materials, merchandise, supplies, and tools to help them improve their products and increase their income. This, in turn, will improve their families’ quality of life. The group is in its second loan cycle. They demonstrate responsibility and honesty by meeting their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es: El Grupo “Las divinas” es un grupo representado por el señor Carlos y conformado por 12 personas dentro D. las cuales existe un parentesco familiar entre la señora Lizeth y Liliana que son hermanas, pero con actividades económicas independientes, vienen D. familias amplias como lo demuestra la fotografía ya que alguna D. las socias se encuentra con su esposo e hijos pequeños. Dentro D. las actividades que realizan los señores para el ingreso diario esta la venta D. juguetes, cosméticos por catálogos, ropa, comida y abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio. Dentro del marco competitivo las socias tienen una amplio mercado por lo que no les preocupa la competencia. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. insumo y herramientas que coadyuve al incremento D. sus ingresos para poder brindarles a sus familias una mejor calida D. vida. A pesar D. ser un grupo relativamente nuevo ya tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios debido a financiamientos con entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital quien les brinda la confianza y un apoyo económico para mejorar sus ingresos y la calida D. vida D. sus hogares.
texts.en:
The Las Divinas Loan Group is represented by Señor Carlos and consists of twelve people, among whom there exists a family relationship between Señoras Lizeth and Liliana who are sisters but whose finances are separate.They come from large families, as the the photograph shows, since some of the members may be seen with their spouse and small children. Among the activities these members are engaged in for their daily income are: selling juices, cosmetics catalog sales, selling clothing, or prepared food, or selling groceries in neighborhood stores. Within the competitive framework, the members have a large market and so competition does not worry them. The objective of the loan is to buy items of consumption and tools that would help them to increase their incomes in order to be able to proviD. their families with a better quality of life. In spite of being a relatively new group, many members of this group have experience in solidarity group lending through other institutions that are similar to AgroCapital. Their solidarity group experience has helped to give them confidence and also economic help to improve their earnings and in turn the quality of their lives and homes.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: San Pedro Y Pablo Group

texts.es: El Grupo “San pedro y Pablo” se encuentran representado por la señora Yolanda y conformado por 12 miembros  que en su mayoría se dedican al comercio de productos como cosméticos por catálogos, vidrio, ropa, comida y otros se dedican al trasporte público de pasajeros y a la chapería de vehículos. La competencia en el rubro comercial es elevada pero las socias saben como salir adelante como lo han demostrado en su anterior ciclo con la Institución. El destino del nuevo financiamiento es para la adquisición de mercaderías, materiales y herramientas para seguir incrementando sus ingresos y poder brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. Su experiencia en el anterior ciclo les ayudo a tener una mayor capacidad de pago y un apoyo económico para seguir luchando por sacar adelante sus negocios y crecer junto a la fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The "San Pedro y Pablo" Group is represented by Yolanda and is made up of 12 members who, for the most part, are dedicated to selling products such as catalog cosmetics, glass, clothing, and food while others are dedicated to public transportation and car detailing. Competition in the commercial area is high, but the members know how to get ahead, as they demonstrated with their last loan with this institution. This new loan is destined for the acquisition of merchandise, materials and tools so they may continue increasing their income and are able to provide their families a better quality of life. Their experience with the last loan helped them to have a better capacity to pay and economic support to keep fighting to get their businesses ahead and grow along with Agrocapital Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Renacer De Vino Tinto Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal denominado  RENACER DE VINO TINTO, esta conformado por doce socias que en su mayoría radican en la Zona de Vino tinto, de donde surge el nombre del grupo.  Las socias del grupo son en su mayoría costureras y tejedoras de mantas, pero también se dedican a la venta de abarrotes en tiendas de barrio, a la venta de comida y verduras en el mercado. Ellas necesitan el crédito para realizar compras de materia prima, materiales y herramientas tales como telas, hilos y lanas para mejorar sus ingresos. El mercado de las socias es altamente competitivo ya que una mayoría de las personas de la zona se dedican al mismo rubro por lo que necesitan el financiamiento para poder mejorar la calidad de sus productos e incrementar sus ingresos para el mejoramiento de sus hogares. Por el trabajo que se realiza generalmente en casa de las socias dedicándoles más tiempo a sus hijos y a sus familias ya que la entrega de chompas tejidas a mano y prendas de vestir a textileras les dan la opción de mejorar y crecer en sus pequeños negocios. Es un grupo relativamente nuevo por lo que cuentan con poca experiencia crediticia, pero con el entusiasmo y las ganas de trabajar saben les da la opción de contar con el apoyo económico de la Fundación agrocapital.
texts.en:
The community bank named "Renacer de Vino Tinto" (the rebirth of Vino Tinto) is made up of twelve members who, for the most part, live in the Vino Tinto zone, from where they get their name.The members of the group are mainly seamstresses and blanket weavers, but they are also dedicated to selling groceries in neighborhood shops, as well as food and produce in the market. The need a loan in order to purchase raw materials and tools such as fabric, thread and wool in order to improve their earnings. The members' market is highly competitive since a majority of people from the area are dedicated to the same job. They need financing in order to provide better quality products and increase their earnings for the betterment of their homes. Since, in general, they perform their work at home, they dedicate more time to their children and families, and the delivery of handsewn sweaters and textile clothing gives them the option to improve and grow their small businesses. This is a relatively new group that has little loan experience. However, with enthusiasm and the desire to work, they know they have the option of counting on the economic support of Agrocapital Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Villa Sol Group

texts.es:
el grupo se llama VILLA SOL esta integrado por 3 personas las cuales son muy unidos y muy amigos desde hace muchos años atras, ellos se llevan muy bien y han trabajado juntos siempre. se les caracteriza por ser un grupo muy unido y honesto.
las actividades que ellos realizan son las siguientes:
el sr. Margarito A. tiene 30 años de edad, el vive en union libre con la sra. Ingris Rudibel Lainez, quienes residen en la aldea del ZOPE Amapala, tiene 8 años de tener su negocio en el cual le va muy bien y le genera ingresos para el sustento de su hogar. el desea surtir mas su negocio para tener mejores ganancias.

la sra. Wendy Patricia F. tiene 35 años de edad, ella es residente de la aldea Coyolito AMAPALA, esta casada con el sr. Juan Rivas Osorio que se dedica a la albañileria, tienen 4 hijos.
ella tiene una pulperia y necesita comprar mas producto para tenerla mas surtida, mas que todo necesita comprar refrescos y carnes.

la sra. Maria R. tiene 45 años de edad, esta casada con el sr. Jose Espinal, su esposo se dedica a la pezca artesanal, ella tiene una pulperia desde hace 2 años, necesita comprar manteca, jabon, azucar, agua.
todos ellos son muy buenas personas y tienen muchos deseos de salir adelante, ellos quieren lo mejor para su familia
texts.en:
The group called "Villa Sol" is made up of three people, who are very united and have been friends for many years. They get along well and have always worked together. They are characterized as being a united and honest group. The work that they perform is the following: Margarito A. is 30 years old. He lives with girlfriend Ingris Rudibel Lainez in the ZOPE Amapala village. He has had his business for eight years. It has been going well and generates income to support their home. He wishes to stock his business more in order to have better earnings. Wendy Patricia F. is 35 years old. She is a resident of the Coyolito AMAPALA village. She is married to Juan Rivas Osorio who is dedicated to masonry. They have four children. She has a grocery store and needs to buy more products in order to keep it stocked. More than anything, she needs to buy refreshments and meat. Maria R. is 45 years old. She is married to Jose Espinal. Her husband is dedicated to traditional fishing. She has owned a grocery store for two years. She needs to purchase lard, soap, sugar, and water. They are all good people who have a desire to get ahead. The want the best for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beans, tortillas, milk, pork, meat, soups, salsas, sugar, rice, corn, sodas, canned juices, water in bottles and bags, churros, jams, toothpaste, toilet paper, soap, detergent, pencils, spices, salt, eggs, cookies, bread.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Pioneras De Chijini De Rsr Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las pioneras D. Chijini rsr” esta conformado por doce socias que en su mayoría radican en la zona D. Alto chijini D. ahí es D. donD. surge el nombre del grupo. Una mayoría D. los socios se dedican a la confección D. prendas D. vestir, a la venta D. verduras, comida, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, pan y ollas. El mercado D. las socias es altamente competitivo por lo que requieren contar con capital D. trabajo para poder competir con mercadería D. mejor calidad y con herramientas y materiales e insumos que mejores e incrementen sus ingresos que ayudara a sus hogares a mejorar su calidad D. vida. El grupo se encuentra cursando su tercer ciclo por lo que cuenta con experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que demostraron responsabilidad y sobre todo ganas D. sacar adelante sus negocios para el bien estar D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The group "Las pioneras D. Chijini rsr" is maD. up of 12 members who, for the most part, live in the Alto Chijini zone, from where they get their name. A majority of the members are dedicated to making clothing, selling produce, food, groceries in neighborhood shops, bread and pots. The members' market is highly competitive which requires working capital to compete with better quality merchandise, tools and materials and inputs that improve their earnings and will help their homes to improve their quality of life. The group is in its third loan cycle which gives them experience and solidarity as a group that has demonstrated responsibility and, above all, the desire to push their businesses ahead for the well-being of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Karla Elizabeth

texts.es: La  Sra. Karla S., labora para la Fabrica de Muebles Alexandra, desde hace tres años, desempeñandose como Supervisora de Produccion, ella tiene 24 años de edad, esta casada y ya tiene dos niños, una esta en la Escuela y la otra tiene un mes de Nacida, su esposo trabaja como Tapicero,  juntos han logrado sacar adelante a sus hijas, en el lugar donde trabajan les permiten llevar sus hijos y así Karla puede trabajar y cuidar de ellos.  Tienen su propia casa muy pequeña pero comoda la cual han levantado con mucho esfuerzo, karla necesita el credito para poder construir el Baño sanitario y la Pila, el que actualmente usan ya esta muy dañado y el agua la tienen que guardar en recipientes plasticos. Karla es muy agradable y carismatica, muy educada y su sueño es ver crecer a sus hijos y poder apoyarlos con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Karla S. has worked for the Alexandra Furniture Factory for three years as a Production Supervisor. She is 24 years old, is married and already has two children: one is in school and the other is one-month old. Her husband works as an upholsterer. Together, they have been able to get their children ahead. Where they work, they are allowed to bring their children so Karla is able to work and take care of them. They have their own home, which is small but comfortable, which they have improved with a lot of effort. Karla needs a loan in order to build a bathroom and the foundation. What they currently use is very damaged and the water must be kept in plastic containers. Karla is likeable, charismatic and educated and her dream is to see her children grow and be able to support their education.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, bricks, sand, paint, and a toilet.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Las Conquistadoras Group

texts.es: El Grupo “Las Conquistadoras” esta conformado por doce socias que en su mayoría radican en la zona D. kiswaras y se encuentra representado por la señora Virginia. La mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la costura D. prendas D. vestir, elaboración D. prendas tejidas a mano y a la venta D. comida, abarrotes y repuestos para vehículos. La competencia en el rubro al cual se dedican es alta pero las socias saben como salir adelante con esfuerzo y ganas D. salir adelante. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. materia prima y herramientas que ayuden a realizar un producto terminado más atractivo para el mercado en la cual se desenvuelven. Las socias se encuentran cursando su quinto ciclo por lo que cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios y demostrando solidez, responsabilidad y ganas D. trabajar para brindarles a sus familias una mejor calida D. vida.
texts.en:
The "Las Conquistadoras" (the conquerors) group is maD. up of 12 partners that mainly live in the kiswaras region and is represented by Miss Virginia. Most of the partners are dedicated to sewing clothes, knitting hand maD. articles, and selling food, groceries and car parts. The competition in the sectors that they work in is hard but the partners know how to succeed with their will and effort. The use of the financing will be for the purchase of raw materials and tools that help them make a more attractive finished product for the markets where they compete. The partners are currently in their fifth cycle so they have experience in solidarity groups and they have shown they are solid, responsible and willing to work to proviD. their family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Fortaleza Rsr Group

texts.es: El grupo “Fortaleza RSR” esta  conformado por doce personas y representado por la señora Dominga que al igual que el resto del grupo radica en la zona D. San Nicolás. Una mayoría D. los miembros del grupo se dedica a comercio D. productos como verduras frescas, ropa, abarrotes y a la confección D. chompas tejidas a mano, matas y accesorios. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es elevada pero las socias tienen diferentes puntos D. venta en ferias y mercados locales con bajos precios por lo que cuentan con la experiencia para salir adelante. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. mercadería y materia prima que ayuD. a incrementar sus ingresos para mejor la calidad D. vida D. sus familias. A pesar D. ser su primer crédito con la institución la socias ya cuentan con experiencia en créditos grupales gracias a financiamientos D. instituciones financiera similares a al Fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The "Fortaleza RSR" group is maD. up of 12 people and represented by Ms. Dominga, who just as the rest of the group lives in the San Nicolas region. Most of the members of the group sell products such as fresh vegetables, clothes, groceries, the confection of hand knitted jumpers, and accessories. The competition in these spaces is high but the partners have different points of sale in fairs and local markets as well as low prices, so they have the experience to succeed. The use of the proceeds is to purchase articles and raw materials that will help increase their income to improve their families' quality of life. Despite this being their first loan with the institution, the partners already have experience with group loans from other financial institutions that are similar to Fundacion Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital
